The room itself was spacious with all working facilities and helpful staff. All that i really fault was that the curtains were a bit mouldy due to thw humidity and climate. The staff were very helpful and welcoming when we enter and lwave the hotel.

We arrived about 730am after all night flight from Melbourne with a 3 mth old baby. The staff were wonderful and as they had rooms that had been vacated, they arranged to have them cleaned first when cleaners arrived at 8am. We were all in our 2 rooms by 9am! The rooms were VERY spacious - we had 2 1 bedroom apartments on our first stay, and when we returned, we had a 2 bedroom apartment what was just as spacious and staff were every bit as friendly and helpful then too.

We were on the 10th floor in a deluxe room (We are smokers) and could not have expected the staff to be so totally awesome. We had a terrible experience with our flight (5 hour delay) and arrived a lot later than expected, my husbands card was not showing to work, but the gentleman at the front desk told us to go ahead and go to our room and get some sleep and we would figure it out the next morning. (which we did). Everyone there was always friendly, honest, (we left things out every day including computers and valuables and never worried) A perfect place for a decent price. Awesome location. Have already started planning our next trip and will definately stay here again. Thank you for a perfect week.

Noisy room, basic toiletries (only soap and shampoo), terrible pillows. The room and bathroom were moldy. I tried to have the room changed by the front desk, they did not help at all. A basic motel does better than this so called hotel. I was in a deluxe studio room but I would not call it deluxe. Very outdated dirty walls, curtains, noisy air conditioner. A disappointing experience. The Wi-Fi connection was very slow and constantly interrupted. Try looking around for a better, cleaner hotel. This is not the one!

I stayed here for a week in August 2016, in a "deluxe studio" room.The Ilima may only be rated as a 2.5-star hotel but the room amenities outshine those of many 4-star hotels while only costing half the price. You get a kitchen with a proper fridge, cooker, microwave oven, space to prepare food and a table to eat at. They even provide pans, plates, cutlery, etc.It may be a few minutes walk to the beach but its location in central Waikiki makes it convenient for restaurants, bars, shops and buses. So what if it doesn't offer an "ocean view"? Nobody comes to Hawaii to sit in their room all day looking out of the window.It may lack the historic grandeur of the Moana Surfrider or the legendary service of the Halekulani but it provides all the essentials for a great vacation at a fair price.Tip - although there are many convenience stores nearby such as the excellent Food Pantry, if catering on a budget you can save money by heading to the Safeway supermarket at 888 Kapahulu Ave, a 10-minute drive from the hotel or hop on the #13 bus southeast-bound on Kuhio which runs every 15 minutes. If you fancy a taste of authentic home-style Hawaiian cuisine pop in to Ono Hawaiian Foods, a few minutes walk from Safeway at 726 Kapahulu Ave. The Laulau Plate is worth the trip - but bring cash, they don't take plastic.

Room was clean and a nice size. Great view from the balcony! Local to beach, food and shopping. The immediate area isn't the greatest so I don't recommend leaving too late at night by yourself... But there's a pool and hot tub that looked fairly clean. It's free parking but make sure you talk to the staff and get something to place on the dash or you might get towed.

Hotel was booked for us by TripMasters. We stayed overnight, in order to catch flight to Maui next day. It is located in busy part of Honolulu and walking distance to Waikiki Beach. Easy check-in, staff was friendly. Above rate paid to TripMaster, we paid an additional $15.00 "resort fee". We had been warned that most hotels now charge such a fee. I guess it's sounds least expensive than adding it to cost of the room. Rooms were large and accommodating. Had kitchen facility, but we didn't prepare any food. Room was clean and comfortable. I would have considered staying there additional days, if our plans had not limited us to overnight. Well satisfied with choice

My friends and I came to Honolulu and stayed at a different hotel for the first 3 nights. As soon as we walked in everything was wrong. There were 4 of us with 2 single beds and 2 cots because our pull out queen bed was broken. Our keys kept getting deactivated and it just seemed like they didn't know much information on anything. Moving on..........after our stay there we moved over to the Ilima Hotel and let me tell you something, we were so HAPPY with the change!!! The beds were comfortable and we enjoyed the open concept room. Our friends couldn't find street parking to come over for dinner and the staff were kind enough to lend them a parking pass for a couple of hours. Wifi and view of golf course was great and the free parking was an awesome bonus, the sundecks on the 10th and penthouse floor were amazing and I luved the quietness of it too, but also about a 5 minute walk to the beach. I spent every morning on my balcony at 6:45a.m watching the sun come up. Gorgeous view!! The staff were very kind and always greeted us when passing by. I also introduced myself to Courtni, with whom I've been in correspondence with before arriving and she was wonderful. ALL the staff were wonderful. Don't ever change!!! I will def stay here again and will def recommend your hotel.

We were only spending one night before starting our cruise so we didn't need anything fancy or expensive. The hotel has some age on it to be sure which felt a little odd for such a large structure. Our room was surprisingly large compared to most modern hotels. The kitchenette was a nice convenience but had the feel of a cabin-in-the-woods type kitchen with the old mini electric stove and very old cabinets but everything worked. It was also interesting that each room has a consumer type window AC unit retrofitted into the old louvered windows on the sides of the sliding glass door to the large balcony. It took the AC a while to cool the big room and while the balcony is a nice size, the roaring AC unit in the corner robs from relaxing and enjoying the view a bit. The bed was big and comfortable, the bathroom was clean with plenty of water pressure and hot water. The neighborhood was no worse than what I've dealt with elsewhere but I could see where it might make some a little uncomfortable. The walk to Waikiki Beach wasn't bad and there was a McDonalds about two blocks away where we like to go for breakfast. We walked or used Lyft to get around so I didn't have to deal with parking. Other people mentioned the elevators being slow which they were but not to the point of inconvenience. Staff was very friendly. Overall, I'd say our needs were adequately met.

This hotel is dated and tired, but the rooms and lobby are kept very clean. The rooms are very spacious and the beds reasonable. The staff are very friendly and always happy to help.The swimming pool is on the small size, but when you are as close as you are to Waikiki beach, who needs a swimming pool right!The location is a 2 minute walk to bus stops and only a short walk to Waikiki beach, and shops.The only down side is there is no restaurant, however there are cooking options in the rooms.Would I go back? Yes I would. The price and location are great, which leaves more money to do the fun stuff!!!

The Ilima was a more affordable option compared to the hotels closer to Waikiki. It was okay - pretty dated but mostly clean. I gave it 3 stars for a couple of reasons: Firstly, I was told I had paid in full before arriving and was hit with a $15 a day amenities fee. This was not in any correspondence I received. I was told this was for the WiFi and the tea and coffee. How I am charged for the 'free' WiFi they advertise is a puzzle to me, especially when the connection dropped out every few minutes. Secondly, the parking is a bit of a nightmare. There was a couple of spare parks, but inconsiderate parkers had put their car into two spaces with no other parks being free. I know this isn't the hotels fault. What is, though, is when we told the male desk attendant who was checking the car parking tags and his reply was, 'Well, if you hadn't already parked I would probably try to do something'. I thought this was pretty poor form considering he had just watched my husband struggle into the park for 5 minutes, could see the other car well over the line and watched my husband have to get out of the car through the passenger door, not to mention there was another car there over 2 car parks. They have everyone's registration and room number. On a positive note, the mountain view from our room was lovely and most of the hotel staff were very friendly. The desk staff when we checked in and the male attendant were all pretty ordinary. Overall, the hotel was okay for the price we paid and compared to the cost of other hotels but I really hate being hit with additional fees upon check in. I would have been even more ticked off if we hadn't been able to get a park because of the careless attitude of the desk attendant.

The room was tired and dated but clean and spacious. You get what you pay for. The location was good as it was a quick walk to the main area but far enough away to be less busy and quiet. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The pool was not very appealing but the beach is not far away.

Loved this hotel clean big rooms just like a apartment full kitchen even thought it said kitchenette, staff was great, is located near the canal, but is just a couple of blocks near Waikiki beach and the Main Street where all the action takes place, it has a pool, parking space, near bus stop. I recommend it. Near the restaurant supermarket convenience store, and a bar, locals hang around this bar, it's not next to the hotel it's at the beginning of the street Nohonani and I've walked around and no one has ever disrespected me or my famalily. If you visit Oahu on April you'll find good rates.

We are definitely staying in this hotel again when we come back to Hawaii! The position suited us very well - just off the Ala Wai Blvd, a block away from the seething crowd of beachside hotels and the bustling Kalakaua Ave, our room overlooked the Ala Wai canal and golf course and had a fantastic postcard view of the hillside and Manoa valley. No huge buildings blocking our sight, the view of the lights on the hillside at night was simply magical. And the breeze, oh the breeze, it's probably one of our best memories of Hawaii - so lovely and cooling, we never had to use the airconditioning at all, and we could dry our our swimming gear easily on the balcony. This hotel may not be everyone's cup of tea especially those who want posh and plush hotels with designer toiletries and fancy accoutrements - and pay the exorbitant rates for it! This hotel is small and has an old, lived-in feeling and the charm, decor and ambience of a 60's style hotel, complete with pink carpets, bamboo chairs and wooden kitchen cupboards - it's certainly got character!We had a deluxe studio on the 15th floor and boy, it was huge! We have been to so many hotels all over the world and this one was definitely the most spacious we've stayed in. It had a king size bed and a double bed and a large open lounge area where we could spread out. And then of course, a fully equipped kitchenette with a big fridge, microwave, filter coffee maker, toaster and a full size electric stove (4 cooking rings and an oven). We even had a small dining table with chairs. These were all a godsend as we could start our day at a relaxed pace, eating breakfast at leisure (and knowing that we didn't have to fork out for a hotel buffet breakfast which are often too much and of poor value or walk the streets to find a cafe serving decent food). We saved heaps (and probably ate healthier) by going to the Food Pantry in the next block to stock up on fruits and yoghurts. The wifi signal in our room was consistently strong which meant we could regularly check our emails and even chat to our kids across the world. There is also a self-serve laundry on Level 3, full size washers and driers and good value at $2.50 a load. And oh, did I mention how comfortable the beds were? With the breeze, the view and a comfy bed, my husband said "this place is just perfect for relaxing!" - exactly what a holiday is all about! I must also mention how nice all the staff were in this hotel. I was bowled over by their friendly disposition, we were welcomed like old friends and in the end, like family. The ladies in the front office: Emily and Remy, deserve bouquets for accommodating our simple requests, nothing is too hard, all accomplished with a smile. Overall, when it comes to value, location, service and comfort, I'd say this hotel ticks all the boxes, I'd recommend it to many except that it may get too popular that it won't have room for us the next time. I really hope it doesn't change, this is just my kind of hotel.(I was delighted to discover that this hotel is just a 4-minute walk around the corner to Ross Dress for Less, my idea of fashion shopping heaven, cheap and cheerful!).

Even though the decor is dated we had a lovely stay. Staff were super friendly and anything we asked they obliged with a smile.Great location, short walk to main shopping area & lots of places to eat near by.

The Ilima Hotel is becoming a little dated, but still a nice place to stay. It has free parking, something that is very rare in Hawaii. Our room was clean and comfortable. This hotel is in walking distance to many shops and Waikiki beach.

The Ilima is a friendly budget hotel with generous family rooms and a good kitchen for cooking breakfasts or dinner. Theres' a decent sized balcony but ours too windy and blocked in by buildings to enjoy - so ask for a room on floor 8 or above. There's a tiny pool on the ground floor and a seperate sun deck on a higher level (but why sit there when you have the beach!) It is set 3 blocks back from the Royal Hawaiian with the canal right behind - which is good for running along in the mornings. It is only about 5 mins walk to the beach but the street has a few low-rate hotels in it so is a bit shabby and you have to walk through the Holiday Inn alleyway - or Duke's open marketplace (cheap trinkets) to get to and from the beach. It is close to a v popular Japanese restaurant and Hola Hola mini market which is handy. Waikiki is very crowded and expensive so this place is a good find to save a bit of money and get away from the crowds. Ask for a room above level 8 (there's 16 floors) as we were on level 4 and stared at car parks and shabby buildings. It is clean and serviced daily so would recommend for those planning to spend most of their time on the beach or out shopping!

We stayed in the Ilima with our adult son for the first week of our 4 week holiday in Hawaii. It was a very good start.The hotel is very quiet and our room overlooked the ala wai canal and golf course, but is only two blocks from central Waikiki - perfect position.The hotel is not flashy but very comfortable. A big plus is free parking and we always found an empty bay. Laundry facilities onsite were always available when we wanted to use them and only $2.50 each for washer and dryer plus $1 for powder.A full size fridge and cooking facilities in the room were welcome and well used in our stay. The wifi had good reception and the cable TV kept us entertained at night.The pool isn't overly big and is located at the rear of the hotel and mostly in shade. We found it to be a bit cool when breezy in the afternoon to swim, but I'm sure kids would still love it.The beds were very comfortable and the room was very clean and well serviced. Staff were friendly and helpful.The only issue we had was with the sliding door to the lanai which could not be fully shut and locked. The front desk said they would arrange for housekeeping to check it but we heard no more about it - so it stayed unlocked during our stay. Fortunately we were on floor 16 and the evil Spider-Man didn't come calling!!!It was a bit pricier than previous stays in Waikiki (left it later than usual to book) but considering the benefits was still good value for us. We would stay here again.

The hotel looks like it hasn't been updated since maybe the 1960s. The beds felt clean which is more than I can say for the elevator - it had old gross carpeting on the walls. Our room had a balcony which was nice. Also it had a kitchen. The hotel also offers free parking but be aware that there are a limited number of spots. When we checked in we got the last one. Also, the spots are super tiny. Anything bigger than a Honda civic and I don't think you'll fit in any of the spaces. The hotel is a bout a ten min walk to the beach and it it about a 5 min walk away from a grocery store.

Shaun who was working the front desk on June 16th was very helpful and friendly. The hotel is very nice and a great location. Beyond all, I can recommend the hotel from the great and friendly service we had.

We've visited Honolulu 4 times and we always stay at Ilima. Over the years I've gotten to know Courtney who handles the bookings and she always comes thru with a great room for us. This time we ended up on the 15th floor with a great view over the canal. They offer free parking, free wifi and the rooms are large and spacious with 2 beds and a kitchenette. It's walking distance to the beach and many restaurants and shops. I can't fault Ilima or it's staff. Everyone is very friendly and helpful.

Excellent location, close to the beach and many high profile shops by walking a short distance. Good restaurants to eat nearby and you don't even need to take your car, except when you want to reach touristic locations such as Pearl Harbor

We have stayed here three times as we find the location great. This hotel has dared decor but has a full kitchen so great for self catering. The staff are very helpful and there is a laundry you can use for $2.50. It is a two block walk to the beach and as the hotel is not on a main road there is not so much noise. We were on the 16th floor on the ocean side and so we could see the ocean between the buildings( but not the beach) and the fireworks on Friday night. You can store luggage here if you are going to another island and do not want to take all your luggage with you.the beds were very comfortable.has free wifi.

Great room with 2 double beds, ensuite, kitchenette, airconditioner.Lovely decor. Fantastic staff and management. Close to shops, restaurants and transport. Heated pool. Laundry facilities. Daily room service.

Iam here in the ilima hotel but i want to write a review because we r having a wonderfull time....room 807 just saw the hilton fireworks on our balcony on a saturday night not friday n the staff makes us feel so welcome n our room is cute with our little kitchen we have not use it just the fridge for our milk n cereal n fruit n they provide plates n free parking as our car has taken us all over the island ..truly having a wonderfull time here ... :) ...

Stayed at the Ilima in May 2016 with my family of 6 we had a 2 bedroom apartment, it was a good size with a kitchen. Great location just a short walk to the beach, there is s laundry on the 3 rd floor plenty of machines 2.50 US for s load staff are very friendly we would stay there again, hotel is a bit dated however very clean.

Hotels in Waikiki have become expensive but the Ilima is still a good deal if you don’t need an ocean view or trendy modern decor. Although the rooms may seem a little dated, they are well maintained, clean, comfortable and very spacious. They also include a full kitchen. As concerns the view, the best bet is to opt for an upper floor mauka view. These rooms have lovely views of the Ala Wai Canal and the mountains, which you can enjoy from the spacious balcony. Hotel staff members are helpful and friendly.From the hotel, it is only a short walk to the beach and an even shorter walk to the stop for the bus into downtown Honolulu.

This is clearly not the most luxurious accommodation option in Waikiki - it's quite dated and a couple of blocks from the beach. However, if you get your head around these facts and compare the rates with other establishments newer/nearer it really starts to look like a good deal!We had no problem with the location. Everything is easily walkable (Waikiki has very good pedestrian facilities). 10 mins to the beach, 5 to the nearest mall and 2 around the corner to the nearest restaurant. Bus stops to/from Honolulu are a minute away.Yes, it is dated, but not in any way dirty. It was actually quite fitting with the tiki-tacky atmosphere of Waikiki anyway! Pink wallpaper, bamboo furniture etc. Our room was enormous with 2 beds, a kitchenette and a balcony (and I had booked the cheapest option). Our previous lodgings had no hot water, so we really appreciated a proper shower! Only problem was the ancient a/c, which was oddly at floor level on a corner of the room and didn't really do much but make noise.Overall we had a positive experience. The service was lovely. I read from some previous reviews that this is one of the only remaining independent local hotels and you could really feel that.Yes, it could be so much nicer, but unless you intend to not step outside your room and/or have piles of extra money lying around, it's a solid choice!

Stayed one night before cruise. We were upgraded to 14th floor and on the side of the hotel overlooking the canal and golf course so was a quiet night. Room Large with double and king beds. Furnishings were a bit outdated but room very clean. Kitchenette in room but we did not use.

We were given a large bachelor room overlooking the canal with double queen bed with full kitchenette and upright fridge. The room was clean, and not bad for the price.The front desk staff very friendly and accommodating.The only real issue was with bugs in the kitchenette area of the room. It took several days before the pesky little uninvited guests were finally gone.The location is decent with many restaurants nearby including ABC and Food Pantry.For beach lovers you are at least a 10 minute walk away.The small outdoor pool is very well shaded and the water is on the cool side. Would we recommend this establishment: sure, it's not badWould we return to this establishment: No, we would explore other options.

This place needs to be torn down or MAJORLY renovated. We booked this hotel for 6 nights primarily because it did not have a daily parking fee and the reviews on Trip Advisor seemed favorable for the most part. At first glance, the exterior is looking a bit rundown but nostalgic looking. The lobby was pleasant and the lady who checked us in was very friendly, however she was unable to accommodate my request for a canal facing room on a higher floor. Based on reviews on this site, we weren't expecting a 5-star hotel. However, upon entering our "superior studio suite" it was obvious that this property had not been updated in decades. I don't even know where to begin! The cupboards and cabinetry were so old I think my Grandfather had the same ones in his garage for tools. The stove was straight out of the 1960's with tinfoil under the burners. There was a single sink and small counter with chips in the top. The carpet/linoleum was worn and stained. The bathroom did not have a vanity - just a skinny metal shelf above a pedestal sink. The furniture was dated and worn. There was a newer flat screen television but it was only maybe a 32". In one corner, there was an old safe with a sign taped to it that said "Do not use - there is another safe in the closet". There were three "deadbolts" on the door - none of which worked properly. The bright pink and peeling balcony contained two plastic chairs and overlooked what appeared to be the "ghetto: of Waikiki. Our view consisted of low income rental properties and their balconies loaded with junk and laundry hanging on railings. We observed a dude scratching his belly and sorting his bottles. The air conditioning unit had moldy foam stuffed around it. To top it all off, the distinct smell of pot wafted through the ventilation system at one point. That was the icing on the cake for us! After not being able to access their free wi-fi and having to phone the local internet provider to remedy this problem, we were able to secure another room at a much better property (4.5 star) with a view of the ocean and Diamond Head and overlooking a beautiful park for the same price per night!! Yes, we did have to pay a daily parking fee at the new property but it was so worth it in the end. We never would have enjoyed a minute had we stayed at the Ilima! The front desk lady at the Ilima was very nice when we explained we were not going to be staying. She was apologetic but unfortunately there was nothing she could have done to entice us to stay. It was that bad! In the end, we were charged for one night as well as a day of their "resort fee" to cancel but we did not care. My suggestion to anyone looking to stay in Waikiki area is to really do your homework. It is an expensive destination and most hotels do charge for parking. However, room rates in better properties can be comparable and sometimes even cheaper than the Ilima. Do not try to cut corners to avoid paying the parking at a better place - it is not worth your peace of mind and will make for a much more comfortable and enjoyable vacation in the end.

A wonderful stay at Ilima Hotel, a great staff who were always very friendly and helpful. Always a smile coming or going. Two blocks from the beach and close to grocery store and whatever else you need. Free parking.......a definite perk!!! Rooms are very clean....so what if they're a little dated. Slept great at night with room balcony door open. Great stay and getting married out on the beach in Hawaii Kai was the highlight of this trip!!! Upon returning to Oahu, I would definitely stay back here in a heart beat. Thanks again to the wonderful staff and a very big ALOHA :)

Have been to Hawaii 44 times and have used this hotel each and every time. The service by staff is truly amazing and you are made to feel like part of the Ilima family. Would highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed 10 days at this hotel, we had a big room overlooking the canal and golf course, with a nice balcony, was good to have open windows to let the breeze through, was happy with the kitchen full size fridge and plenty of room to cook meals if needed. The beds were very comfortable, and had plenty of towels in the bathroom. The hotel is 2 blocks away from the beach, and found a food pantry supermarket not far from hotel, Staff friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay there again.

Very smooth & friendly check in with Shaun . Room is huge ! Full kitchen , big balcony , cool breeze . Sleeps 6 not counting the couch or floor . Big living room seats 8 , 4 more seats off kitchen . Got snacks from the store 2 doors down & cant wait to check out the rest of the place . This is our new favorite !

What a great place to stay and relax,we had a lovely big open room with a kitchenette which we utilised every day.Fabulous staff who made you feel a part of their ohana,great treats of nut and shell necklace making and beautiful hawaiian songs performed by the staff.Only a short walk to the beautiful Waikiki Beach and shops,restaurant,Food Pantry,buses,transport,etc.We loved the Ilima and hope to visit again,lovely clean and welcoming.

I stayed at the Ilima for a week recently and had all positive experiences. The Waikiki location is great, very central but not in the loudest parts of Waikiki. The staff was always very friendly, warm and ready to assist. The room was well-sized for Waikiki and equipped with a kitchen. When checking out I was given a shell lei which was a nice touch. I would definitely stay here again.

This was my second stay at the Ilima and it was as good as the first. The rooms are large and the kitchenettes are well stocked. The pool is small but perfect for a nice dip. The sun deck has beautiful views. We loved relaxing on our deck with beverages after the toddlers were in bed. The staff is lovely and very accommodating. Because some of our family was moving to the mainland at the end of our stay, we had to rearrange our visit several times and the staff was so pleasant and helpful. The parking is a huge bonus as well. I have recommended this hotel and another part of our family is enjoying it now!

Stayed here for 3 nights before heading up to the North Shore. It is a bit dated and in need of TLC but hotels in this area are very expensive and for the money it is a great location with spacious rooms and kitchen facilities. There is a supermarket a few minutes walk away if you prefer to cook your own meals.Staff were friendly and helpful and provided beach towels for us to take out. If you are on a budget it gives a great opportunity to walk to Waikiki beach and the shops without costing the earth.

A little dated but very clean. Reasonable prices, close to the beach and tons of shopping. STAFF are excellent to deal with. Very friendly and helpful. This hotel is on my list for a return next year for a longer visit.

We stayed here for three nights before heading to some other islands and really enjoyed ourselves. The place is super cool and retro, with massive clean rooms with balconies and nice views. Staff were very friendly, and the price was amongst the best in Waikiki, especially for us with the weakened Australian dollar. On top of that there is free parking, and a short walk to restaurants, bars and the beach. Would recommend and would stay here again!

Stayed here for a week in December and thoroughly enjoyed it! The staff were so friendly, room was clean, solid wifi, lots of towels, activities in the lobby and they gave shell lei's as a parting gift. A very pleasant stay!

The Ilima Hotel is one of the few mid- priced hotels left in Waikiki! This was our first time staying at the Ilima and we were warmly greeted upon arrival. The rooms are quite spacious with a small kitchenette. The décor could use freshening up, but honestly, who is in their room long enough to worry about the décor. The swimming pool is quite small, but works well with young children. All rooms have a lanai and their own hot water tank. It is located between Kuhio and the Ala Wai Canal. Conveniently located across the street is an Enterprise car rental. Down the street on Kuhio is the Food Pantry grocery store. The Bus stops are just steps away on Kuhio The Ilima is one of the few hotels offering a touch of Hawaiiana. Guests can sign up for lei-making, listening to the hotel staff sing Hawaiian songs in lobby on Fridays, and offering complimentary parking. There are complimentary beach mats and beach towels for your day on the beach. The only criticism would be that the rooms are usually made up much later in the afternoon. Upon checkout, a complimentary shell lei was placed on us by one of the hotel desk staff. We would definitely return to the Ilima Hotel, as guests are made to feel like Ohana.

We stayed for 16 days in a high level one bedroom this christmas.The premises and rooms might be a bit dated. However everything clean. Bed great.The room had 2 ac quiet wall ac units.Quiet. Kitchen helps save a lot.A couple of BBQs in the pool area would help.Location not far from the beach.Parking included, found a spot every day.Staff so friendly and helpful.Would recommend caution around the local bar.However with renos at the outrigger, the new international market, ritz a couple of blocks away should improve the neighborhood.Great free wifi.Don't change a thing we will back.Aloha.

We had a great stay at this hotel. We had a room with a mountain view on level 11 with a superb balcony. The rooms are very spacious and very clean. The hotel is a little tired however it's very clean and excellent value for money. All staff are excellent and went out of their way to make our stay more enjoyable. We would highly recommend this hotel to families visiting Honolulu

This hotel is one of the few left still owned by native Hawaiians. It is clean, comfortable, spacious, and offers free parking (which is unheard of in Waikiki). It's a bit no frills, but there is a kitchenette if you are there for a longer stay. There was a great balcony where we enjoyed our coffee in the morning. The location is near shopping and within a 10 minute drive of many resorts. We were in 806, directly a roses from the elevator, and were never troubled by noise. They have a pool that just opened back up, which we did not check out.When comparing rates- go to their website. It's was massively cheaper to book with them directly.

My family of four stayed here for 1 night. The location is fairly convenient, close to F&B establishments. There's nothing fancy about it, just the basics you will need. The room I stayed in came with a small kitchenette, with utensils provided. There was air-conditioning, and the beds were comfortable enough. The entire place did look a bit worn though.One very good plus point - parking at the hotel is free, subject to availability as there are not many lots. I understand that this is a rarity in Honolulu.

Location is great closer to the canal end and near the Pantry, they film parts of Hawaii 5o at the hotel next door which is value, nice mountain views and partial ocean view. Great verandahs, large rooms and cooking facilities.There are also a lot of great restaurants close, Ross Dress for Less is just down the road and to top it all off the staff are fantastic.

This is our 5th time to Waikiki and the 3rd time we have stayed at this hotel and I am sorry to say it is really starting to look a little tired now. Staff are excellent and courteous, the room was very spacious, neat and clean, and had two queen beds but the whole building really needs a refurbishment. It would be a 3 star Hotel, at best. Amenities and utensils in the kitchen are bare minimum, with no wine glasses provided. No cork screw and one sharp carving knife that was broken isn't really enough to get you by. The position of the hotel is fabulous in down town Waikiki and is convenient to everything, and they provide choir singing on a Friday and a necklace making course, which is really nice. But a renovation to bring it up to a level with some other hotels in the area is required. With all the new developments going on around Waikiki, there are better choices around for the same cost, if not cheaper.

This smaller hotel was a home away from home. We had a large room with a kitchenette. One king and one double bed. It is a dated hotel but very clean and had everything we needed on site. Bonus, the only hotel with free parking. We were within walking distance to the beach, shopping, smaller grocery stores. One side of the hotel is facing the canal and golf course. The staff was amazingly helpful and friendly. Since I am a smoker, I was permitted to smoke in the room and balcony but only smoked outside. They have other non smoking rooms as well. Pricing was reasonable compared to the big box name hotels on the beach. I highly recommend this hotel. Honolulu is expensive and this helped with the budget. Thank you Ilima Staff!

Large comfortable room with kitchen facilities. Very clean. We had a lovely view towards the canal, golf course & mountains. Only a short 10 min walk down to main beach & hotel has towels available for use on beach, although I would recommend grabbing 2 towels per person as they are really small! Small pool available for guests but it was nice to refresh in if you didn't feel like the stroll. Staff very courteous and helpful. Room was a little dated but we had no issue with that. If you want somewhere that you can cook a quick meal and be a little self sufficient definitely a good place to stay. Supermarket just 2 blocks walk so no problems getting supplies. Would definitely recommend.

This is a very affordable hotel 2 blocks from Waikiki beach. Rooms are large, with kitchen and balcony, it is clean, but comfortably dated with no onsite food/services. As long as you have this expectation, it is a great value, also has free onsite parking. Staff was very nice and patient with giving directions to beach, restaurants, local attractions.

Ok, and Aloha from Honolulu. The Ilima Hotel and Studio Suites is the perfect vacation spot for small groups or families in Honolulu. The suites are HUGE, and half the price of anything else in the neighborhood. Clean, well-equipped kitchens and perfect views of the Canal, Mountains and Golf Course give you the feeling you're living the life of luxury. Just a little older than some of the newer super-hotels, The Ilima , pronounced (ilima) is very well maintained and managed, offering a laid-back atmosphere unlike a tourist hotel, where everyone seems to be in a hurry. If you're looking for a Honolulu Life-Style Stay, I highly recommend this place Try it and like myself, you'll just want to move in and stay forever. Ken Forsberg I.T.W.P.A. Bye the way - Surf's Up at Waikiki!

I only stayed 1 night as I has prebooked Island Colony over the road for 9 nights. The Hotel was great and I was able to checkin at 7.45am due to efforts of Karen in back office. The room was good and the staff were excellent providing good travel tips. I will stay here next visit and NOT over the road.

We've stayed here before, and this is still a great place. This isn't for you if you want a full service hotel, but if you want rooms with a lot of space in the rooms, cooking facilities and really genuinely friendly staff who go the extra mile - this is it.The hotel is situated away from the beach but is an easy walk if that's what you're after - beach maps and towels can be picked up at reception as you head out. The Ala Wai canal is just around the corner and is a calm strip of water frequented by canoes and kayaks. Our room had a superb view of this and the mountains beyond.There's a small (but expensive) supermarket a couple of blocks away. Other food options nearby have become a bit limited with the closure of the food court at the nearby International Marketplace, but there's still choice.In the room (deluxe studio) you get a king and double bed, table, wardrobe space, drawers, hob and oven, microwave, coffee maker (with daily supply of coffee), toaster. Furniture has in places seen better days, but is fully functional. The beds were great.The room had air conditioning, but we found it better to simply leave the door to the balcony open - quieter and usually driving a breeze through the room. Wifi is free, as is a daily local paper.There's a small outoor pool if you need to cool off.All in all, recommended and I'll be staying again.

I organised a large party to stay at the Ilima, and from every email sent back and forth with my million questions Courtni was exceptionally friendly and helpful.Yes the hotel is dated and could use a few touch ups but the spaciousness of the rooms, coupled with a full kitchen makes travelling with a toddler very easy. The pool is private and quiet and a great place to relax - sun decks on a higher floor looking out gives you a fab view while working on your tan, and having a laundry room was great!Its not far from the beach but tucked away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki which was nice, and we even got to see Hawaii 50 being filmed next door. I would stay here again and hope to soon!

Booked in hotel 26th October 2015 for 6 nights with 11 friends , if you want 5 star pay 5 star prices down on the beach if you want good value for money come here. Rooms are good maid service every day with clean towels, very spacious very clean comfortable beds iron with board with enough room to leave up. 2 blocks from beach and close to everything you want, Honolulu tavern in same street more of a locals bar than tourist and had bad review but it's full of characters and all welcoming and friendly try it, would defiantly return here everything on hand

Recently stayed 6 nights in a Deluxe Studio room on the 15th floor. We arrived early on the first day and reception were able to put us straight into the room. Great after an overnight flight. The room was large, clean and comfortable and quiet. Even better, the beds were very comfortable. Very close to all amenities, restaurants, supermarkets etc. Reception staff always extremely helpful. Had a great stay. Would definitely recommend.

Room with kitchen and hotel close to everything, staff great. Very quick check in at US$182 its reasonable but it is accommodation only but lots of restaurants just around the corner try Atlantis at 2284 Kalakaua avenue. Aircon made clicking sounds so had to turn it off

We stayed here for one night as landed in Hawaii late at night but stayed with family for the rest of our stay.A good location as we ventured out to get some food but did have a kitchen area in our room A very lively place but quiet hotel with lots of rooms and some hotel parking available on first come first serve basis

Perfectly located less than 5 minutes walk from the heart of Waikiki and only a couple of blocks from the beach. It's location provides a relieving retreat from all the hustle and bustle which is only a stones throw away. Extremely large, well kept and serviced rooms which include Fridge, Stove, Microwave, Sink etc. Perfect for self catering. Large, furnished, private balcony with great views. Generally provides a homely feel which is difficult to achieve in any hotel environment. The staff were very accommodating and genuinely personable. It's "70's style" as someone put it, is what makes this place. We were there for 8 nights; it was faultless. Will definitely return should we visit Hawaii again and will definitely recommend the Ilima to family, friends, and associates.

If you are looking for a modern luxury hotel... well this isn't it. If you are looking for ocean views... nope. But, if you are looking for a nice hotel off the busy Waikiki beach tourist stream and prefer a basic room with lots of space and a full kitchen, then this is a great place to stay. My room looked out on the inlet/stream - golf course - mountains. The balcony was spacious and was the perfect place to sit back and relax. When I arrived, I noticed that some of the plaster near my room's door was pealing. The next day there was someone performing repairs. The property is definitely aging and could use a total renovation. But everything worked and I was completely comfortable for my entire stay. I did notice that the building turned into a flute when the winds started to blow as many of the windows in the public areas of the floor were open. The noise was not bothersome. The staff were all welcoming and friendly. The parking (very tight spots so get a small rental car!) was free. I booked well in advance and the rate was reasonable. They have a pool, but I didn't get to it. They also have coin operated laundry. The location makes it very easy to get out to Honolulu by car, or walk a couple of blocks to the beach. Everything was clean and tidy. They even give you a little dish soap to clean up after cooking. All in all a great value hotel.

I loved my two nights here 25-27SEP. Exuding 70s style, this hotel two plus blocks behind Waikiki Beach is nevertheless clearly well looked after. Similarly, every staffer was efficient and affable. And at the US one-sixty-ish per night I paid, Ilima seemed a bargain. The highlights for me: convenient mid-beach location, complimentary parking, firm bed, free & reliable WiFi and flat screen tv with a nice selection of channels. Others will appreciate the expansive room size and kitchen. I would return in a heartbeat!

This is no luxury accommodation but great for families as the two bedroom suites come with full kitchen and an extra bed in the living room. Simple yet comfortable stay in a great location. Highlight of the stay has to be the friendly and helpful staff, and the Friday afternoon choir.

This family run hotel is not the fancy or new kind, but it has a homey feel that made us glad to call it home base for our stay near Waikiki Beach. It's central location made walking to the beach or nearby shopping easy. The rooms were decorated in an outdated style, and a bit worn, but clean and large. The kitchen was stocked with all we needed for quick breakfast or sandwich. The one night we could not find a parking spot, an employee moved her car and gave us her spot.

We had a nice stay here. The room was large and clean. The parking was included in the price. It was walking distance to anything in Waikiki, but also far enough away from all the busyness to feel private. Nice balcony. Staff were very friendly- I appreciate that.

This accommodation whilst a bit dated was a perfect choice for our family vacation. The staff were friendly, the location is within walking distance to everything in Waikiki and I think it provides great value for money in comparison with other properties in the area.

This is an excellent value hotel. The decor is slightly dated but the rooms are huge. We had an ocean facing room and on Friday evening we could see the fireworks. The ocean facing rooms give you a view of the ocean in between the hotels that are on the waterfront.There is a food pantry store a few minutes walk away to get some basic food supplies but if you do not mind a 25 minute walk there is a large safeway supermarket that has everything you ever need. There are also straw beach mats that you can borrow each day from reception to use at the beach so your towels do not get covered in sand as well as beach towels. The staff are very helpful and there was no additional " resort fee" to cover the wifi that other hotels charge you as the wi fi was included in the price. The pool is on the ground floor and is not huge in size but most people go to the beach anyway so when we did use the pool we were the only ones. I would highly recommend this hotel as very handy to everything. The area was safe and each night we would walk back from the department stores that were open late each night with no problems. There is a popular bar a few doors around and also other eating places. You can leave your bags here after you check out and they will look after them for you.

Older hotel but large rooms with kitchen. Everything worked and room was clean with good maid service. Nice location only two blocks from the beach. Staff was friendly and helpful. Good value because parking was free and even with the small lot, we found parking every night.

Great location,easy access to beaches(5 minutes walk) night life & shopping.Free car parking & free wifi a real bonus.Excellent front of house staff & cleaning staff excellent.Quiet elevators.We were on the 14th floor,no city noises,so overall great hotel.

This hotel is somewhat dated and the rooms were not well maintained - a little grubby in the corners of the room and in the tracks of the sliding doors. It needs a good makeover. However, the accommodation is functional and with a fully equipped kitchen you can save on food by doing your own catering. Staff are friendly and obliging. We only stayed one night as we were on our way to Seattle from Australia. We were going to stay a further five nights at this hotel on our way back from the USA, but chose instead to stay at accommodation closer to the beech. Mind you we certainly paid a whole lot more. If you are seeking budget accommodation, this Hotel is worth considering.

Room was large with full sized kitchen. Furnishing are old school tropical. Location is excellent Waikiki - close to beach and away from the crowds. Friendly and helpful staff.This is one of the few Hawaiian owned hotel. Plenty of aloha. Free parking is a real bonus.

Most hotels in Waikaki are pricey. The hotel is reasonably priced and nice and clean. Our room had a nice balcony and a good view of the mountains. The room has a kitchen which was very helpful with our 8-month old daughter. The rooms are a bit dated. The parking is free but limited which is a big benefit in Waikaki. I did find parking on all days. Just a block away from Waikaki beach. The pool is very small.

Stayed one night. This is an older place. Reminds me of 60s quaint motel hotel. It is a friendly place. White and pink on outside. Tropical decor on inside. Rooms not much to speak of but clean. We had an efficiency which included a king and double bed and kitchenette. It was a large room with a nice lanai. Staff had a sing-a-long on saturday morning in lobby and I think have a Lei making class on another day. Pool area is small. This is a great place to stay on a budget.

Ok, I'll start with we stayed here because it was cheap! I needed something walking distance to the beach, two beds, and wasn't going to cost the world for a week.'Ilima was perfect!The rooms are HUGE! so you have heaps of room to spread out post a day at the beach or shopping. The full kitchen means you can save money on food and drinks and can pack picnics when you go to the beach.Being a girls' week away, we needed lots of mirrors - check, lots of towels - check, good water pressure to wash our hair - check, and plenty of hanging space - check. Added to this was the fantastic view from the balcony (lanai), the pool and sunbathing areas, loads of windows for natural light, plus lots of lights/lamps in the rooms.I had read some reviews that weren't too favourable, but seriously don't understand how anyone could not like this place. The decor is a bit dated, but this adds to the charm of a vacation, and everything was spotless with excellent housekeeping (I've stayed in supposedly better hotels and found them grotty).There is a car rental across the street. you are literally two minutes from the heart of the tourist district straight down Duke's Lane. There is a Food Pantry the next block over for stocking the kitchen, but the little 7/11 style shop two doors down is well stocked and cheap. There is a bar two doors down where the people were very friendly and respectful (I don't understand the negative comments I had read about the the neighbourhood, every night my girlfriend and I walked past the bar and not once were we heckled). And the kitchen had all the utensils, glasses, plates etc you could possibly need.But enough about the room, you go to Waikiki for the beach, sites and culture. Ilima has ample free beach towels and beach mats - you just grab fresh ones on your way out each day. The hotel is an easy walk to all the local beaches. There is a tour information desk in the lobby and the reception staff will bend over backwards to help you. There is ample undercover parking and a full guest laundry. I'd suggest saving the money on using the dryers and just hang your clothes on the balcony over night. The hotel offers guest events too, like singalongs and lei making. They also have a luggage scale so you don't get stung by fees at the airport.All in all, I was very impressed with the 'Ilima. I've stayed at other 'budget' hotels in Waikiki and this one is definitely the best. Considering the room size, full kitchen and excellent staff, I would rate 'Ilima above a lot of the more expensive four star hotels.Being Australian, I'm not so fussy about having a breakfast restaurant in the hotel. But I know my American friends are big on their breakfasts. Don't fear, if you don't want to use your own kitchen there is an IHOP down the street, a Starbucks on the corner, and hundreds of other excellent cheap breakfast option you can pick up on you way back from an early morning swim or run on the beach. I can recommend the Seaside Cafe for super cheap but good quality food.Oh, almost forgot, Good free wifi and no resort fees!!! And did I mention, the rooms are HUGE!Seriously, for the price, this place was great. It also has so much character - everyone knows the 'Ilima - "it's the pink one, right?" Getting a taxi back from a big day shopping or a big night out, all the drivers knew where to go!

This is a very practical choice for those who simply want to have a base hotel and plans to be out all day to explore the island or enjoy Waikiki beach (which is a short walk away). Sure it is a bit outdated but it is a good price for the location. Having a kitchen in the room is very convenient. The room is big and it was wonderful to wake up with the views of the canal and the golf course.What was very remarkable during our stay is their great customer service.After checking out,my husband realized that he misplaced his wedding band.We called the hotel and asked if they can double check the room for us.Somebody else was already staying in the room so they couldn't do a thorough search but as soon as the guest left,they moved furnitures to search for the ring and they found it! I could tell that the hotel staff worked together to make this happen. Thank you,Emmy,and everyone at Ilima who went the extra mile to assist us.We will stay here again the next time we visit!

My room on the 14th floor (which was actually the 13th floor) was equipped with a king bed, a queen bed and a kitchenette. It had a beautiful view of the mountains. It was quite spacious, but a bit outdated, but clean. It has all the amenities for long term stay. There is a self service laundry on the 3rd floor.Parking is free on a first come, first served basis. There are not enough parking spaces if all the gests have a car. Plus, the spaces are very tight, so if you have anything larger than a Smart car, you will have a tight squeeze.The Wi-Fi is free and worked very well - even on an upper floor. There is a very small pool and a tiny fitness center. I think there were two pieces of equipment. Better to get your exercise walking on the beach, which is a few blocks away. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I will definitely return.

We stayed at the Ilima Hotel in June (2 nights, Room 1402) August 2015 (4 nights Room 1202) on our way to and from home, Australia. Had a corner room each time. All staff at reception and service staff really lovely. Both rooms are getting old but very clean, quiet and quite large. We had a king and double bed in our room. Our bed was super comfy and loved my pillow. Loved having a kitchen, has a good sized refrigerator, full stove and microwave, coffee machine. Yes the crockery is a bit of a miss match, but so what, it does the job. Good sized wardrobe and set 6 drawers. Plus a cupboard with shelves so quite a bit of storage for your clothes.. There is a desk in the room. And how good 2 suitcase stands. The laundry ($1.25) was great. Was so nice after a big day out have a swim in the pool, (it isn't a huge pool but more than adequate) then relax on our balcony (lanai) with a cool drink overlooking the canal and golf course.There is a great grocery store about 1 block away, called the Food Pantry. (Kuhio Avenue) They sell everything (we bought a BBQ chicken one night $8.99) and well priced. They also sell alcohol which was handy. A huge department store called Ross Dress for Less (Seaside Street) is just around the corner, wow never seen so many clothes for sale, including many brand named clothes, very good prices, they also sell suitcases and other bits and pieces, This hotel is a couple blocks from the beach but a very easy walk. We were given a lovely shell necklace on departure. For the price this hotel was a perfect choice, walking distance to many necessary things to make your holiday easy, would certainly recommend.

Our room on the 11th floor had a view of the beach through the other newer hotels, nice balcony on beach side, good AC, and wifi, comfortable beds and very useful kitchenette ,Very clean,Staff were helpful Car park was small but freeWe have now stayed there twice

My wife and I stayed for 3 weeks on the 16th floor and we really loved the accommodation they provide. OK it's not super flash but it just felt like being at home. It was very clean and our lovely cleaning maid Sovanna was just incredible. She was so obliging and friendly and always ready for a good chat. We had a lovely view out over the city and out to the Pacific Ocean. The sun came flooding into our room and lanai in the afternoon and this made bar time extra special. The foyer staff were so friendly and helpful as well. The pool area was small but we spent hours there. With a full kitchen and refrigerator we only dined out once as supplies from the Food Pantry nearby made this easy. We will be returning to this hotel for sure.

I had a sinking feeling when we drove into the check-in bay at the Ilima Hotel. My first thought was "this is a dump", but, I was mistaken. Yes, the decor was dated, but, the room was clean and the bed was comfortable, and that was what matters most to me. We had a corner room, and although there was some late night pool noise from the hotel next door, we still left our large balcony doors open to enjoy the fresh air and city noise all night! (I did get up in the early morning to shut the door and turn on the a/c - I never sleep soundly.) Our room also faced the canal and golf course, which, was actually a very decent view. We walked and jogged on the sidewalk beside the canal. We guessed it was approx. 2 miles round trip. The Illima was also a short walking distance to the only two places we dined in Honolulu, Dukes (breakfast buffet) and Hula Grill (mac nut crusted Mahi Mahi, Hula Pie), which I can highly recommended. There were street vendors along the route we took to the restaurants, reminded me of Nassau marketplace. We parked in the provided hotel parking - very tight fit.

Stumbled onto this moderately priced establishment while googling "free parking" for Waikiki hotels.Glad I did. Room was very spacious and spic and span. Only complaint is that the air conditioner was kind of noisy and don't really understand why they charge a fee for using the room safe. Location was perfect - an easy stroll to the main drag. Wifi in the room was excellent, capable of streaming Neflix. Stayed two nights and easily found parking spaces in the hotel's small garage, but that might just have been luck. Very friendly front desk and you get a lei on check-out. That was a nice touch. Didn't need a kitchen, but fridge came in handy for cold drinks. Came away feeling I got a bargain, and would happily stay at the Ilima again.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Ilima Hotel.Great sized rooms and very friendly staff make the stay fun.Rooms a little dated but the comfortable beds and large rooms make up for it.Kitchenettes also very handy.Close to restaurants and the beach and an easy walk to the bus to Ala Moana for shopping.

We have stayed at Ilima several times and it's the best deal in Waikiki for families. We booked a two bedroom which was perfect for our family of five for two weeks. Most hotels in Waikiki won't accept more than 4 in a hotel room so our options are limited. Plus with the kitchen, free parking and internet this was a great deal. The best part of Ilima though is the staff. They are always super-friendly and helpful. Even though it's like a 3 star hotel, they provide 5 star service. It's only a short walk to the best (less crowded) part of Waikiki beach and there are tons of food and shopping options within a short walk. The only suggestion i have is Ilima needs to start refreshing the rooms. The wallpaper in our room (504) had water stains on the wall probably from condensation. Not a big deal and the room was very clean, but it looked unattractive. There's also a pretty rowdy bar right next to Ilima. We never had any problems, but i saw cop cars there several times during our stay. I'd be worried about teenagers walking around there at night alone. That's more of a general Waikiki complaint though and not really specific to Ilima.Overall we were very happy with our stay at Ilima and we'll most likely stay there again when we go back to Waikiki!

When searching for a hotel to stay at in Hawaii, I came across the Ilima because of the ratings and it had Free Parking. Yes it's very limited, but we always found a parking spot and if there was not one the lady at the front desk was willing to give up her employee parking spot. The hotel is not on the beach, but it is a short walk to the beach, shopping and eateries. The only reason I gave the hotel a four star is because the decor/furniture are outdated and our shower didn't have a lot of power. The hotel could use a good renovation, but we were not there to stay all day in the room, was there to explore Hawaii and I can't say enough about the staff. They were very helpful, friendly and went out of their way to help with any needs. I would definitely stay here again.

If you're looking for a place to stay in Waikiki at a great price, this is it. We got a 1 bedroom apartment to sleep 4 for $220. It was on a high floor and had a great view from the balcony of the mountains. Full kitchen and very clean. I loved the lobby with it's old Hawaii charm and the hotel receptionists were very nice and helpful with our vacation questions. 2 blocks from the main street in Waikiki, Kalakaua Blvd., it was fun walking from the hotel. We opted to go through a teeny street that had a market loaded with vendors. There is plenty of beach and shopping in Waikiki to walk to from this central location. On a budget, I would definitely plan to stay here again. With more money, I would go where there is a beach view.

Since we were traveling to Hawaii on a budget, we were looking for a hotel that wouldn't break the bank. My husband, daughter, and I felt we found a home away from home with the Ilima Hotel. Our room was a simple studio with a kitchenette, not a lot of extras, but it worked for us! Though a breakfast is not offered, this hotel is much less expensive than those that do. The Food Pantry is about a quarter mile away with reasonable prices compared to the ABC stores so this is where we got our breakfast and sometimes dinner supplies. Every time you walk into the lobby, you are greeted with a friendly "Aloha!" and a much welcome blast of air conditioning! The staff couldn't be kinder. Every Wednesday, the staff offeres complimentary lei making with kukui nuts for hotel guests from 10-11 a.m.. Our daughter's 13th birthday was on a Wednesday, but we were unavailable to take advantage of it, so I asked the folks at the front desk if they could set aside some supplies for my daughter so she could make one on her own. I was told they'd check and get back to me. When my husband returned from a trip to the post office, the front desk person gave him a small baggie full of everything my daughter needed to make her own lei. Also, two days later, when we were checking out, our daughter was given a shell lei, unlike the ones you get at other attractions at the area. If we ever have the good fortune to go back to Oahu, I want to go back! Thank you all, so much, for making us feel at home!

We enjoyed our stay. The room was spacious, comfortable, and clean. Everyone was very friendly and the on-site parking and the daily beach towels and mats was ideal. We're going back next year. Also, the location was ideal. We ate most of our meals in but spent a lot of time walking around.

our family of five stayed at the Ilima for 8 nights, the living area was quite acceptable although the bedrooms were on the smaller side, that said you don't book a holiday to sit in your room all day and as a base to roam from it was excellent, very handy to the night markets and Waikiki central and a 20 minute walk to the less expensive areas of town, the bus routes were nearby and the staff were very friendly and happy to assist. The kitchenette quite adequate as was the bathroom as a value for money hotel we couldn't fault it

In Waikiki there aren't a lot of Hotels you can book for this price. The hotel is a bit old, but clean and the staff is very friendly. There was however a cockroach welcoming us in the bathroom, but we transported it outside and did not have any other unwanted guests. They advertise with free parking but it's on a first come, first serve base. We arrived late so the parking was full and we had to park across the building on a public parking for $12 until the next morning. All things considered is was okay for the price we payed!

My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights. As others have pointed out this is an older hotel in need of refreshing. The carpeting is a little stained, the wallpaper peeling in spots, older appliances - a little rough around the edges for sure. The trade-off is a large spacious room with a full working kitchen and lanai, free parking, pool (although small), sauna (again small but great to have), good location, good bathroom and terrific staff all at an attractive price. A few months earlier we stayed at the Parc Wakiki (lovely but $$$$) but I have to say overall this was a more enjoyable (and practical) stay. Although a little funkier, I like the area better. It felt more "local". The beds were comfortable with very good pillows. The only negative was the major construction going on directly in front of the ocean view side: a new large hotel and a new 4 story market place set to open sometime in 2016. (There is major construction going on all over Wakiki: be warned). If you expect to sit out on your lanai between 9-4pm you will hear a lot of jackhammering and construction noise. We got up early and spent most of the day out. The beach is a short walk away and there are some very good Japanese restaurants nearby. A full-size supermarket is just a few blocks away. We used the kitchen and overall enjoyed our stay here. We would stay here again (and request the mountain-view side).

My husband and I stayed at the Ilima for 5 nights in May. This hotel was perfect for us. It has a kitchenette in the room with refrigerator, stove, sink, microwave. We didn't need anything but the fridge. It was close to everything. The hotel was very clean and the people were friendly. We didn't have any trouble with the parking - it's first come, first serve, but if we had gotten there late in the day we probably would have.

If you want all the bells & whistles, don't stay here. But if you want extra money to spend on tours etc. this is a very clean, comfortable hotel with free wifi, within a couple of blocks to the beach. The staff are very helpful & friendly. The beds and pillows were very comfortable with clean new white linens and soft white towels. There is a kitchenette with full 70's type stove (which we didn't use - we ate out for dinner), microwave, large fridge, a miss match of corningwear crockery. Wine glasses would have been good - but not supplied.The rooms are very spacious. We had a queen and double bed in the room. We were in room 1201 (12th floor) overlooking the golf course & canal - lovely view sitting out on our small veranda having happy hour before we went out for dinner. The rooms are a bit dated - because of the bed spreads and kitchen area & an old safe - non working that hasn't been removed. There is a safe fee $2.75 per day plus tax which should be complimentary. There is no resort fee. The pool is small but adequate and clean with pool towels. There was only one lift working but didn't bother us. There is a seedy bar at night you might pass to get to the restaurant, beach, shopping area. To avoid passing it walk on the opposite side of the road or street adjacent to get to the hotel if this bothers you. We walked straight pass the bar quickly and had no concerns. We are budget conscience, in our late 50's and loved the hotel. If you stay closer to the beach you will be paying triple the price and resort fees. Highly recommend Hotel Ilima for a clean, budget, comfortable holiday.

It starts at the front desk with outstanding staff. Then the rooms are large enough that you have space to move around. This will be our hotel in Waikiki from now on and we've made 17 trips there already.

Certainly not the top end of the market but we are spoilt in NZ for hotels that are a step down from the top of the market. This hotel had great staff. The linen and beds were great. it was cleaned daily - especially the bathroom/ toilet, It was handy to shops. The pool was ok. But it wa so dated - first impression was "What have we come to....?" There were no wine glasses and very limited utensils. Had to ask for coffee and tea - in the end we just bought all this ourselves. Wouldn't take much to give it a coat of paint to modernise it.And how expensive is it to buy some decent crockery. I would have happily paid another $10 a night to have had wine out of a wine glass.

We have a family of 6 and the I'lima was perfect. Our room had 2 bedrooms/1 bath and fully stocked kitchen. Parking is free, first come first served so you may need to have an alternate overnight parking plan. It has a small pool. There is a computer and printer to use for a fee. $5 for 30 min and .70/page to print. One elevator is currently being updated. Cultural activities during the week. Price was very good for just being a few blocks from the main strip.

This hotel is very dated. However, do not let that deter you. We stayed for three nights and they were great. We stayed in a two bedroom with a small kitchen. This was perfect for our family. The hotel is a short two block Walk to the main drag of Waikiki so it's easy to getti everything. Parking is FREE but limited which was a nice perk. A final note I wanted to make was about the staff. They were simply amazing. Overall highly recommed this affordable Waikiki area hotel!

Great sized room with family of four including two young toddlers. Very close to Waikiki beach. Found a great playground at the back of the zoo for the children. Staff very friendly. Public bus to pearl harbour is $5 return per adult. Bus stop very close to hotel. Much cheaper than going with an organised tour. Fast free wifi.

We stayed 6 people in a 2-bedroom. It was good for us. It is closed to the beach and shopping. And if you need it, they have all the tours you could wish. The cleaning was efficient and well done every day. I would recommed it for people to Waikiki.

For 10 days with my wife and another couple we stayed in a two bedroom apartment. This we found very adequate for our needs being large enough for the four of is to live .There was a shortage of some basic kitchen equipment, corks screw,wine glasses, but otherwise it was fine for the price. The facilities and staff were excellent.

I was impressed by the Staff. The hotel is in a location which is noisy due to all the construction. Don Draper (of MAD Men ) would find this an Ideal place to stay. I thought the in room Kitchen area could use a good scrub down. The beds were good, supportive and Clean. They are renovating the rooms with new carpeting but the age of the hotel shows the need for extra love. pool is very small and no hot tub is a draw back for me.

The rooms here are kept clean and the friendly Staff do everything they can to make your stay comfortable. Try to get a room that overlooks the golf course not the front entrance. The old style ranch sliders (and old louvre windows) are not double glazed and the air conditioning is noisy and past its use by date. This makes sleeping difficult in the front facing rooms because of the sounds from the street throughout the night. Particularly the rubbish trucks at 5am! Four of us were in a two bedroom self catering apartment. By NZ standards the kitchens are poorly equipment with mismatched plates, glasses, blunt knives, no wine glasses, no bread knife etc.The location and excellent staff make this three star hotel good value for money.

I stayed in the hotel for four nights. The facility inside the room could be a bit outdated but it is very clean. It is pretty large in which it fits very well for three adults. The kitchen has all necessary kitchenware including a small bottle of detergent ready to use. The parking is free which saves me tens of dollars of parking elsewhere. The parking spot can be a little bit small but I saw mini-van parked there without too much problem. All in all, I am happy about the room I got!

Free parking..Friendly...Close to action...Spacious rooms...Kitchenettes...Older and dated furniture and kitchen items...Beds were very comfortable and TV was a flat screen. Air Conditioner was unit in the window/wall, but very efficient. Bathroom was clean and towels plush...Your are next to a bar type joint, but just walk across the street down the other sidewalk. Our family made it fine. We stayed our first and last nights here. We were at Disney's Aulani for 6 nights in between. Although the teens almost died after being at Aulani, we know the value of a dollar and this was a good value. The biggest complaint my teen had was the smell. Maybe the staff could try some other kind of air freshener or cleaner. It did have a little crazy smell. The last night we were given a 14th floor room and could see a sliver of the ocean between the buildings. We had the mountain canal view at the beginning of our stay. I would chose the canal view. Hands down if you aren't real ticky, this is a great value. We are really careful about where we stay, but had no problem staying here for a couple of nights. Our room was twice the size of our Aulani room. We pretty much had a standard size at both places.

We live on Maui and needed to stay in Oahu one night. I chose ILIMA because it has FREE PARKING. Yes, you heard that right. FREE. in Waikiki. Unheard of. And get this, FREE Wifi!From my first point of contact via telephone reservations to the moment I checked out I experienced nothing but ALOHA. Everyone is very nice, efficient and helpful. Loved that. Our room was on a high floor with a King bed and a Queen bed and a small kitchenette. The room was very large. Bathroom had all the amenities and even a couple that were pleasantly surprising such as make up remover. Exactly what I needed when I needed it.The hotel is very dated but extremely clean. This is not a fancy place. If you need modern furniture and a fancy polish, this is not your place. If you are looking for a clean, comfortable place to stay in crowded Waikiki, this is perfect.Hotel location was fantastic. Royal Hawaiian was two blocks away. Hilton's MAC 24/7 for the world's best pancakes was three blocks away. Easy beach access walking distance. Starbucks one block away. We loved the Ilima and we will be back.

Stayed in Oahu without the huge, expensive, and impersonal hotel experience. Not a designer destination but Down to Earth and knowledgeable staff. Comfortable, clean, and capable accommodations. Met like minded travellers within the friendly community that is present there. Our room was always well supplied with towels and bedding. Air conditioning worked great. The Pool is open for the better part of the day with lounging chairs, showers, and handicap lift. We also had full fridge, microwave, stovetop, and oven. The room was spacious and also had a balcony. The second elevator was out of service during our stay however we rarely waited long. If you like to save money and feel like you are worth more than your Visa card, this is the hotel for you.

If you are looking for a swanky hotel, then the Ilima Hotel isn't for you. But if you are looking for great value, clean spacious rooms, and friendly helpful staff, then this is the hotel for you. The price is very reasonable compared to other Waikiki hotels.It is located in Waikiki about a 10 minute walk from the beach. Ask for a room that overlooks the golf course and hills behind Waikiki.We had a standard studio. It was a very large room with a kitchen, two double beds, a large balcony, and lots of space. I would have preferred a king or queen bed. But we were still pleased.It is an older hotel, and you can tell by the age of the cupboards. But it is very clean and bright.The staff were excellent. Always friendly and willing to chat or provide advice. Checkout is at Noon. But you might be able to stay until 1:00pm if someone isn't moving in right after you. We had an evening flight. So they allowed us to use the pool for the entire afternoon, after we checked out. Very nice indeed.There is an outdoor pool on the first floor. And an outdoor sundeck on the 10th floor. Be aware that in April the sun leaves the pool deck by 4:00pm.If we return to Honolulu, we will stay here again.

We really enjoyed our stay this past weekend 04/10/15- 04/12/15. The room was large and very comfortable. We use liked have the kitchenette it came in very handy. Staff was very friendly. Parking was free!! At the Holiday Inn a block or so away they were charging $35:00 a day. Internet was free also. We would stay there again in heart beat.

My family of four just returned from a week in Ohau and chose the Ilima hotel as home base in Waikiki. We liked the location of the hotel - less than a 10 minute walk from Waikiki Beach, tucked away from all the busy-ness of the beach area. The hotel offers free towel and beach mat use, as well as free parking, which was a huge bonus for us. the hotel is definitely older, but for us, we were happy to pay less and spend our $ elsewhere. The hotel staff is very accommodating and helpful which we also appreciate.

We stayed at Ilima hotel for three nights. Staff were friendly. Got best deal from the own hotel website. You pay for what you get. Great price for Honolulu, but rooms are dated and noise around the area can be loud. Free, tight parking. First come and first serve. Had some difficulty finding parking later in the evening. Beach towels and mats available at the front desk. Able to ask for coffee at the front desk if needed. Decent Wifi. Location is about 3-4 weeks from the beach and about 2 blocks from the major action of Waikiki.

I can pretty much reiterate what many other reviewers have written. Yes, this hotel is a bit dated in it's appearance and furnishings but it was clean, safe, friendly and ticked every box for my travelling needs.Staying on the 8th floor and facing the beach (though could not see it for other buildings) my room overlooked the old International Market Place. By day you wouldn't comment on the view but it was pretty at night with all the surrounding building lit up. I wasn't there to sit on the lanai all day so the view wasn't a factor for me.This hotel is only 2 blocks from the beach and all that the Waikiki strip has to offer but by being those couple of blocks back it was far enough away to be quiet and out of the rat race.The rooms are really large, mine had 2 double beds and a very spacious lounge area, as well as a kitchenette, full size fridge, oven, dining table and occasional furniture, easy roomy enough for longer stays. The furniture was a bit tired and dated but it was clean and in good condition, the beds were perfectly fine, not saggy or in poor condition. The bathroom was functional and included a bath with overhead shower, again, clean and in good condition.We attended the lei making class at the hotel (free) and had a lovely time with a group of other guests. It's worth going to, you get to take home your lei and it's an excellent souvenir.The reception staff were always friendly and attentive and were genuinely there to help, beach mats and towels are complementary. I have stayed in an ocean front room on a previous visit at a different hotel and now here at the Ilima and I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.
