Hot tip: you must get a walking map and find the Musubi Cafe Iyasume, it's right beside the Pacific Monarch hotel, they have the best and freshest musubis in town !!

This was the only hotel that offered FREE Parking. It is about 3 blocks from the Ocean, but an easy walk. The rooms are very very dated (think florescent lights, CFLs, old carpet & kitchen counter, paint chipped & falling off ceiling of bathroom, etc.) But then again, you're not paying the exorbitant prices commanded by the Waikiki beach hotels that are 3 times this price. There is a full kitchen for saving $$ on the morning bfast. (Refrig, Stove, toaster, dishes, etc.) The staff are very friendly & welcoming. Free morning Paper & 2 cups of coffee in the room.Complaints? There was only 1 working Elevator & the staff tended to commandeer them daily as they moved supplies (linens, etc) between floors. There were periods of waiting literally 10 mins only to have a full elevator arrive. (They are re-doing the 2nd elevator - so no idea when that one will be functioning.) The adjacent window in our room (809) was a slatted glass window. It LEAKED noise & wind during the night. So was kind of noisy for sleeping. The views are nothing special, really. Ours was a view of the mountain & the canal across the street. the hotel is surrounded on 2 sides by very high hotels (looking down on the balcony). Sort of a fish bowl if you like to hang on the balcony. Speaking of which, the furniture in the room & balcony is very very old, chipped, cracked tables. So again, not paying for "luxury" at this place - just a bargain price. (you get what you pay for). Oh, and the "Free WiFi" kinda sucked for my cell phone. Only was able to get like 1 bar in our room so it was not usable at all. I ended up just using my usual 4G network for internet access.Plenty of grocery stores & ABC (alcohol) stores surround this hotel. So it was easy shopping for supplies to bring to the room.

I was a bit hesitant to stay here because I thought the property looked pretty dated. Quite frankly, I was afraid there might be a bug issue. We were looking for a quick overnight property before our place for the week was ready in Ko Olina. I was trying to keep the price down on this one night because I knew we would be in and out quickly. This was a great hotel for what we needed it for.Parking was convenient, the hotel was clean, and anything you might need for the evening was within walking distance of the hotel. I wouldn't recommend this place for the week if you are looking for a true Hawaiian resort experience (but I wouldn't recommend Waikiki, in general, for a week long stay), but it is great as a quick place to stay for an overnight. When I was scanning the Trip Advisor reviews, I just wanted reassurance that this place was going to be clean and comfortable for one evening. It is....don't be afraid.

This hotel is only a block back from all the hustle and bustle but is central as well. It's a bit tired but the service is friendly and helpful people behind the desk, no matter what hour. The hotel is clean and safe with a pool out the back, which we didn't get to. The rooms are huge, 2 doubles with plenty of storage space for all your shopping. Th kitchen is fully stocked with all cooking equipment but will need to bring your own coffee.Overall we had a lovely stayThe Lei making class is excellent. We have a lovely hour or so and the teachers were really helpful and sweet.

When I've had decided to book this hotel I could not expect how nice it is. I booked it because was the most economically hotel in Waikiki. They have free wi fi and parking lot, excellent and nice staff, clean rooms and heat pool. The location could not be better in the heart of Waikiki, 5 min walk to the beach, Cheesecake Factory, Stores, restaurants, bars and groceries shopping. The kitchenette is a plus to stay in this hotel and the price was the best. I pretty recommend this hotel

My daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights in March 2015. Everyone was very nice and were able to accommodate us at a short notice. The room was very large and had a full size refrigerator, small stove, sink and lots of storage space. It was great having a parking garage and wifi included. The parking spaces were very narrow, so was a pretty tight fit. The room was quite outdated, but was clean. If it was updated, it would be awesome. The view was pretty nice and just a couple of blocks from Kalakaua Avenue. There was a bar on the block that was a bit of a dive, but no one bothered us. I would stay here again.

The furnishings may be dated, but it is clean and comfortable in a great location . The beach is only two blocks away and there are places to eat, shop, etc close by. We were on the 14th floor, facing the canal, so the noise level of Waikiki was reduced somewhat. Running the AC also helped cut out the noise.Parking is tight, but free which is a rarity in Waikiki. Knowing that ahead of time means we rent a smaller compact car. The location near the canal means easier access to H1, no matter which direction you are heading to on Oahu.The kitchenette is very convenient to cut down on the cost of your stay. Even if you just fix breakfast and keep water/drinks cold in the fridge it saves a surprising amount of money.Over the past several years, this has become our go to hotel if we overnight on Oahu.

My first impression when I walked in my room was it was about 20 years out of date. I quickly overlooked that when I realized the room was clean, the bed was very comfortable, the location is ideal and parking is free.My room had a beautiful view of the canal and mountains and was on the 12th floor and was very quiet. It had a small kitchenette area with a coffee maker, stove, refrigerator, microwave oven and kitchen utensils. There was plenty of storage. There is also free Wi-Fi. The hotel was a great value.Regarding the parking, it is first come first served and the limited parking spaces are VERY narrow. Also be sure your parking permit is visibly displayed. When I was there a guest's car was towed because he did not realize the permit needed to be displayed. He was from Japan and spoke and understood limited English. He had to take a taxi to the impound lot and pay CASH to retrieve his rental car. He was understandably upset. The day I arrived they began a months long project refurbishing one of their two elevators. As a result, the wait for the elevator was quite lengthy at times.The staff was very helpful, cheerful and friendly. On Friday they have Hawaiian singers. I caught some of the performance as I passed through the hotel lobby. It was a nice touch.

Yes, the hotel is outdated. But it is clean, spacious, well located and perfect. It is 2 blocks away from the beach and far enough away from the madness of Waikiki and the main glitzy shopping streets. I hadn't expected a kitchen, which was a nice surprise although we didn't take advantage of it. We were on the canal side, 14th floor which was great. A little too noise to keep the windows open all night (for us at least) but the breeze was nice. A/C also worked well.

I felt an especially warm welcome from the moment I walked into the hotel lobby. I was greeted with genuine smiles and was attended to immediately. The reassuring staff went the extra mile answering my questions and gave us a lot of personal attention. I had originally reserved a room for 3 nights, but asked if they could accommodate us for a longer period of time. I knew it wasn’t going to be easy during the high season, but they found a room for me and it even was a better price!They really did go out of their way to make me feel at home. I attended the “sing-along” on Friday morning. The staff handed out binders of Hawaiian song lyrics so guests could sing along (or just watch and enjoy). The staff sang beautifully and were accompanied by live bass fiddle, guitar and ukulele. It was lovely and fun!I signed up for their free craft class, held on Wednesday mornings. It was just an hour, and we all made lei’s from kakui nuts and shells. You have your choice of many different colored kakui nuts. I highly recommend it.Every room, other than the penthouse units, are the same. They are quite spacious (approx. 1000 sf (93 m2) including the bathroom area). Each room has a balcony and some kind of view. Our view faced the ocean, but was mostly blocked by taller hotels. There was a major building construction project going on (and will continue until about March 2016) and we actually enjoyed watching them work. We made a time-lapse movie of the trucks, dozers and cranes at work all day long. On Friday nights, Waikiki puts on a fireworks show. We could see it from our lanai. There are also viewing decks on the 10th and Penthouse levels. There is a small, outdoor, heated pool, sauna, coin-operated washers and dryers and other amenities. Every room has a kitchenette. My rooms (1604 and 907) had very basic kitchen equipment and no dishwasher. There are pots and pans, dishes, glasses, silverware, a tiny coffee maker and toaster. The hotel does not stock plastic wrap, foil, paper towels, coffee filters, salt, pepper, sugar or anything else consumable. If you like making your own coffee, buy it ground. If you think you might want to use a measuring cup, measuring spoons, a vegetable peeler, grater, or a baking pan, you will have to provide them yourself.Our rooms were perfectly clean. Bed linens were high quality and seemed new. Towels were extremely plush. The hotel provides beach towels and beach mats (tatami) to guests as well.The WIFI was very good. We were able to stream videos without a hiccup. The room was equipped with a large flat screen TV that had HDMI cables (we used it as a computer monitor).If you like a room that gets warm, ask for one that faces south. If it gets hot from the sunshine pouring in your room, you can open the large sliding doors or run the air conditioning.The downside is the loud city noise. This is not the hotel’s fault; in fact, every hotel in the city is surrounded by the same noise, 24/7. This is Honolulu, after all. It was a bit louder on the ninth floor than it was on the sixteenth floor. We closed the doors and ran the air conditioner which greatly reduced the noise. This was the only way we could sleep.This hotel is in a great location, only 2 ½ blocks from Waikiki Beach, 2 blocks from Food Pantry for groceries, and 1 or 2 blocks from bus-stops that take you all over the island for far less money than the tours charge. Consider ditching the car rental and exploring the area via TheBus.If you do drive a car here, you’ll be pleased to know that the hotel has a free parking garage for guests, which most hotels do not have.We saw no insects in the hotel the entire 2 weeks we were there.I recommend this hotel for visitors who don't mind somewhat dated decor and reasonable prices. We experienced genuine hospitality and were given complete privacy. We loved the spaciousness of the rooms and the fantastic location. We plan to return.

We have stayed at the Ilima three times. It is just a couple of blocks from Waikiki beach, located on the back side of the big tourist area, near the canal. The rooms and furnishings are a bit old, but are spacious and include a full kitchen - great for a family stay. Free parking and Internet make it a real bargain for this great location. Staff are very friendly and helpful and even put on a singing show in the lobby on Fridays. There are many good restaurants within a short walkig distance and the old International Market, now under development and the many stalls relocated to an alleyway, are at the end of the street. The Ilima is a reakl bargain and we have always had plesant stays there.

My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Ilima Hotel Feb 2015. We had a terrific experience :friendly staff , great location, spacious clean rooms with kitchen & good value --all we expected and more . Nice to feel the genuine Hawaiian friendliness of a family operated hotel. Will definitely be returning .

Like many others we spent four nights here before embarking on a cruise and had a most enjoyable stay. Staff were friendly and accommodating, giving us access to our room early. The hotel is older but clean and having a kitchen and dinette is a bonus. Not far from Dukes Lane and the shops and beach, so you can walk everywhere or if going further afield the bus is a economical option. On a Friday be entertained by the staff mid morning and on Wednesday take part in Lei making if you wish. Small pool but the beach is just a short walk away. Would certainly stay here on any return visit.

We stayed at the Ilima for a few nights prior to embarking on a cruise. The condo style hotel is a bit dated, but for the price and location offers that little something extra we were looking for. The room was clean and functional with a complete kitchen and dinette. Our room was quiet and had a partial ocean view (more of a good glimpse between two other buildings). The balcony was small and mostly overlooked the roofs of surrounding buildings, so we didn't spend much time on it. However, the location is perfect. There is an open air market just downstairs, and the beach, and excellent shopping and dining are all within blocks (most are less than a 5 min. walk). They were booked for our return trip, and while our second hotel was more swank, we missed the perks of the Ilima and would have happily returned.

The staff have been very helpful during our stay. while the hotel is dated - it is comfortable,clean and well looked after. We booked the three bed room penthouse for the six people in our group. It was a perfect base to explore Oahu and had ample parking for the car we hired.

We stayed at Ilima for four nights and our experience was great. The studio was huge, clean and had everything we needed. They offer free parking which has limited space but we were able to park our car every day/night. The hotel staff is very friendly and you can feel a friendly atmosphere from the moment you enter the hotel. Beach towels and mats are provided. Wi-fi was great.

We were looking for an apartment in the Honolulu-Waikiki area for four people for three weeks over the Christmas and New Year holiday. We needed a minimum of two bedrooms and preferably three and would not consider a place that listed the living room with sofa bed as one of the bedrooms. We began our search in early July and already the options were few and far between. Hawaii has been having a problem with short term lets and has been trying to clamp down on the casual rental business, without a lot of success. Minimum rental periods of one month were the most legitimate on offer and there was only a limited supply of these. Reports of scams where people paid deposits on properties that were never on the market in the first place were not encouraging. The Ilima Hotel has penthouse apartments and we started to look at this option seriously. Penthouse A (PHA) and Penthouse B could be linked to provide two plus one bedrooms, with a separate living and dining room and full kitchen. There would be sufficient beds to sleep eight. more if you used the living room. There was one full sized bathroom in each section as well as one washing machine and free standing dryer. Each apartment had its own WiFi router with free access. A big plus was free on-site parking although it was on a daily first-come first-served basis. Also a weekday newspaper was delivered each morning. It was a pity that they charge $3 a day for the use of the room safe, it seemed a mean-spirited charge when WIFI was free. We locked passports inside one of our bags. The Ilima Hotel is not one of the big names on the Waikiki scene and the property has been around for a good while. It is a sixteen story block and the Penthouses are on floor seventeen. Level thirteen seemed to have got lost. It is located only two blocks behind the main Waikiki street, Kalakaua Avenue, that could be reached in an easy five minute walk. Even closer was Kuhio Avenue with bus stops for The Bus, the efficient Hawaii transit system, and other shuttle transport. The apartments face the ocean that could be glimpsed between various tall buildings. Directly in front was a massive construction site where the International Market once stood. All the work going on there was still at ground level but if a tall building is to go up it will limit the views more. Construction noise was heard on and off, as was early morning garbage collection. The linked apartments turned out to be a great find. For four people it was spacious and supremely comfortable and would have been so for six. PHB could be easily isolated temporarily in the evening and would be ideal for up to four children if they could all sleep in two very large beds while their parents could have a double room each as well as a generous living room. The kitchen had a large refrigerator, full sized stove, microwave oven and a waste disposal unit. The cutlery, crockery, glassware and kitchen utensils were rather sparsely supplied. Four guests stretched what was available and we made do by buying paper plates to eke out the mismatched crockery and drank our wine from tumblers. Some matched crockery and well chosen glassware would be classy and work wonders.Each of the rooms was individually air conditioned. The units were silent and efficient. December is the Hawaiian winter so we needed air conditioning only infrequently, mostly in the late afternoon when there was full sun on the balcony windows. There was a small balcony with furnishings outside each room and it was a pleasant location to take drinks in the late afternoon or evening. The penthouse level also had a large terrace carpeted with green astroturf and furnished with sun loungers. There was a good supermarket five minutes away and a huge Safeway a few stops away on The Bus from our corner. The Penthouses are let as Hotel rooms, with daily service including Christmas Day. They were generous with towels, clearing garbage, and frequent linen changes.All sixteen floors are serviced by two lifts and except in the early morning around check-out time there were never delays. Guests joining and leaving the lifts included lots of families sometimes with a surf board or other beach gear. Our experience was good. The hotel is quiet except for some modest external noise and it is well run with friendly helpful staff. Its location could not be better.

Chose the Ilima based upon TA rating. Hotel was was in a good location for restaurants & 4-5 blocks from the beach. Front desk was very personable. Rooms were dated and showed their age (70's). Beds were just OK (again age). Construction, which started early, just a block away could be heard inside with the balcony door closed. Good value for the location and free parking is a plus, but parking spots are very tight.

Booked this hotel on our first night of a O'ahu vacation. Wanted to stay downtown and experience a weekend in Honolulu. Great location to walk to the busy downtown shopping area of Honolulu and find a restaurant for lunch or supper. This is an old hotel and needs a lot of updating but still works as a place to stay and worked great for our party of 3. We requested and got a superior suite with a separate sleeping area and it worked great with lot's of room for all of us. The staff was super and made suggestions for dining and sightseeing. One of the best features was a late weekend checkout of 1:00PM the next day at no charge so one could wander around longer. Did I forget to mention, "free parking? "

We were on the 11th floor, Ala Wai side, with a superb view of the city and mountains. No, it isn't glitzy and full of the latest gizmos, it is full of friendly and helpful staff, comfortable spaces, a quiet location, free parking, and made the base for a great re-acquaintance with Waikiki. I want to go back ! We were there in November 2013; I kept forgetting to review it.

Stayed in the penthouse suite for a week with six adults and two children. It was spacious! From the livingroom you had to strain to hear my infant son crying in the master bedroom, so his crying and my husband's snoring didn't bother the other couples in our suite. The in suite washer and dryer are tiny (fits two pairs of jeans and four t-shirts in a load), but don't require coins. Both of our washrooms had very deep jetted tubs. The only downside is that my preschooler had to be lifted high to get in and out, I can imagine that someone shorter than my 5.5 feet or not so nimble might find it difficult but there are hand holds on the shower walls.The top floor hallway (and maybe all floors, I don't know) is open to the outdoors with wide spaced metal bars to keep you in. The same wide spaced bars were on each lanai. My child stuck her head between the bars to have a better look and that was the end of our using the lanai as none of us wanted her to plummet to her death. We kept the doors locked and told her the lanai were haunted and it was never an issue with her going out there.The kukui nut lei making class was better than expected and was fun for all of us. We left with gorgeous leis made with glossy painted kukui nuts and coloured shells.Decorating the lobby are obscenely ridiculous paintings of nearly nude men and women in quasi erotic poses which made us giggle every time we came and left the hotel. It made the hotel memorable!The outdoor pool is small and doesn't appear to see much use, but why would it? The beach is a short walk away. The gym hardly deserves to be called a gym as it is really just a low ceilinged converted storage closet with two beat up old exercise machines inside. Some of that might sound awful, but it really wasn't. I liked the older decor in my room, I felt like I was staying at an auntie's beach house instead of a hotel. The hotel staff were kind and responsive to our needs. The check in and check out processes were simple and fast. The maintenance and housekeeping staff were thorough and friendly. The parking was free and the lot wasn't as frighteningly tight as I had anticipated and we parked our Dodge Caravan without trouble every night.We will be returning to the Ilima for our next Hawaiian vacation and telling anyone who will listen about how great our stay was. The Ilima made our good trip a great one!

This is obviously an older hotel but some updates could help a lot. The room was clean but there were rips in the wall paper and carpets. We found a huge cockroach on our patio one night, but thankfully never in the room. We had a room with a kitchen but couldn't make a dinner for 5 since we had only 2 pots and one frying pan. There were no baking sheets and limited utensils so we ate out way more than expected. We had to call for coffee a couple mornings and after they asked us to come down to get it we gave up and started going down the road to Starbucks. We did really enjoy the location though since we could walk everywhere we wanted to go.

Pros: * very friendly and helpful staff *attached parking garage with free parking *walking distance to beach, shops, and restaurantsCons: *very dated furniture (like a college dorm), chipped bathroom fixtures, chipped/cracked tiles in kitchen *bedrooms are VERY small - second bedroom has two twin beds and you could barely walk  into the room to get into bed. We had to leave our luggage in the living room as there was no room. *noisy, leaking air conditioner units in each roomOk for a short stay.

Many of my relatives have stayed here when visiting Honolulu for vacation or business. The reviews are accurate. For the price you pay the value is superb. Comfortable rooms with full kitchens. Away from much of Waikiki's hubbub and noise but still near the beaches and world-class shopping. Individualized attention from a very helpful and friendly staff that you don't often get in Waikiki's mega-resorts. I highly recommend it for your next visit. Disclosure: none of my family members or friends work here, but it is where I would stay if I didn't already live in Waikiki; they display the true meaning of "aloha".

Clean, comfortable, dated condo hotel with pleasant staff. Close to shopping (groceries, sundries, and luxury shops), restaurants, and Waikiki beach. Each morning we strolled down (2 blocks) to the beach in front of the Royal Hawaiian for a quick dip, walk, and view of the morning surfers. Stayed in a Deluxe (higher floor) Studio. Comfortable room with a king and double bed and a full kitchen with basic supplies. Free parking. Trash trucks nearby made lots of noise each morning. See room selection tips below. Check out their website for internet deals.

The Ilima Hotel is a good choice if you wish to stay in a reasonably-priced room or suite in Waikiki. When I stayed at this hotel for a week in October, they charged no resort fee. They have a garage with a certain amount of free onsite parking (but be aware that only the smallest of cars will fit comfortably in this garage). The resort fees and parking fees charged by other hotels in Waikiki can easily add up to $40 or $50 per day, plus I saved even more by renting an "economy" model car, which fit easily in the garage. The staff was friendly and pleasant, and our room was very large and clean, and had everything we needed. It was not luxurious, and was decorated in "80's" style and colors. It was a 12th floor, ocean view room, but we had to keep the blackout curtains of our room drawn during the day so the air conditioner would have a chance to overcome the sun's glare and heat. Our view also included the giant hole where the International Marketplace used to be. The Ilima Hotel is in a great location for riding the bus on Kuhio Avenue, and for walking anywhere in Waikiki. I would definitely stay here again.

Chose this after reading reviews that showed it was excellent value for a great location and were not disappointed. It was a family run hotel that was slightly run down but the king suite on an upper floor was perfect for 3 adults and allowed us to self cater with a good sized kitchen. There was a lovely view over the golf course. It was very clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. It was a short walk to the beach and all that Waikiki has to offer. Would be happy to stay another time.

We stayed here for 10 nights during our first trip to Oahu. Rooms were large, clean and very comfortable. Staff are very friendly and extremely helpful with all questions. More than enough room for my husband, myself and our 7 year old son.

We've stayed here several times and have had a great time with kids and large family groups. This hotel has "seen better days" I'm sure; not a 5 star hotel, but plenty good enough. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. Rooms are clean. Try to get a suite on a higher floor and you won't hear any of the street noise, although sirens at night in Waikiki are the norm. Kitchenettes in the room make it very convenient if you're travelling with kids. Location is only a couple blocks from the beach, so tons of interesting places to walk to. Also close to the Ala Wai canal where they have canoe races sometimes.

Best value for a prime location. Privacy, cleanliness, happy to serve staff. Beds were needing replacement. One was hard, one was too soft. Room had a full size and king size. Mountain facing side is best view. Get above 11th. floor for clearances to view more and good tropical breezes. I have stayed at this hotel for almost yearly visits since the 1980's. I like a clean room. Doesn't matter to me how costly as long as it is perfectly clean. Staff is smiling all the time. Close to the heart of Waikiki. Beach is 1-1/2 short blocks away. From balcony can view canoe rowing from your chair. No loud noises except normal distant street issues. Love this hotel!

When I'm in Honolulu I always stay at the Ilima: You get a large suite with a well-equipped kitchenette, really comfortable beds, an excellent location in Waikiki, and helpful, friendly staff. Prices are a fraction of the beach-front hotels. And the essential air conditioning works really well!

We had a 2-bed room, 8th floor, mountain viewPro: Great location, friendly service, fast internetCon: Overall a bit too worn-out for the $ you pay (a little investment in the room infrastructure wouldn't hurt); not filthy, but super-clean is different (e.g. kitchen)

We stayed at the Ilima Hotel for 3 nights (after changing from a horrible hotel) and it was such a nice surprise. It's an older style hotel but it is immaculately clean, very spacious rooms and we had a little kitchen area - with a decent sized fridge. It had a pool and laundry facilities which were very handy. Bed was clean and comfortable. The staff were very nice, helpful and friendly. Would definitely stay here again.

We have stayed in this hotel several times over the years.. Unfortunately it is now looking a bit tired and in need of some TLC but it's still the best place to stay. The location is right in the middle of things, only 2 blocks from the sea AND it offers FREE parking, something other hotels in Waikiki don't. The staff are always pleasant and the rooms clean and very large and added bonus is a tiny kitchen. My husband and I are often out late and we've never felt threatened by patrons from the tavern just down the street so we consider it quite a safe place to stay. I found it's best to book straight thru their website (as someone else has said) and we've always gotten a super good deal. BTW, Courtney who handles the bookings is a real sweetheart.

We've just returned from our holiday in Waikiki and stayed at the Ilima hotel. I know this is going to be a long review, but please take the time to read it as I have nothing but praise for the hotel and staff. We stayed there for 2 weeks and had a great time. The hotel was just lovely, clean and very comfortable. Our room was so spacious and having kitchen facilities helped with the occasional breakfast/ dinner. We booked our room directly through the hotel website, and as such, the price was more competitive. In doing so, I was able to be in contact with the booking staff and specified that we would like a room on the 16th floor - with canal/mountain views. The lady was so accommodating and answered every question that I had, and this was months before our actual trip. When we arrived, our room was so spacious, clean, comfortable. Staff were so friendly, everyone of them from reception to housekeeping - we were always greeted cheerfully and everyone was willing to stop and have a word. Any question regarding transport, getting around, shopping etc was answered patiently and we were provided with maps, directions etc. Our first day at the hotel, we couldn't get the microwave to start and contacted reception early in the morning. Within minutes someone was sent up to have a look and fix it. At the time, our fridge started making a loud noise - they replaced the fridge!!! The service we got was just sensational. They have free lei making classes every Wednesday which i would highly recommend. The hotel staff also have a choir that sings every Friday; this was really special and again, if you stay at the Ilima, you must watch them. There have been a few negative reviews on the hotel, but when we were there, none of them seemed valid. Yes, there is a pub a few doors down from the hotel, and you might be a bit wary about walking past it at night, but you can easily get around this issue by coming to the hotel from the Ala Wai end of Nohonani street rather than the Kuhio end. That is what we did, we walked up one of the other streets eg. Seaside avenue. There have also been negative comments re the room decor, colour. Again, these just did not appear valid to us. The views from the room were just spectacular and we spent every morning having breakfast on the 'lanai', looking out on to the canal and mountains.A few tips: eating out in waikiki can be expensive till we discovered restaurants on Kapahulu street. It is a bit of a walk from the Ilima (30mins), but so worth it. To name a few, uncle Bo's pupu bar and grill, the blue water shrimp and seafood truck - we had amazing food there. It is just a blue truck (opposite Lennard's bakery). They have just 5 items that you can order, but the shrimps were delicious and food was so cheap. Another must is the Malasadas from Lennard's Bakery. I've never tasted doughnuts like that before. Another place is Side Street Inn. Just walk down Kapahulu and you will find lots of lovely places to eat. And don't forget to eat at Marukame Udon - a Japanese restaurant just round the corner from Ilima. The long queues will give it away. Get there early - around 5.15pm. Having said that, the queue moves very quickly.And finally, there is free entertainment almost every evening from 6-7pm at the Royal Hawaiian Grove at the Royal Hawaiian Centre. The Friday evening performance is especially good and you can buy the CD after the show for $15. Get there early to get a good seating spot if you would like to record the performance. Don't forget to attend the Rock a Hula show and Fourever Fab. These are paid performances, but well worth it.A big thank you to all the staff at Ilima - we had a wonderful holiday !

We usually rent a condo at 444 Nahua around the corner from the Ilima hotel, but this time we were booking last minute and weren't able to get the condo. We went with the Ilima so we would still be staying in our usual neighbourhood.We stayed at the Ilima Hotel for 9 days. Our room was large, clean, comfortable and everything worked just the way it should. The small pool area was immaculate and the water crystal clear.Every member of staff, from front desk to housekeeping, greeted us with a smile and a cheery hello or wave whenever we saw them. Every question we had was helpfully answered, and we were even given a staff parking spot when we had a lot to unload one afternoon.The Ilima isn't fancy, but it is a friendly, comfortable place and will be our hotel of choice from now on.

We only stayed here for one night as we were able to get an earlier flight, but it is a nice clean place with FREE parking. Free parking is hard to find in Honolulu! It was a decent location. Had a little kitchenette in the room, which was nice. If you were going to stay longer, it would be ideal if you were trying to save some money for sure! The pool was very tiny, but who goes to vacation in Hawaii and not want to swim at the many, many beaches? I would recommend this hotel because of cleanliness and price!

A little bit on how I rate hotels: we are practical, value conscious travelers with customer service being top priority. So I can/will equally give 5 stars to a "budget" hotel as I would a fancy resort. OK onto the review.Disclosure: our friend is good friends with the GM so we got a "friends and family" rate, much less advertised than any website etc. during their 2nd busiest month of the year. While that made our vacation an even greater value, I don't think it affected service, meaning, I believe they treat EVERYONE as VIP (although, I'd like to think we're special lol ;)Location 4.5 stars: approx 3 blocks/10 min walk to Waikiki beach (if it was beachfront, it'd get 5 stars, but guess what? You'll pay much more!). For us it was a practical location: 2 blocks from Food Pantry, within walking distance of all shops/restaurants and across the sreet the little "alley swap meet" where I got a whole bunch of souveniers at a fraction of the cost of ABC stores/Walmart etc. Also across the street is a store (can't remember the name) that sells shirts 8 for $19.99.Since we didn't have a rental car, the location was great for us b/c we walked everywhere and all places conveniently located.Hotel/Service 5 stars: It is an older hotel, as you can see from their website/other reviewers, but it was comfortable, very clean and kept up nicely. Our room was a superior King (see their website for pics) which included a King & double beds and a full kitchenette (full sized fridge, stovetop and microwave) complete w/ dining table. This kitchenette was for us, an important feature for our 1 week stay. We wanted a good value to save money (I'd rather spend less on a hotel/food and use the savings for healthier eating, shopping/excursions etc.). It was very clean, no bugs or anything like that. Also comes with utensils, cooking utensils, plates/cups etc.). We saved $$$ by stocking our fridge.The AC is a wall unit and it kept our entire studio room nice and cool. 2 big closets/plenty of hangers, shelves, etc.Bathroom: has a bathtub, it's clean, basic. Comes with toiletries (shampoo, soap, face wipes, shower caps). Comfortable temperature even though no AC in bathroom.We requested the highest floor possible (got 15th floor) that was quiet and facing canal (see pic of view of balcony, very nice). You can hear sirens of driving by but other than that, very quiet.Beds: firm mattress (which I like), comfy and clean :)Service: BEST housekeeping, we just called when ready to leave to request the time we wanted our room refreshed. They always provided extra towels and toiletries per our request. Sometimes if I needed something in the evening, they'd send someone up right away (unlike other hotels where their housekeeping takes forever, or sometimes don't even show up). Made me feel like we were the only guests they were catering to :)Front desk, we got to know some workers more than others but all were extremely friendly. We just loved Nicole, who on our last morning said she wanted to invite us to her place for breakfast (but we had to go to airport). I let her know we'd host her when she visits So Cal :) She felt like family.Courtni reservations: Awesome in booking our room and providing all of our requests for quiet, highest floor, non smoking etc. Super friendly (in fact, just spoke w/ her this week to book our next visit there...which reminded me that I needed to post my review :)General Manager: Phil Sammer, GREAT GM, you can tell he does a great job in how his employees treat guests. They seem more like a family/team, than "workers". Very impressive. Again, he knew we were friends of his friend, but based on other reviews, I think this is how they treat everyone. I love the friendliness and service at Ilima.For value minded travellers who aren't in the hotel much, and do not mind that it's not "on the beach", it is a great way to have an affordable trip in the heart of Waikiki. This hotel had EVERYTHING we specifically wanted/needed in our hotel room. We didn't experience any problems whatsoever during our 8 day stay. Other amenities/perks: - Free lei making class (which I need to partake in next time :)- Free parking (we didn't use b/c no rental car)- Partner w/ Ilima Shuttle (800-713-0146) we got airport shuttle for $11 per person HNL to hotel and $10 per person hotel to HNL airport. You can probably get it a few bucks cheaper elsewhere, but this was a recommended company from the hotel so we used them for reliability. They were great/on time etc.- Coin operated laundry (didn't use)- Litlte fitness center (didn't use)- Beach mats at front desk- Free WI-FI in the roomsOverall, a great value, EXCELLENT service and for us, we couldn't ask for more. Having said that, there's no such thing as perfect and what would make them even better (based on other reviewers comments too), few tiny little things:- Fresh coat of paint to "modernize" the rooms. I think this would make a big difference to reviewers commenting on the rooms being "dated"- Eliminate the daily safe fee. It's an item already in the room that bears the hotel no cost in allowing guest usage so I think people who don't like to feel "nickel & dimed" would give them higher ratings if this $2.75/day were removed. This was mentioned alot by other reviewers. For us, we avoided the charge by simply bringing a lock for our luggage to lock up our iPad & passports.- Provide free coffee packs in rooms like all hotels do (for us, we didn't care b/c we aren't coffee drinkers but I saw alot of comments on this one too)- Allow free printing of boarding passes (most hotels do this)Whether an overnight stay or an extended vacation, the Ilima hotel will suit your needs. We can't wait to go back in 6 months. They are awesome and I'll be bringing them goodies from So Cal :)Aloha & Mahalo :)

Good value for the area (everything is relative!). We were in a penthouse studio. Came with kitchen and nice balcony overlooking mountains and canal. No problem with noise. Obviously an older property, but was clean and comfortable. Having the kitchen made it easy to eat in on occasion as Waikkii is pricey no matter what you do! Staff very accommodating and friendly. Easy walk to beach, shopping, restaurants or to catch tour buses. Here are my specifics.Hotel Evaluation CriteriaLobby staff - very helpful, available 24hrsCarts available - didn't askElevator to upper levels - yesRoad noise - did not notice on our levelGuest Laundry - yesRoom General-Easily Accessible plug by bed (CPAP user) - no, had to unplug clock in order to plug in on that wall-Bedside tables on both sides of bed - no, had to move bed a little and use a chair for my side (CPap on other side). I really like having a bedside table for my water and eyeglasses!-Plug by desk (computer) - no, we used a plug by the eating table and pulled our our power strip - shortage of plugs in general in the room-Bed Comfort - ok-Chairs/Couch -2 chairs with table, one with desk and an ok couch-AC cycling noise, constant fan setting, temperature control - old unit , sort of jerry rigged into wall, but it worked ok and could put on constant fan mode.-Balcony - nice size with 2 chairs and small table,TV - flat screen# channels available - okQuality of reception - okSleep timer - didn't useRefigerator/Freezer - regular size, but had a smell of fish - needs a deep clean!Microwave - yesCoffee Maker - yes, full sizeInternet-Speed - good-Ease of connection - easy, no password-Requires log on acceptance - would have to search for occasionally, lot's of routers listed for hotelBathroom-counter space - ok, above sink shelve saved the day-tub - has jets, didn't check out-shower (shelves, water pressure) - fine-shelves for shampoo etc. - yes-hand rails in tub shower area for stability - yes-overall size - ok-outside sink available - yes, in kitchen areaBreakfast - No, but several places with reasonable prices in walking distanceRestaurant - expect above average restaurant pricing in area-onsite - No-within walking distance - yes-within 1 mile driving - yes-delivery available - yesFitness Center - yes, didn't usePool - small, but available

AlohaI live on Oahu, Hawaii, in Pearl City. I had my son Michael come to Hawaii for two weeks. I booked his stay at the Ilima Hotel. He just left to go home to California on Sept. 3rd. He was very impressed with the hotel and his room. His room had a full kitchen with microwave and pots, pans and silverware, coffee maker, etc. 32" color TV and a great view of the Ala Wai canal,scenic views complete with rainbows. Two short blocks from Waikiki beach. He commented several times to me about how friendly and helpful the hotel staff was during his stay.My son and myself would very highly rate the Ilima Hotel. I wish to give a big Mahalo to the hotel associates for taking great care of my son during his recent visit to Hawaii. Aloha and MahaloCLM

I've stayed at the Ilima Hotel for a staycation during the spring and summer times and each time it was great. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Check in/out was easy and quick. All the times I've stayed here, it was quiet. The hotel has studios, 1-3 bedrooms and a penthouse I think comes with four bedrooms, but not sure, check the website. I stayed in a deluxe studio that had both a king and double size beds. The room is very comfortable and clean. There is a nice size refrigerator with freezer top. Also has a stove and there is cooking and eating utensils in the room, so you can save some money and make your own food instead of eating out that could be pricey. If you like seeing the ocean from your balcony, then this is not the place for you. The only views it offers is a mountain or Waikiki city (basically surrounding buildings) views, depending on which side of the building you stay in ( the best is the mauka or mountain view), but that's why a room is just to relax and refresh yourself, not to view Hawaii from inside. Keep in mind, if you want a room with a ocean view, its more expensive. There is a sundeck on the 10th floor and if you go there on a Friday night, you can see the Hilton Hawaiian Village fireworks show (check with the hotel staff for start time). Overall, this hotel is great if you want good value, quiet atmosphere, great staff, FREE wi-fi, no resort fees and if you don't mind the view.

The staff were all friendly and welcoming. The room was spacious with 2 double beds and a kitchenette with a large balcony overlooking the canal. The location is perfect, just a few minutes walk to the main street and another block to the beach. The "Pink Trolley" leaves from the corner to go to the Alamoana Shopping Centre for $2 as does "The Bus". The room was clean and the beds very comfy and great value for money. I would definitely recommend the Ilima and would return in a heartbeat.

The hotel is well located and includes parking in the room cost (no extra charge unlike most other hotels in Waikiki). During our stay, we always found a parking spot although they are offered on a "first come first served" basis (ie, they are not reserved on a room number or floor basis).The room was clean and included a fridge, kitchen with utensils and crockery, toaster, and coffee maker. We stayed 3 nights so we filled the fridge with drinks and fruit. The beds are comfortable. The AC was a bit noisy.The WiFi is supposed to be room-specific but the one for our room did not work, so we used the WiFi for a room next to ours (the staff OK'd this).The staff were courteous and helpful. The value was very good for what we paid. We would stay at this hotel again the next time we go to Waikiki.

All the staff we met at the Ilima were very friendly. We never passed in or our without receiving a cheery smile and an ‘Aloha’. They are a credit to the hotel.We stayed for a week in June, and booked a Deluxe Studio room at just $130 a night, which is excellent value for Waikiki. They offer standard, superior and deluxe studio rooms (as well as one and two bedroom suites) and I think that there is no real difference in room size between any of the studios – I think the additional cost is simply dependent on how high you are in the hotel, and hence which view you get.We chose the Deluxe Studio and specifically requested a high floor with a view of the mountains. The other side of the hotel would pretty much only look over other (taller) buildings. We got floor 16 (out of 17), and had a wonderful view over the canal, the golf course, and the mountains in the distance from our own private balcony (with a table and two chairs).As we knew in advance, the hotel is an older property, and a little rough round the edges here and there if you are being particularly picky. However, we thought it was superb for value, amenities and location.Our studio was a large room with two separate beds – one huge king size and one queen. It also had an arm chair, various lamps, a chest of drawers, a desk and chair, separate dining table with two more chairs, and a kitchen area with oven, coffee maker, toaster, sink, microwave and large fridge/freezer. There were sufficient utensils, plates, cutlery, etc, for four people. The furniture was generally made of wood, wicker or bamboo.The beds were really comfortable – sheets (rather than duvets), under the cover, but blankets and extra pillows were available if needed. There was plenty of storage space around the room in various cupboards, including a large wardrobe which included a safe (strangely charged at $2.75 per day, so we didn’t bother using it) and an ironing board and iron.The bathroom was basic, but nice and clean, and offered a few toiletries such as soap and shampoo and a modest selection of towels and a hair dryer. It only had one shelf, which was just about big enough for our range of toiletries.The location is excellent, being just less than two blocks away from the main Kalakaua Avenue, where all the shops, restaurants, fancy hotels and beach front is found. It really was just a five to ten minute walk to everywhere. Beach towels and mats were freely available at reception if you were headed out to the beaches.The room was sometimes a bit noisy during the night. We could hear occasional water noises (tap or fridge) plus wind blowing and traffic outside, even though we were 16 floors up. But this wasn’t excessive, and didn’t keep us awake or otherwise bother us.We had a hire car, so parking was important to us. We were aware that the hotel offered limited free parking, which is an amazing benefit for Waikiki, and it turned out that at least half a dozen spaces were free every time we came back to the hotel. Some of the parking spaces were tight, but we never had to worry about finding somewhere else to park the whole week.Twice during the week we picked up a Korean take-away from the nearby Me BBQ and ate it back at the hotel. This is where the plates, cups, cutlery, etc, all proved such a benefit. We ate breakfast in the room (or out on our balcony) each morning, too, saving the expense of eating out.The hotel offered a guest laundry. Washers and dryers were just $2 each, and soap powder available for just $1 at reception.In all, we had an excellent stay at the Ilima. Yes, there are loads of bigger, posher and vastly more expensive hotels in Waikiki. Some even have direct views of the ocean. But all these come at a price. We look for value for money, but still expect high standards from our hotel choices. This is the second time my OH has stayed here; the first time for me. But if we ever come back to Oahu, the Ilima will once again be the first (and possibly only) place we look to stay.

Our family had a very rough start to our Oahu Hawaiian vacation. The rental that we booked through TripAdvisor was inhabitable, and I truly believe it was a scam and not a legitimate rental. We would NEVER book through TripAdvisor again and FYI - they DID NOT stand behind their “Peace of Mind” guarantee! After our long flight, our bitter disappointment, and our desperate search in a McDonald's parking lot on our phones, we were able to find the last two rooms in the Ilima Hotel in Waikiki (www.ilima.com, 808.923.1877). The Ilima was very nice, the staff was warm and welcoming, and they had free internet and parking. We found the Ilima on Booking.com, but were so gun shy by this point to pay upfront, that I called the hotel and they gave us directions, told us to come on in, and they took us up to see the rooms, before they even asked us to pay! The rooms were very large, the kitchenette was fantastic with a picture of ice water in the fridge, the beds were comfortable, and the view was nice! We only stayed one night, but we will always look back on this hotel and its staff with very fond memories!

Had a wonderful stay here. Staff was always pleasant and very helpful whenever we had any questions. At first glance the room seemed outdated with pink carpeting but aside from that, our room was very clean and very spacious. It was also great having a kitchen so we could cook our own meals when we felt like it. There is a grocery store (Food Pantry) steps away and lots of restaurants close by. We got a room facing Waikiki beach side although we couldn't see the beach. It overlooked the construction site of the new shops although we never heard much of construction noise since we were out most of the day. One of the highlights of this hotel is the free parking. You can't get that anywhere around here so this was a big plus since we rented a van for two weeks. The bus transportation is also very convenient just down the street and takes you everywhere. We probably wouldn't rent a car next time. The free wifi was fabulous since our family of four was always hooked up to some sort of tech device when we returned to the hotel. Another highlight of our stay here was that they offered free lei making classes every Wednesday. It was a wonderful experience that was enjoyed by everyone including teenagers and we left with a pretty souvenir that we made ourselves. I must add that if you stay here you must visit the Japanese restaurant close by (Marukame Udon). You can't miss it. There is always a line up and no wonder, the food was excellent and cheap. Waikiki beach is about a 10 min walk away so it was fabulous for the kids and they thoroughly enjoyed taking surf lessons on the beach. The hotel supplied towels and beach mats which was bonus! Another highlight was that we got to watch the filming of Hawaii Five-O right on Waikiki beach. We even got to take some pics with the actors when they were on break. I definitely recommend this hotel and would return again. Thank you for making our stay such a pleasant one.

I don't know what other people are talking about...this place is a dump! Looks ok in the lobby but room was disgusting, smelly, gross, outdated, etc! Comforter had huge nasty stains (as did the carpet!) I was so grossed out by this room! These other reviews are NUTS. If you like prostitutes and homeless people, this is the place for you! The area is disgusting, go elsewhere on the island. Ew Ew Ew please do not stay here

We stayed at 3 different hotels during our time in Honolulu. This was by far the best value for the location. It was close to the beach (walking distance) and very close to much of what Waikiki has to offer in terms of shopping, restaurants, tourism, and transportation. We were in a 2 bedroom suite that had a murphy bed in the living room. There was also a kitchenette that was very useful at breakfast time. The downside was only 1 tv for a family of 5, but the upside was free wi-fi!! The room was clean, and every one of the staff we encountered was very friendly and helpful. There is no parking fees and no resort fees (which we had at both of the other hotels), and they even had laundry facilities which we used. If you are looking for a luxurious resort, this probably isn't the place for you, but if you are looking for a clean, economical and functional place to stay, I would def recommend the Ilima.

We just had a two night stay and had realized we were booking a budget hotel (at least for Waikiki), so we anticipated an older, somewhat shabby hotel. Well, it is older, but it is spotlessly clean, has everything you might want, comfortable beds with crisp linen and decent air conditioning. Parking is free (subject to availability) and the hotel also has fast wifi, also free. Beach towels and mats can be borrowed from the front desk.Finally, the employees are highly-motivated....nothing is too much trouble...one of the front desk people took her car out of a parking space in order to accommodate our car late one evening. Courtesy and pleasant greetings were present everywhere we met the employees.Would have no reservations about recommending this place and its location.

It's not often that hotels in big cities offer such friendly service. After all, a room is a room, particularly for cost-conscious travellers. Despite being a little worn, the Ilimi Hotel is still a nice place to stay. It's close to the main sights (and easy to get to, even during traffic hours), close to public transit, and walking distance to the beach. Parking is free (first-come-first-serve). Most important of all, though, the staff are such friendly, informative and helpful people that make the stay memorable. I was quite impressed by this.Honolulu is by no means a cheap destination, and even budget hotels can re-define your budget. For us, it was a transfer point from other islands to the mainland, so we did not need to stay for long. The Ilima Hotel was perfect for this. Well suited for the need.

We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite for 3 nights in August 2014. The room was very outdated: sofa was old and stained with a slip cover to hide the condition. Wallpaper was peeling, lamp shades were stained, and the bathroom walls were dirty. The bathroom floor around the toilet area was visibly dirty and was not cleaned even after the housekeeper cleaned the room on the second day. We were in Honolulu during tropical strom Iselle and Julio and the hotel shared emergency procedures. The rooms all had battery operated lights, but none of ours had working batteries. We requested that the batteries be replaced, but only 2 of the four lights were fixed.The swimming pool water was slightly green and we did not use it.

This was our first stay at this off-the-main resort listing. We were pleasantly surprised at the exceptionally large 'Superior Studio with Kitchen'. It was very clean, had lots of storage areas & perfect for our family with 2 older teens. The staff was great & informative in preparation for the Double Hurricane Threat. We didn't take advantage of the pool, fitness or rooftop sunning area since we wanted to be at the beach but it was nice to have the option to sunbathe or take a quick dip on the premises.There were two pricing items that sealed the deal. The first was the free parking although not guaranteed which can average $25/day at other hotels. We did easily find convenient free street parking when we returned after 10pm one night then we moved the car before 7 AM the next morning back to the hotel. The second was no resort fee (avg $20/day). The kitchen was adequately equipped with a dated stove and microwave for cooking quick meals for budget-minded families. Newspapers, beach towels & straw mats were available for free at the front desk daily. We had a wonderful unobstructed view of the lush mountains due to neighboring low-rise buildings. I would definitely recommend & return to this hotel in the future.Extra perk was the location to the extremely popular Marukame Udon restaurant at the end of the block on Kuhio for breakfast from 7-9AM with NO LINE compared to their lunch & dinner crowd! This was a great breakfast treat with their very reasonably-priced homemade udon noodles, tempura & delicious broth/sauce. Typically, I don't even like udon!

We booked two weeks at this hotel and it was great. The spacious room, value for the money and great service made it a great experience. The hotel offers free parking, which is a bonus for those renting a car.

If you like a hotel that is centrally located near Waikiki, but affordable and clean, choose this hotel.This is only few blocks from Waikiki beach, one block from the international market.Every room has a kitchenett and they provide free parking (first come first serve). The room is not sumptuous, but is clean and staff is very friendly.

I spent a week at this hotel with my daughter's basketball team. This is a great small hotel. It's not on the main strip but close enough to walk to everything. This is a perfect place for families. It was clean! They have a small kitchen in every room. It has a microwave, full size frig. small electric, 4 burner stove with an oven, coffee maker (ask for filters), and a small table. We stayed in the deluxe studio and it was very roomy. They also have coin-operated laundry machines. They have 4 washers and dryers! I found it very convenient! There was never a wait for a machine! The pool is small but they do have sun decks on the 10th floor. They people there were so helpful! It was a great experience. I would definitely stay here again.

This is a mid range hotel a couple of large blocks from the beach front main thoroughfare. The staff here were always very pleasant and helpful. The WiFi worked well. The room was clean and tidy with handy kitchen facilities. Balcony was nice, large fridge kept the beer cold. All quite fine.Only negatives I can think of were:- the pool and surrounds are very small- they have a coffee filter machine in the room but do not provide coffee (unless you go and get it from reception which I believe is $1.00)All in all, if you must stay in Waikiki, this is a decent mid-price option. Having said that, I was often jealous looking from my balcony at the very nice looking large pool facility across the road (at the Aqua Skyline at Island Colony).

We had a great time at the Ilima Hotel. It is an older style Waikiki hotel, but the rooms are very large and the rates are very reasonable for being in Waikiki, makes it worth the walk to the beach. Wonderful and very helpful staff. Nice clean hotel. Lots of wonderful restaurants with walking distance.  Our only negative is that the windows are the old style shutter glass, not very sound proof. Keep in mind that if you get an ocean facing room, that there is contraction going on nearby at the old "international marketplace" during the weekdays. No problem if you are up early & on the go. Highly recommended.

The Ilima is a basic but clean hotel with nice sized rooms. The bed was very comfortable.What made my stay in the Ilima was the attitude from the staff, and one staff member in particular with the assistance she provided to my family and I during our stay.

From the moment we walked in we felt welcome.The staff were extremely friendly and helpful.The hotel is a bit older but the rooms and public areas were spotlessly clean and well maintained.The beds were very comfortable and having a kitchen was an added bonus.The room was huge. We had a view towards Kuhio Ave & the the "former" International Market Place. Hotel was very central with a short stroll to many restaurants & shops. Only two blocks to the beach.The area was nice and quiet at night which made it easy to sleep. Free internet via ethernet cable or wifi provided for each room. We would definitely stay here again If you're looking for value for money, fantastic staff and large clean rooms, it's hard to go past The Ilima Hotel.

Pros: cheaper than many other Waikiki hotels, coin laundry , friendly staff, small kitchen in room with a good sized fridge, lanai on room, small but nice pool, free lei-making class, free parking (park by 7 each night and rent a small car to ensure a space), walking distance from beach/restaurants/grocery store/zoo/aquarium/bus stops/etc... We even walked to diamond head, enterprise car rental across the street, cold A/C and they appeared to be updating several A/C units as well, quietCons: looks old/needs updating, we had one cockroach in our room (only one in the 2 weeks we stayed. Just kept all food in the fridge to be sure we didn't attract any more), had to be careful not to be too late in evenings to get a parking spot in the free garage (Lots of spots in the garage but too many people rudely parked over the line taking two spots instead of being careful to park carefully as to leave space for others.)

We (family of four) recently stayed at Ilima Hotel when we first arrived in Honolulu. We decided to stay here for several reasons: (1) positive reviews, (2) location, and (3) it was one of the few one bedroom hotels listed on the TLA list in our price range. I didn’t know how long we would be in a hotel & wanted a place with a usable kitchen & a separate bedroom for the little ones.I requested a quiet room when I made my reservation & was given a room on the 14th floor. The room was clean (yes, there were a few strands of someone’s dark hair in the bathroom but in the grand scheme of things not a deal breaker for me), quiet, and worked for the week we stayed there. There was room for the 2 kids to play and we weren’t on top of each other. The king bed in the bedroom was comfortable and the queen sofa sleeper wasn’t horrible. The kitchen had the basics & I was able to cook most of the nights we were there. There is a Food Pantry about 2 blocks down that I could grab things at if needed. My kids loved the heated pool. We really enjoyed the lei making class that was offered on Wednesday morning. The laundry facilities on site were nice to have and I was able to get change at the front desk. The cost was a bit of a shock for me ($2 for the washer & $2 for the dryer) but at least I could wash the clothes without hanging out at the laundromat. We never had problems with parking availability & we were in and out quite a bit. As far as downtown noise, I didn’t notice it much. A siren or garbage/delivery truck here or there but nothing so bad we couldn’t sleep.I would definitely stay here again & recommend it to family/friends for when they come out for a visit.

We spent 1 night in Ilima hotel to be close to Waikiki beach during our Hawaiian trip.The staff was very helpful in checkin us in before the official time.The hotel is well located, close to the beach, and has got a private parking.The rooms are ok, nothing special but is value for money.The beds were quite small, this was quite strange considered that the room was very spacious.The clean was ok, but the room was a bit aged, as per the hotel itself.Recommended for a short stay to be close to Waikiki, otherwise for a longer stay in Oahu I recommend something outside Honolulu to have a better quality for the same price.

This was the second time we have stayed at this establishment and could not fault it. Although it is slightly outdated, this did not bother us in the slightest and only adds to the character of the building. The staff were sensational and super helpful, and the room was extremely spacious, clean, well maintained and suited all our needs. The inclusion of a full kitchen made it so much more easy to prepare our breakfast and lunches. We had a view of the canal and gold course which was nice.The hotel provided free lei making classes and also provided a free local song rendition sung by 13 employees which was outstanding. It also has a small gym and sauna and of course, it's own swimming pool.This hotel is so well positioned....handy and central to everything.We would not hesitate in staying here again and recommending it to others. We stayed in room 501 and would recommend requesting a room on the eastern (canal) side of the building.

The Ilima is one of the somewhat dated hotels in Waikiki and is a bit of a walk to the beach but right in the heart of Waikiki. Bathrooms have been renovated and are clean and efficient. Beds are comfortable and has temp controlled Aircon in each room. We stayed in two bedroom apt. At front, which can be a bit close to the noisy late nighters on the weekends. The single rooms are quieter at the back.

This is a great older hotel with an efficiency kitchen. Well maintained and clean. With included parking the price can't be beat. We had a great stay. Easy to find. Within walking distance to all of Waikiki beach restaurants and attractions.

I unfortunately did not book this hotel. It was a package deal with the trip I purchased via a travel agency. I expected more from the various reviews I had seen. However, once in Waikiki I had already paid for the package and simply stayed at the hotel. While the room is spacious, I did not feel comfortable with being in the room at all. The floor was dirty and I found myself wearing socks whenever in the room. I was also glad that I had brought my own pillowcase as the ones that were provided were a bit dingy as well as the sheets. The bed was rock hard and in the morning I found that the kitchen had small ants present. I called the front desk and they said they would take care of the ants while I was out. When I got back I did not see ants but saw them again the very next morning. The location was close to the canal and restaurants however, beware at night as there is a bar down the street where shady people just hang. I did not feel safe coming back to the hotel. I personally would not recommend this hotel.

Before finally booking the Ilima Hotel, I spent a long time searching for a budget friendly hotel in the Waikiki area. When I stumbled across the Ilima I was extremely grateful and happy to find an inexpensive hotel so close to all the action in Waikiki. The hotel rooms are spacious and truly a home away from home with an en suite kitchenette (dishes, pots, utensils, sink, stove/oven, fridge/freezer, dish soap), coin laundry, and free parking. We rented a car to get around Oahu easily so the free parking for hotel guests was a big selling feature.The room decor is retro (circa 1980's?), but the rooms are in pretty good shape and overall clean. We had one issue with the cleanliness of the sheets when we first checked in, but upon notifying the front desk there was a staff member within minutes in our room replacing our linens and double checking the room. I loved how close the hotel was to the beach and some of the more expensive hotels in Waikiki. We were able to enjoy the nightlife and shopping of Waikiki without spending an arm and a leg for one of the beachfront hotels. About 2 blocks from the Ilima is a small grocery store and about a 10 minute drive away is a Safeway grocery store.Overall I would recommend the Ilima to anyone looking to stay in the Waikiki area for a budget price.

A hotel for bargain shoppers booking with price-cutting websites. Its a older hotel but the amenities makes up for it (free parking,wifi and kitchen). Hawaii is expensive, adjust your standards and be a baller on a budget. Located 10 min walk to beach and farmers market.

The Ilima is an old school Waikiki gem. As other reviewers have noted, everything is within walking distance, at a fraction of the cost of the beachside hotels. Our corner room (1207) was quite large and included a kitchenette, as well as a lanai with table and chairs (not to mention a spectacular view of the canal and mountains). We looked forward to unwinding on our lanai at the end of the day, watching the canoes and kayaks glide by. At night, the lights twinkled on the mountains, and in the morning the clouds misted off the mountain tops -- an oasis of peace in bustling Waikiki. If you're fussy about things being updated, this probably isn't the place for you: the carpet could have used a good cleaning, and the furnishings were a bit worn. But the kitchenette and bathroom were immaculate. The staff couldn't have been nicer. Another big plus is the available parking. We loved it.

Booked on line no problems, clean but dated, roomy for a family of four with teenagers. Full size kitchen spacious lounge. Mattress were small and uncomfortable but the were in the process of updating up to fourth floor we were on eighth. Perfect location two blocks from beach, shops restaurants. Would stay again perfect if on a budget.

Clean and comfortable, this place was a surprise. At first glance it seemed to be an older slightly shabby hotel. Our very spacious room had been renovated with the original fittings bought up to date and made to work perfectly. It was like stepping back into the 70's and it had been well done. Even the old in window airconditioning system has been retained but is now new and remote controlled. A full kitchen complete with period Corningware dinner service, all matching, topped off a delightful experience. Very friendly and helpful staff complimented the facilities.

We found this hotel to be clean & comfortable although the wallpaper & carpets need updating. All the staff were friendly & helpful. Our room had a queen bed plus a double bed. It also had a full kitchen which was perfect for breakfast or to prepare a snack. Easy walk to shops, restaurants & buses. There is free parking available on a first come first served basis. They also have a guest laundry. Free WiFi was great as well. The hotel can also organise a shuttle to the airport for $10 per person.Overall this is a good hotel for those on a budget.

Our check in was a breeze. We knew the room had 2 twin beds (perfect to share with my sister) and a full kitchen....what surprised me the most was the spaciousness of the room. It was about twice the size of most standard hotel rooms with plenty of closets (yes, that is plural) and storage space.The kitchen included a full refrigerator, a stove, oven, microwave, toaster and all the necessary dishes, utensils, etc. An added bonus was the free parking included in the price (first come, first served - - might be a problem if you plan on getting in after 8 or 9 pm).The room was clean if a bit basic, but there was a small table for 2, a desk TV and balcony with views of the city (and other nearby high rise hotels). The only minor problem was the beach towels (that you had to get from the front desk) were actually just regular bath towels (white and not much. if any larger than the bath towels in our room). The pool is also a bit small and there is no hot tub (but I think there was a sauna and a 2 machine work out room, although we did not use these).  This hotel is about two blocks from Waikiki Beach. An easy walk but I would be cautious walking it at night (we did this once and it was a but scary, but there was a moderate police presence).I would definitely stay here again. There are great prices available on the hotel's website (search for their "specials" tab or you will pay a bit more).

We stayed at the Ilima Hotel with a group of 6. The hotel is located two blocks from the beach on a relatively quiet street. All the main attractions of Waikiki is in walking distance. The layout of our room was good although the interiors are a bit dated. We had two bedrooms and a pull down bed. Wifi was strong. Parking is provided although first come first serve so don't get back too late. The air conditioning (the types that stick out the window) being noisy was probably the main complaint. Overall a good experience in Waikiki.

Honestly, the best part of our 17 day trip to Hawaii. Had room 1002. I was next to a roof top sun area. Great place to visit with companions. The balcony off our room was great in the morning as it was facing the east. Sun in Morning. Shade in afternoon. The Ilima is 1 block away from what is left of the international market. Very clean. Comfy beds. Only weird thing is the charge for using the safe??? Odd with so many other things offered free.

This is a nice, albeit very outdated, centrally-located Waikiki hotel that has everything you need for ~$140/night: free garage parking; free wi-fi; spacious, quiet, very clean rooms with comfortable beds; soft, clean towels and linens; a fully equipped kitchenette; a big, furnished lanai with a gorgeous mountain views or city view views; coin-operated laundry machines ($4/load for wash+dry); fast elevators with no wait, a sun deck and a pool. It is located on a quiet side street that is just a 5 minute walk from Waikiki Beach and plenty of dining, shopping, grocery, drug store, and entertainment options. You can have a very comfortable stay and still save a lot of money if you stay here. We opted to buy groceries from the Food Pantry around the corner and cook many of our meals at home, opting to enjoy our beautiful mountain view from our Lanai instead of the cramped, noisy pricy restaurants downtown. If you're not a cook you have many $5 take-out options within a block from the hotel (udon bowls at Murakaume, steak and egg scramble from Hi-Steaks, ramen from the ramen stand at Food Pantry, tacos from Surf n Turf, subs at Subway, etc).

Decent hotel, close to Waikiki Beach, and the heart of the tourist area, full of shops, restaurants and bars nearby. Nice view of Waikiki and the sea from the balcony. Parking available inside the complex too. Has a pool and a penthouse on the roof for sunbathing and viewing.

The hotel close to International Market and the famous of Waikiki Beach,Honolulu within walking distant about 5 minute. You can play Ping-pong inside the room, even though with 2 queen beds but still plenty room. The hotel look old but clean and highly maintain, that's why the room so big.Barely see the hotel staff and I don't know friendly or not friendly because we use back door, use elevator and straight to our room.I really don't want to mention about the hotel STAFF PHOTO COPY my ID/ Driver License and I don't know if that's WITHIN HOTEL POLICY or not but I stayed in many hotel and they've never taken my ID to the back room and make a photo copy.Other than that everything just perfect experience vacation.You have to pay to use safety box in room and big enough to put every gadget you have in.

If you're looking for a 5 star hotel, this ain't for you. The room are clean and much bigger than the Hyatt Regency. It's one block from the famous Waikiki Beach and it's right smack in the center of Waikiki.

We went to Hawaii as a baby friendly destination before my wife went back to work from maternity leave.Let's start with the good:Price per night is better value than many of the other options.Ilima were accommodating, arranging a crib for our baby.Rooms, while dated, did have a fully equipped kitchen so we could re-heat any left overs and make baby formula easily, etc. As food servings are huge in Hawaii we had a lot of left overs but back to the hotel review...Location is great, just 3min walk down Nohonani St to the main beach side strip on Kalakaua Ave. Lots of good places to eat or get a coffee close by.Swimming pool is adequately sized and well maintained.Staff are friendly and helpful.Free wifi is very handy.My wife loved the free Lei making class What could be improved:As mentioned earlier, rooms do look dated but that is Honolulu as it is an older city.Gym is tiny, hardly a gym at all as it's just a treadmill and bike in a tiny room.You will get charged a daily fee for using the safe which is inclusive in most other places.Air conditioner was loud.Some bad reviews are probably due to the 80's furnishings but for our purpose of having a baby friendly hotel that was clean, conveniently located, not overly expensive and with friendly staff then Ilima was the obvious choice.If you want a 5 star beach front hotel then go with the bigger named chains and pay at least twice as much per night.

Spent 7 days at this property on our visit to Honolulu. We wanted a room with kitchen as we couldn't eat out for 7 days. The place was quite reasonable for the price, it's just a short walk to the beach. On the way to the beach is the market to under the giant banyan tree which is cool. The markets around the area are bustlling with activities and it's fun to hang out on the kalakaua street which has some really high end retail outlets.

Enjoyed our time at the Ilima. The full kitchen in the room was very useful, although we did not use the stove. It was fully equipped had we decided to cook. Instead, we just used the refrigerator and microwave for leftovers and snacks. We enjoyed the Friday night fireworks from the 10th floor sundeck thanks to a staff recommendation. Can't praise the staff enough--they were always friendly and willing to answer questions and give directions. Room was very clean. Our fourth floor room had a lanai, but was too low to have a view. Two blocks got you to the beach and there was a street type market through Duke's Lane on the way to the beach. Bus stop was one and a half blocks away in front of the Food Pantry where we picked up water, snacks, etc. Our grandson and I enjoyed making the nut leis. That is a very nice amenity, and free. We thought we got a good rate for our room and were very satisfied with our stay. Would definitely stay again if we have the opportunity to return. We met a lady while making leis who told us she had been coming to Honolulu annually for 27 years and had always stayed at the Ilima. That speaks very well for their staff.
