We stayed one night as we arrived one day early for our 8 day vacation at our time share property. The staff were very friendly, the room was spacious and the parking free. Although the bed was uncomfortable (a personal preference), and the room was dated I would still give it four stars.

I had very comfortable stay for 6 days at Ilima Hotel. I stayed at a studio room. The room facing to the mountains on the 8th floor was very spacious. The room was equipped with nice kitchen . The kitchen has an oven ,a microwave oven, a big refrigerator and 4 cooking heater, dishes, cups and so on. The bath room is also good , equipped with full sized bath tub. The swimming pool located back side of the hotel building is not big, but its good point to mention is that the water is heated up comfortable temperature in winter time. I felt the hotel building itself is old but well-maintained. The laundry machines are available in the hotel. Location is very convenient but quiet. The hotel staffs are nice and friendly.

You are 2 blocks from EVERYTHING! You have a small kitchen and a balcony. PLUS free parking. Best deal we could find and I would totally stay there again!!!! And the staff was really friendly :) After staying at Turtle Bay and Paradise Bay I was shocked that they were the only ones that gave us a lei. Finally felt like I was appreciated :) Save the money and stay here! Trust me there are plenty of other places to blow your money :)

This is our 3rd time staying at the Ilima, and it continues to be a low-key, comfortable, clean place to stay. Our upper-level room facing the canal was big, clean, and with a comfortable bed. The staff continues to be professional and friendly. My main suggestion is to pay extra for an upper level room facing mauka (inland toward the canal) rather than pretending to get an ocean view from the other side. The hotel is old but well maintained; just don't expect luxury, a fancy lobby, room service, etc. Do bring ear plugs because you will have the windows open (though there are room air conditioners they really aren't necessary) and there is a bit of street/partying noise.

I have not been to a hotel with such friendly and capable staff. They bent over backwards to make your stay enjoyable form the free lei making session to letting us out on the penthouse level for evening canal photography.While an older hotel, it was clean, incredibly big, well equipped and quiet. Great value for the price.There is a full service store a few short streets away and some things like pop, booze, and some groceries only a couple doors away, towards the beach. World famous Waikiki beach is only a couple shorts blocks away as well. Great restaurants all around including Duke's at the Outrigger, Cheesecake factory, and California Pizza all within a couple blocks.Bus transportation was close and easy.If you are looking for an ABC store there are only one or two per block.

5 minute walk to the beach and compared to prices of other hotels in the area this hotel had all you needed. Full kitchen, large rooms with balcony and friendly staff. Not a 5 star but I would stay here again.

Stayed here on our return trip back to Australia from the US, found the location very central and with the kitchenette in the room very handy for early breakfasts and late night snacks. nothing like the large hotel chains where the rooms are small and lack the friendliness associated with Hawaii. Our room was large and airy with a small balcony. The establishment has a very friendly atmosphere, and the staff only too willing to offer advice on local bus tours. On my next trip to the US will stay here again, it's a great place to break the long haul flight between the US and Australia. the room was spick and span and on the 3rd, there was next to no traffic noise at the front of the building.

It was my first time in Hawaii, but my hosts have been staying at the Ilima Hotel for almost 20 years and I can see why. The heated pool, views from the balconies and the welcoming friendliness make it a wonderful stay. I used the kitchen to great advantage, especially on those early mornings when a tour bus was picking me up. It was a close walk to shops, restaurants and the beach. I liked coming "home" to the Ilima Hotel after a sun-drenched day at the beach. Paula

Stayed here with my family for several days and would recommend it. It is conveniently located and the suite was spacious and well appointment and although the accommodation isn't 'luxury' it is clean, spacious and comfortable. The service was amazing the staff was friendly and helpful, nothing was too difficult. Also parking was free and this is a real find in the area. I recommend staying at this hotel if you want to be in a good location but not spend a small fortune.

The Good Stuff: Staff were 7 star, always friendly, informative, and helpful. Location: 3 blocks to Waikiki beach, one block to buses, adjacent to Ala Wai canal for a nice walk without sand in your shoes. Free Parking!! The room was clean and kept clean by maid(s). Stove, microwave and refer plus a few pots, pans et al (in deluxe studio). Mattresses were firm. 12th floor view towards mountains was nice. Free local newspaper. Good commercial washers and dryers, coin op. The rooms are big.The Irritating Stuff: As with our last stay some years ago you get one 4 cup coffee pack per stay. You either buy your own coffee and filters or go without. A charge for use of the hotel p.c. and printer, $1 for 5 minutes. With all the other good things going for this place this miserliness seems misplaced.The Other Stuff: This is a budget hotel, really cheap given the freebies and amenities. So it is a bit dated, the pool is the size of a hot tub, your room carpet may have a seam showing, likely the awful pink paint on the closet doors has a scratch or two, and the vinyl wall covering near the floor by the full sized tub in the bathroom will be loose or poorly glued down. If those things are not important to you then make your reservation but ask for the upper floors (above 10th) and mountain side for the best view.

We stayed here from January 31 to February 4. A friendly hotel with great service and comfortable rooms. The location is close to everything In Waikiki. The front desk very helpful. We were looking for a used replacement suitcase and the clerk Nicole actually brought us one from her home. That's what I call service above and beyond!!

The staff at the Ilima Hotel consider themselves a family, and you are a guest at their house. They trieat you as though you are a family relation, not a customer. Hotel is easy access to the Honolulu bus system, to Duke's, to the Waikiki Aquarium. Family loved staying here.

People stop your complaining...if you want a five star then PAY for one and stop complaining... You are too cheap.....this is for the economical crowd who want a nice place to stay without paying alot.

Stayed 2 nights in early December 2013. We were happy with the location. Disappointed that our room overlooked buildings not the mountains as we hoped, I booked because of the view of canal/mountains. Easy walking distance to beach[2 blocks] and main street[1 block].We had a room with 2 double beds and kitchenette on 9th floor. Clean not smelly at all and a good size room. Staff helpful and pleasant. Free parking, wi fi.

Not quite a 4-star review, but better than 3 stars. We stayed here for three nights starting on Christmas Day. The room was huge! We faced the mountains and the Ala Wai Canal, so the view was very nice. The beds were comfortable and the room seemed clean enough. We were on the 8th floor, and it was surprisingly quiet given the busy streets of Waikiki. The location is excellent, close to all the restaurants and shopping, and not too far from the beach. There's a full sized refrigerator, stove, and microwave, so you can cook in your room and save on restaurant costs. It's an older hotel so the furnishings can be a bit banged up, but at the price we thought it was a great value.

We booked a 2 bedroom suite for 2 nights in December 2013, our choice based largely on the favourable reviews we read on Trip Advisor. Although the staff went out of their way to accommodate us on our early arrival, we were very disappointed with our stay. To characterise the overall condition of our suite as "shabby" would be kind. The drapes on the master bedroom window were stained and the room smelled. The only room in our suite that looked and smelled clean was the bathroom. In its favour, the hotel is well-situated in Waikiki, close to public transportation and shopping. Needless to say, we wouldn't recommend this hotel and won't stay here again.

Aloha! free wi-fi good for me.Half block to main bus line,and ABC store plus International Market Place,right at corner.Great Staff.Washer/Dryer at garage level has view to Canal and main drag.Take #2o to china town and Wal-mart.I ride bus from Airport $2.50.May rent a Jeep for 1day top off,all rentals with in a half mile...this my second home from LA.Also,Subway half block turn left at corner,about 1 dollar more.Mahalo!

We stayed here for a few days before a cruise. We initially had a room on a lower floor at the front of the building but found it quite noisy when the bars emptied out. We were moved to a huge room on a higher floor with a kitchenette and a great view over to the canal at the rear.The room was exceptionally clean and comfortable and the staff were extremely friendly and accomodating. The room rate was a snip compared to other hotels in Waikiki. The shops were literally 2 mins walk away and the beach maybe 10 mins. Would highly recommend.

We recently spent 10 days at the Ilima Hotel. The staff were always friendly and helpful.The rooms are very large and being self contained made the difference of not always having to go out for meals. It is conveniently located to Waikiki Beach as well as bus stops. This was the second time we have stayed at this hotel and would certainly go again

We stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment for 6 days. It is located near busy Kuhio Ave, where many buses pass by. We took the buses to airport, aquarium, bishop museum, downtown, Ala Moana, etc. Very convenient and save on taxi fares. Canal view is nice, but ask for full view, because there are rooms that have full view, and there are rooms like ours that can only see a small portion of the canal. I didn't specify clearly, so can't blame them. The room has an adequate kitchen, but a few items were missing. Also some cutleries are a bit old. Once sofa bed is opened, the living room does not have much space for walking. There is a laundry basket provided, and it was very helpful to me for collecting the clothes at their coin-operated washer and dryer at the P3 level. Maid service was daily and good, clearing our rubbish and food waste promptly. They also have a pool, and a fitness room with a treadmill, a bicycle and a sauna room. I like the cultural activities such as staff singing and lei making that they organized. There is also a vending machine and a tour desk in the lobby. The front desk staff were professional and helpful, but I disagree that everyone is friendly. Some can do better with a smile and greeting when guests pass by. But what stand out is still its location, walking distance to many eateries, shops, international market, beach, etc. Yet far away to have a quiet environment. I would recommend this hotel for families on holiday.

It was absolutely disgusting. It was for layover and got there after midnight so didn't have a choice otherwise I would just take off. I picked it because of free parking, but of course arriving this late there was no parking. Ended up parking on the street and getting up early for meter parking. Inside of room has nasty order and everything is just old. We were afraid to touch anything. The last time we had to stay place like this was old motel in hollywood after partying, that was 20 years ago! One good thing about this place is front desk lady, she was so nice.

My fiance and I stayed here for two nights before we went on a cruise around the islands on NCL's Pride of America. I would highly recommend both the hotel and the cruise to anyone!I requested a good view when I booked the hotel online, and they gave us one -- the 16th floor facing the ocean. Granted, Ilima is a few blocks back from the beach and there are a lot of huge buildings in the way, but you could see the water and sunset/sunrise perfectly. We loved hanging out on the balcony. The decor and furnishings are very 60s/70s (for instance, the balcony floors are hot pink) but they were half the charm of the place. The hotel's kitchenettes allow you to cook for yourself, and there is a Food Pantry a few blocks away for groceries. There's also a laundry room available.People who want to save money, don't require many frills, like to be left alone by staff and want to be within walking distance of all the great restaurants and shopping in Waikiki will love this place just as much as we did!

We stayed at the Ilima for 9 nights. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone. We had a moderate studio with two beds and a kitchenette. Our room was very spacious. We were on the 6th floor. We had a lanai where we could go out and sit. Rooms were very clean. Would definitely stay here again on our next visit. Having a kitchenette really saved us money on food as it is expensive to eat out. We were two blocks from the beach and shopping. Great location.

I only stayed on Oahu for 1 night and didn't need anything fancy.I paid $125+tax.For the price, I was expecting1. stains on blankets, sheets, pillows2. sticky tables, chairs, etc3. dirty bathroom4. weird smells in room.And my expectations were all right. But that's fine. Like I said, I just stayed 1 night.On the upside, the staff were all really nice and helpful.Also the location is super convenient.Would stay here again if I only needed to crash for 1 night.

Friendly hotel in a quiet side street of the main throughfare of Waikiki: close to shops and beaches.Very spacious rooms with fully equipped kitchen. Although a coffe machine is provided, no coffee, creamer, Sugar etc. is provided (as is yet the case in most other hotels).The special attraction of this hotel is the fact that free parking space is available. Early November sufficient lots were available, but that may be different in high season.Although still pretty stiff, the room rate was quite compitative for Honolulu (especially considering free parking).

The only two good things about this hotel were the staff and the location. The staff is extremely friendly, and you can't beat being a 10 minute walk from the heart of Waikiki. Beyond that, this hotel was a huge letdown. Our room smelled musty, and even after leaving the window open for hours, the room still smelled awful. I mentioned this to the front desk, and they offered to change rooms but this new room also smelled just as bad. I have read other reviews that mentioned other guests staying in musty rooms so this issue obviously has not been addressed. The bed was like a rock, one of the most uncomfortable beds I've ever slept on. It was not possible to get a good nights sleep. The whole hotel is very dated, and the rooms are disgusting. The bathroom is all white and feels like an operating room, while the bedroom has peeling wallpaper and visible mold. This was a cheap place to stay, and now I know why. I would NEVER recommend anyone stay here unless the hotel does a complete remodel.

My wife and I both loved this place. In the heart of Waikiki just three blocks from the beach, this place is a steal. We stayed here twice in a studio (rooms 1401 and 1407) and loved the view of the canal, golf course and the mountains behind Honolulu. The room was very spacious with a king bed and a full size bed. It was clean and comfortable. Staff was very friendly and helpful. High end shopping (Prada, Chanel, Coach, Gucci, etc) were within close walking distance as was the pervasive ABC Store and Royal Hawaiian Center (a large open end mall) and street vendors. Jimmy Buffet's Restaurant was 2 blocks away as was Da Big Kahuna's (burgers, etc). PJ Chang's, Cheesecake Factory, Honolulu Cookies are in the Royal Hawaiian Center and many restaurants and other shops. A steal at $120 per night! If we go back to Honolulu, we will not even consider another place.

I booked a studio for myself and my husband and a two-bedroom suite for my son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren, 10 and 5. Our studio was absolutely fine: a large room with two double beds, kitchen and small dining table. The two-bedroom suite was hardly spacious: the children were in single beds, which was absolutely ideal, but the double bed in the bedroom was not big enough to comfortably accommodate my son and daughter-in-law - who are not fat - and they made use of the pull-down bed as well. I can't imagine how six adults could feel comfortable in this suite. The hotel has a pool but it is very small and has very little space around it to sit. The hotel is within easy walking distance of Waikiki beach, restaurants, the supermarket, and the staff were extremely helpful and pleasant.

We had a very pleasent stay at the Ilima. Friendly staff and a very spacy room in a very good condition. Nice guy at the front desk (Robin). Every time a good feeling to come back home in that hotel - and got one of the free parking slots. We will be there, if we are another time in Honolulu. Wish you all the best.

The Ilima hotel in the Waikiki area of Oahu Hawaii is a very spacious suite hotel. We, a famliy of six adults had enough space. The kitchen was fully equipped. Two separate bedrooms, one pull down bed in the living room. One badroom. the hotel staff is very friendly. Hotel is situated on walking distance of Waikiki beach. Tip, walk 10 extra minutes to the left and you are at the less crowded area's. Around the corner you'll find a Denny,s. One block away you'll find the cheesecake factory. And in between there are lots of bars, diners and restaurants, waiting to serve you. The hotel is a little old but very comfortably priced and has everything you need. My next visit will be at the Ilima again

We had an amazing time at the Ilima! Super-friendly and helpful staff and quick to help you out if needed. The rooms were huge and the kitchenette (fully stocked with pots/pans/dishes) was handy when we didn't feel like eating out. Blocks away from everything: beach, shopping, restaurants. We were on the 11th floor and it was so quiet! And the beds? We slept so well! Better than at home! The balcony was a nice retreat after a long day of sightseeing. The only con I have is that the pool was closed the entire week that we were there, and there were no other pools at nearby hotels that we could use. But we would definately stay at the Ilima again.

We had a 2x bedroom for 5x nights with four adults an one child. It was great location close to everything you would need. Pool was great. Free wifi an parking all fantastic. Staff very friendly!!! Beach close an lovely to swim at. Just a walk down dukes lane across the road an down an alley way an ur there . Closer than I had thought. Rooms clean an tidy. Air con a lil noisy but that's the only thing could fault but its nice to have cool air. One room didn't need air on on at night as it had the wind from the mountain side. Had a balcony that looked down the street. Which was nice an u could see the pool next door . An also the top of the royal Hawaiian hotel. (The pink one on the beach). Would recommend to give this place a try don't be a snob an dont judge a book by its cover!!! Had a great time here.

Perfect for us cos we are a bit dated anyway - asked for quiet room with a double - got a quiet room with two doubles . Staff friendly & helpful location perfect just a block from international market & 2 blocks from Royal Hawaiian. All required facilities in room with view - see pic.

This hotel is in a great location with a short distance to centre of town, International Market and beach. The room was quite spacious with a kitchen facilities- oven ,microwave, etc. ( of these we only used microwave once as we ate out most of the time.)There are plenty of restaurants close by. The balcony was nice but we only had a view of the roof of the nearby apartments. The staff were friendly and helpful and there was a concierge for booking tours etc which was handy. I our room the air-conditioner didn't work properly and the room became stifling. However, it was partly our fault that we didn't report this and it may have been able to be fixed easily.

We stayed at the Ilima for two nights in October, 2013. Overall, it was average. The rooms were very large but terrible views (on the 4th floor). We actually overlooked a parking garage and what appeared to be the back of some stores or homes so it was difficult to keep the curtains open. You could hear noise from the outside but it wasn't too bad. The rooms are old and dated and does not 'feel' clean. There were some kitchen supplies but it wasn't extensive. On the plus side, the hote reception staff were very good....very friendly and helpful. If you are looking for a budget hotel (we paid $120 per night) or staying for a day or two, then this is okay but I wouldn't stay here for long term. The location is good....only one block from the main street....close to a grocery store/Starbucks/Subway restaurant.

We stayed in the Ilima Hotel in early October based on the positive ratings we saw on Tripadvisor . It is true that it is in a good location as far as being close to the "sites" in downtown Honolulu . It also has free parking (but I would bet the space for parking is inadequate during the "high" season). The rooms are large and generally clean. However, the entire hotel is in much need of an update. I felt like I had entered the 1950's or '60's when I walked into the room they assigned us. The refrigerator and stove looked like they were manufactured about 40 years ago and had long since seen their better days. There was an old safe in the room next to the bed that was inoperative. The room smelled musty (we were on an upper floor) and a fresh coat of paint was needed about everywhere. Finally, the hotel sits between a couple of buildings that appear to be somewhat run down and occupied by a few "questionable" characters. In summary, I think the ratings for the Ilima are too high. This hotel is not among the top 25% in Honolulu in my opinion.

The hotel is just down the street from wakiki beach and all that has to offer with shopping restaurants, etc. It is easy walking distance... The rooms are adequate with nice beds and ours had a kitchen. What made our room great was the balcony. It opened up onto a creek which is right off the hotel and has a golf course right behind it. We slept with the big glass doors of the balcony open with a perfect breeze and woke to watch a beautiful sunset every morning off the deck coming over the mountains. And in the evening it was perfect to commentate to the people we wtahced playing golf while enjoying a drink or too before or after we had dinner... P.S. Buying breakfast/lunch foods and cooking in the room saved us a ton of money.. there is a gym with maybe 2 machines and a small pool if you choose... we did not use

Walking distance to Wakiki Beach. They had a king size bed. The staff was very nice. They met all of our needs. Very functional kitchenette. The only thing not in the room was washer and dryer. But they were on location. Free parking, if you rent a car, but I wouldn't recommend it. To many places provide transportation, and there is an easy to use bus system, once you figure it out. Easy walk to shopping, food, entertainment, whatever you are looking for. Great value for the price, especially compared to others in the area. And most of them only offered a double or queen bed. That is baloney! Smoking too! If I ever do go back, will definately go here again.

As we were staying in Honolulu only 2 days, we were interested in staying a few blocks back from the beach. The room with kitchen was large and comfortable. The real advantage is the location as we could easily walk to the beach, restaurants, & bus & trolley stops. The staff was pleasant and helpful. There are interesting activities offered to guests. The hotel is off the large noisy busy streets, an advantage.

Ilima hotel, Honolulu.This hotel is ideally situated 2 streets back from Waikiki beach. Although it is showing its age and is a little outdated, it is excellent value for the cost. Staff were very helpful and courteous, and there is free wifi throughout the hotel and free car parking should you have a hire car. The rooms we very spacious and serviced each day and we had a balcony which gave a view to the south. The bonus of the kitchenettes is great as well. We would stay here again.

Ilima Hotel came onto my radar through Tripadvisor and other independent sources when I was searching for accommodation for a week lay over from a visit to mainland USA. I was acting as ‘tourist agent’ for our party of four and we needed at least a two bedroom apartment. Through a combination of position (not too far from Waikiki Beach), generally very good reviews and price I decided to book a two bedroom suite with full kitchen for a week. I was able to specify one bedroom having a double bed and the other bedroom having two singles.No matter where you are on Waikiki Beach it is quite a long trip from the airport. We arrived late one evening and took our chances with one of the many spruikers offering transport to Waikiki Beach. On arrival the hotel staff were very friendly and efficiently saw us into our apartment. The apartment was on the 7th floor facing the front of the building. It had a large lounge area, functional kitchen, the two bedrooms, bathroom and lanai (balcony). The apartment was serviced every day. While the furnishings were dated they fulfilled their purpose. Internet access was provided (we arrived on the day it became wireless accessible). There were 3 older style air conditioners.The main problem with this particular apartment was in the main bedroom. For the first few days I couldn’t work out why the air conditioner just couldn’t get the room down to a comfortable temperature. The ones in the living area and the second bedroom performed well. On close inspection I discovered that the louvre windows above the air conditioner were not closing properly no matter how much force was put into the handle that controlled them. As a consequence the hot air from the rear of the air conditioner was funnelling up through the louvres back into the room! While I could have notified staff about the problem I didn’t want workmen in our room, particularly if we were away (as we were most of the time).The Ilima Hotel has some interesting organised events that occur in the lobby. My wife took part in a couple of them. One was a lei making lesson where she created some beautiful leis. The second was a performance by a choir.Waikiki Beach is only about a 10 min walk and there are tons of shops around where you can get supplies. There is no restaurant on site. There is a small pool out the back.On our last day there we happened across the tour desk that has been manned by Alan for many many years. He is 88 years old. Chatting to him was one of the highlights of our stay at Ilima. We left very early the next morning in a taxi effectively organised by a very amenable Ilima staff member.

We received a very loving and friendly welcome on arrival.The service and helpfulness of the staff was simply overwhelming. One can trustful turn to the staff with any questions and concerns and they were all very welcoming and helpful. Very great was particularly pleased that despite environmentally responsible use of resources, was always made ​​sure that plenty of towels and shower and washing utensils were in the bathroom, which was very helpful for my uncle because his case was lost on the trip.The hotel choir singing for the guests in the lobby every Friday, was so beautiful and heart warming.A very warm ALOHA therefore to Karen, who made possible to me to move into a smoking room, and to Robin, who welcomed us so kindfull and friendly and helped us with the formalities for the missing suitcase, and to Jay, who gave me a free internet access and to all the others who have given us help, advice and warmth or made us a memorable stay with the Spirit of Aloha. MAHALO!Petra from Germany(Please excuse my bad english, I hope you can understand everything that I want to express)

We stayed here in a deluxe studio with kitchen from 9/4-9/8/2013. Room was very large, clean, and we had a view from the 14th floor of Waikiki and the ocean with the Royal Hawaiian hotel right in front of us. Did not notice any street noise as we were up so high. The staff here is super friendly and willing to help with anything. Just 2 short blocks through Duke's Lane and we were at the beach. Could not ask for a better place to stay for a family at a better price. the free parking is a terrific added bonus! The Seaside restaurant around the corner had reasonably priced meals if we didn't feel like cooking. We will defiantly stay here again when we get to Waikiki!

A Very friendly staff, the free overnight parking and a huge clean and quite room with a small kitchen made my stay in Honolulu to a great experience. The Ilima is well located in the heart of honolulu.

We stayed at the Ilima because we won a visit in a 1 bedroom suite at a silent auction. The suite was large and very comfortable. I would recommend it to young families as there was a pull out sofa in the living area and very well stocked kitchen.There is a self serve laundry area on the 3rd floor so if you are staying more than a few days - you don't have to pack as much, just wash things out and take less luggage- or at least leave room for all the new t-shirts you are going to be buying and bring home.Yes, its a bit dated, some nicer bedspreads would go along way to update it, and if management is reading this- the wall unit should go and the TV should just sit on the dresser so there is more room in the main living area.The bathroom had a jetted tub and good water pressure. The toilet was a good flusher which can make or break a hotel stay for me.Location was close to shopping and is you have rented a car you can enter and exit Waikiki from the back side instead of fighting all the traffic on the main road.If you are interested in a good, solid , functional hotel for a fair price - leaving you more money to spend on daily activities, then The Ilima is a great choice .

Overall, a good hotel. Location can't be beat at this price. No, you can't see Waikiki, but views of canal & golf course & mountains are nice & tropical. Just a couple blocks to busy Kuhio & Kalakaua Aves with their shops & restaurants & people watching. Another block or 2 to the beach, so definitely convenient without paying astronomical beach-side prices. Bathroom looked recently updated & was clean. Room wasn't anything special but was spacious and clean and having kitchen was a plus for doing your own breakfast and reheating left-overs from a restaurant, etc. AC worked adequately, and this room also caught trade winds well. We didn't have any trouble getting a parking place in their garage but might have had we taken it out at night (both times we parked we were in place by late aft.). All the desk clerks were very friendly & helpful; they have menus for local restaurants & a map of the local area which were both appreciated by us. Also, if you go to the beach, they have a bin of beach mats to borrow in the lobby. WiFi in room worked well.

For what this hotel offered, the value for money was excellent. Our room had great king size beds, complete with a kitchenette and a view of the mountains. Also, it is centrally located in Waikiki.I would recommend staying here if you are after a great base for exploring Hawaii, without the sky high price.

We decided to stay away from the Waikiki beachfront and were rewarded with wonderful views of the mountains, rainbows and fresh trade breezes. It was my fifth trip to Hawaii but my first in over 20 years, and my family's first. The Ilima staff were the best hotel staff we encountered anywhere, including mainland USA: friendly, warm and gracious. These were the values of old Hawaii which shone through. You felt you were at home and nothing was a hassle. We had a kitchen and plenty of space to spread out. We didn't have to spend big eating out as we had a supermarket only a short distance away. My son and I even got the chance to ride some decent sized waves on a surprise December south swell at Canoes, Populars and Queens, just five minutes walk away. I have already recommended the hotel to others. At the end of the day, it was a place where you could switch off, feel safe, comfortable and cared for...all at an affordable family price.Graeme, Caringbah, Sydney, Australia

Stayed for three nights (two stays) in early August. Receptionists were friendly and helpful, and I was allowed to leave my bag with them as I travelled light to Maui for a couple of nights in between. The hotel is a ten minute walk from the beach and the area is safe despite the proximity to a bar a few steps away. Wi-Fi worked well. The Standard rooms are a bit dated but very spacious. Even though I didn't use the kitchenette, I felt it'd be perfect for a family for a longer holiday. Prices were reasonable for a Hawaiian summer.

We stayed in a Deluxe studio for 3 nights August 26-29. We were on the 14th floor and faced the mountains and canal. The room was very nice (Yes, a bit dated but fine). But for the price we paid ($120/night) it was worth it. The full kitchen and dishes, etc. were very nice. There is a washer/dryer on the 3rd floor. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Always could answer our questions. It was great to get beach towels from the desk. The free parking was nice and we always found a spot but we did not come back in late at night. It was a 3 block walk to the beach. If we ever go back to Waikiki we will stay here again. The only drawback was that the pool was closed the entire time we were there for maintenance. Since it was a really small pool...not sure why it took a week to "Maintain".

Stayed here in a delux studio for a week. Room was spacious for a family of 4. Beds are comfortable, kitchen is stocked with daily necessities, bathroom is clean. The only drawback is the kitchen cabinets are dated and should be replaced with more modern materials. Location is convenient; just down the street from International Market Place and shops along the major streets. We were planning to do some cooking at our unit to save some food bills, it turned out that around Waikiki, there are tons of places to eat, especially with our low budgets, so we did not cook at all during our stay. The other minor drawback is the window AC unit is a bit noisy, but we slept through the night without problems. Generally, a very pleasant hotel with very helpful, friendly staff.

Probably, it is not only in this hotel, but in general in Honolulu that the well-known Aloha spirit is missing. We did not feel welcome when we checked in ilima. We could have got a smile, since we paid money, couldn't we? The furniture was of 80-s style, but that was fine, as it made us feel as if we appeared in old good time when movies about Hawaii were made.The room was clean. The air conditioner was rather old and noisy. When we turned it off and opened windows, the noise of cars serenes was not any better.Location was good and it took us about 10 minutes to get to Waikiki beach and a couple of minutes - to city souvenirs market.

I needed two reasonably priced rooms and booked this based on Tripadvisors reviews and wasn't disappointed at all. Sure, it isn't 5 stars, but for the price and location you really can't beat it. Rooms are spacious and clean. We got views of the Ali Wai Canal, golf course and mountains which could not have been any better. Rooms are a tad worn, but being one block from the International Market place and 2 blocks from center of Waikiki and the beach make up for it. The street that the hotel is located on is quiet during the day, but the evenings along with Kuhio Ave tend to get a tad seedy since there is a local tavern and tons of tourist, but we never felt unsafe. Bathrooms looked renovated. Rooms included full refrigerator, stove, microwave, coffee maker, cook ware and utensils. Staff was pleasant and helpful. The only downside would be the small pool and it is an older property but well maintained. Starbucks and Denny's was one block from hotel plus convenience store on same block. Foodland Supermarket was 2 blocks from hotel.

We thought we were being smart by trying to save money by booking a hotel that was a few dollars cheaper per night than more reputable and more recently refurbished hotels. We were wrong. It just wasnt worth it. The entirety of the hotel gave off this dingy, grimy feeling that never really allowed us to be comfortable. The rooms were an ok size but desperately need updating. We were hoping to take advantage of the free parking but found that it was almost impossible to get a spot! We ended up just going to a pay lot a few blocks away because we just didn't want to bother with it anymore. The staff were somewhat nice but mostly just seemed bored and uninterested - I feel that sums up the hotel. Shabby and rundown and not any real value. We would not recommend.

We were in HNL for 6 days rather than the initially expected 2 days and were glad we had picked the Ilima. It is near the canal rather than the beach but conveniently close to restaurants, food stores and transport. Our 16th floor room had a good outlook, was large and had a full kitchen. Kitchen cupboards were old but most appliances fairly new making it easy for us to eat in when we wanted. We also appreciated the good guest laundry and helpful staff. Very good value for Waikiki.

My wife and I flew in late and needed a cheaper place to stay before we drove up to the north shore the next day. Hotel was in a good location and clean. It's a little outdated and needs some new beds but it had what we needed. It would be a good place to stay if you were in Honolulu for a while as the rooms have full kitchens in them.

The Ilima Hotel was handy to all amenities. Within walking distance (2 blocks) to Waikiki Beach, close to restaurants and shopping. The bus stop was one block away and only a five minute walk with buses going to both ends of Honolulu. The Ilima Hotel had large rooms with a queen and king size bed. There was a kitchenette with tea and coffee supplied, a stove, microwave, toaster, pot, pans, etc - everything to cook your own meal.

This was our first stay and It will not be the last stay very Friendly staff. There is a washer and dryer and that helped out greatly. The room is very large with frig , table and sink. The pool is small but we didn't go there for that. Had a great time....

This was our 2nd stay at the Ilima and we can`t wait to come back again !! The staff lives the "Aloha-Spirit"; we really felt like a part of a big "ohana" (family). They always wished us a nice day when we left and greeted us with a smile and "Aloha" when we came back. We had a deluxe-studio on the 12th floor with a great view towards the mountains and the Ala Wai canal. Rooms: are really big; beds very comfortable (we`ve got a waterbed at home, so our backs are a little bit fastidiously because of that). Kitchen is a little bit old, but everything works.Enough dishes and cookware exists. You get free dish liquid and cloth (the room service fills the dish liquid up when its empty). Enough space in the closet for suitcases, so that you needn`t put them in the room the whole time. Bathroom has shower and tub; very clean-we never saw a single cockroach oder other insects during our stay in 3 weeks. Room service really cleans well. Everytime enough fresh, soft towels.Noise: Very quiet-never heard any other guests; noise from outside was only from police cars and ambulances (hey, it`s Waikiki and not a lonely beach). Never heard drunken people.Pool: Little nice pool behind the hotel; there is also a little gym and a sauna. A separate sun deck is located on the 10th floor.The hotel offers a free kukui nut lei making class-it was really fun and we are really happy about our selfmade leis !! We also did sing-a-long with the hotel choir who sings every friday morning-that was also a lot of fun :-)You can get a free newspaper at the front desk every weekday, except sundays. Also you can get extra towels and beachmats for free at the front desk (so you needn`t buy them). Location: excellent-2 blocks to waikiki beach, 1 block to Duke`s Lane/Interntional Marketplace, 2 blocks to supermarket (Food Pantry), 1 block to restaurants and bus stops.We`ll definitely book the Ilima for our 3rd time !!!

What a wonderful experience! The room made me feel like I was on vacation and at home at the same time. Very comfortable as we had a FULL size refrigerator, which is invaluable having a teenage boy, a VERY spacious room, a table to eat at, a lovely lanai used both at night and the morning (faced the canal on the 15th floor), a KING sized bed and a double bed, free parking, free internet, and a 7-8 minute walk to the beach. We bought our food at the Food Pantry two short blocks away(much more reasonably priced than I was expecting), and used the kitchenette to eat all our meals. We did not have to eat out once during our 9 night stay which saved us a ton of money. The walk to the beach was pleasant as you can always find shade if you choose your route properly. The area was very safe, extremely close to everything, quiet....well, what else can I say? Loved it! Was it luxurious? Not exactly. The paint job and the wallpaper could potentially bother you if you are picky about that kind of thing as it showed it's age a bit and the kitchenette was dated but who cares? The full sized fridge and the conveniences of home triumphed over any minor asthetic shortfall. Everything felt clean, including the carpets. The towels were fluffy, the beds were nice, the staff were great, especially the awesome cleaning ladies, and the price was fantastic. I paid $120/night in July 2012 for the Deluxe room. I would stay here again in an instant, especially if I could get such a great price again. Can't wait to go back! Thanks, Ilima!

We stayed in this hotel for 15 nights in july 2013, and we had a wonderful time. The hotel is close to the beach and lokal busses. The room was big and clean with a nice view. The staff is very polite and helpfull. We enjoyed our stay here. The gym is a bit small, but u can go running down by the canal only a minute away.

First, I agree with all the positives of the other 4 and 5 ratings. This place is really very, very nice overall. I'll just add that 1) there was complementary in-room wifi, which is not what the booking.com add says, and 2) we had some rental car trouble while there, and the hotel staff really went beyond expectations to help us. We will definitely consider staying here again.

I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights prior my cruise from Honolulu. This hotel has a great location, because of walking distance to the Waikiki beach. In your room, you will have available full kitchen.Good hotel for reasonable fee.

After reading review and staying in Oahu a few times we decided to make this local hotel our stay for the 10 days. We were upgraded when we got there to a 1 bedroom suite, nice surprise:) We ended up on the 16th floor with a view of the canal and partial ocean. The parking in Waikiki is terribly expensive and it was so nice to have a hotel not charge. The spaces are tight but we had a mid car and it fit fine. We were there 4th of July week and found a spot every night. The hotel is older and the rooms could be updated but they were very clean and the everything worked great. The hotel staff were so helpful, everyday we left they let us take towels from the front desk and beach matts. Every person I came across working there said hello and was very friendly. The location is perfect for walking to almost anything in Waikiki which we did every night. The lei making class was free and so much fun. One night we left the front door cracked I guess and a security guard rang our doorbell (yes they have doorbells) and let us know. I felt very safe at the Ilima:)We have stayed at the bigger resorts in Oahu and they are so packed and elevators take forever. I would stay at the Ilima every time over the big hotels.

An older property, but clean and the rooms are VERY big (the deluxe rooms), with a full -size refrigerator, sink, microwave, dishes, glasses, stove top, etc. I appreciated the large rooms. Parking is free (no small thing in Waikiki, which in other hotels is $25-$40 per night!), but it is tight spaces, and first come-first serve. Out of our seven night stay, we couldn't find parking for only one night when we came back after 11 pm or so. Very close to all the sights and fun in Waikiki. A short walk to the beach, close to food, stores, the International Market and two Starbucks. All in all, a great stay, and I would definitely stay here again.

The reviews are all correct. The hotel is old, but clean, with a friendly staff. We booked through Expedia which stated we would have free parking. It is free but it's first come first serve. We arrived at 11:30 p.m. one time and were very happy to find two spots. We booked a deluxe studio, which had a queen and king bed with a tiny full kitchen. We didn't cook but just used the microwave and had cereal in the mornings. We were rarely at the hotel and we weren't looking for a resort, thus this place was perfect for us. We were charged $14 for the use of a safe, which we thought was free. Internet was good and included. We could hear early morning noise from the street but it didn't really bother us. The air conditioner worked great and was a little noisy but nothing we worried about. The location is great! We plan on staying here in the future.

We chose this hotel to spend 2 night before going on board the Pride of America and did not want to spend too much money. This hotel fitted the bill perfectly. Despite its central location we had a lovely balcony overlooking the canal and views inland. We had a king size studio which was very well equipped but you would need to bring you own tea and coffee. There was plenty of space and comfortable beds. The hotel also has a self service launderette and swimming pool. Friendly reception staff. Nothing posh, but would definitely recommend this hotel if you are not too fussed about being straight on the beach.

How refreshing to see Courtni, Drina, Emi, Robyn and many other staff who I remember from my previous stays. The personnel are all friendly and out to please you. The rooms are clean and spacious with a very useful kitchenette. There is free internet in the rooms and free parking (first-come, first-served basis). Also, you rarely hear noise from neighboring rooms (rare in most hotels). This hotel is one, of perhaps a handful, that still has rooms set aside for us smokers. Most hotels went totally "smoke-free" some time ago, even though they can set aside 20% of their rooms (with certain stipulations) in HI state law. Even if I wasn't a smoker, I can't see how going 100% "smoke-free" could ever be a smart business manuver for a hotel.My visit was from June 19th through June 10th and was my third stay at The Ilima. This hotel is the "perfect fit" for me. Guess what? I've already made my reservation for next summer!

Stayed there for 4 nights in June (they were very nice and let us check in early when we arrived on Sunday). Clean large room with a balcony, close to the beach and all of Waikiki, decent price, parking included in room price, nothing really negative to say. Could use some updating throughout the hotel but other than that it was fine. We would stay there again.

I booked our hotel based on the reviews and I was definitely glad I did. This was our first trip to Hawaii and Ilima Hotel made it a fantastic one! The staff was friendly, the room was clean and the kitchenette was a huge plus! Location was perfect - just a few blocks from everything. I would recommend requesting a room facing the mountains and canal. Previous reviewers recommended it, but I forgot to mention it. The balcony was pleasant but the view could have been better. Such a minor mention compared to the cost and service! Don't pass this gem up!!

We had one night here as a break in a trip from Brisbane to New York. The Ilima met all our needs - the location is excellent and the price is good for Waikiki. There's plenty of room, we used the kitchen facilities and they gave us a late check out until after lunch. The street it's on is a bit basic but that did mean that it was quiet and the curtains were dark so we slept well.

My wife and I and other members of our family recently booked a Hawaiian cruise and needed a place to stay both before and after the cruise. My daughter's mother-in-law found this hotel and booked it about a year in advance of our trip. Our rate was $100.00 per night for an efficiency room that included a refrigerator, a microwave, a stove, plates, cups, glasses, utensils, a flat screen tv, air conditioning, a pool, a sundeck and free parking in the adjacent parking garage, And I've probably forgotten something. Oh yeah, there are numerous inexpensive shuttles from Honolulu Airport to this hotel. One such shuttle was $8/person.The hotel is located within walking distance of a large variety of restaurants and shops in all price ranges, and is also within walking distance of Waikiki Beach. And just to make things a little easier, Enterprise Car Rental is literally across the street. I'll do a separate review on them at a later date. (They were great).The staff were extremely polite, helpful and professional, and had answers to any "touristy" questions we posed to them.With a little planning, you can save a lot of money and be very comfortable at this hotel.

I booked the Ilima for my work trip last month. Second time in 2 years. Pretty much the same comments from last time hold sway: The Pros - 1) A Bargain, 200 bucks a night got me a suite with a Kitchenette. 2) Free Parking (though one night I was forced to park on the street and got a parking ticket. Spaces are also challenging - tight and lots of concrete stanchions to avoid. 3) Perfect proximity: Close enough to walk to all the Waikiki destinations, but not so close that you are sucked into the vortex of insane crowds and valets and whatnot. 4) Very friendly staff.The Cons: 1) Dated. Material condition issues like a window AC unit in my bedroom that wasn't keeping up. But most nights, the breeze was so nice that I just slept with the window open.For the value and location, budget-minded travelers can't go wrong with the Ilima.

Having now stayed with the Ilima Hotel on many occasions we thought that it's time to provide others with the benefit of our knowledge, having stayed here over many years.The rooms are among the largest in Waikiki and certainly the largest in their price-range and although some rooms could use an upgrade the room sizes, staff and hotel location far outweigh the downside. Every time you check in as a returning guest you are greeted as a close ohana member.The hotel has a small pool, gym and limited parking and the Friday morning staff sing-along is a nice touch.Located around the corner from a bus stop in Kuhio Avenue it is only a short walk through the International Market Place to Kalakaua Avenue and a stroll to the beach.It's always nice to return to the Ilima.

We arrived late at night but were greeted very warmly by the reception staff. The room looked like it was still 1960s or 70s but was very clean. Then came morning, I went back down to the concierges area, and there was a 90 year old staff member sitting at the desk with a huge portable typewriter and a very old phone. He was wearing a tweed jacket and it looked adorable. I loved it. It was like being transported to 1960s. Our 3 days there and nights there went without a hitch. Easy access to the the market place, beach and a good laundry area inside the hotel were a plus.

Ilima Hotel was in a good area, two blocks or so from the beach, near all the top stores and marketplaces. But it was also just enough away from these places/areas to give you some peace and quiet. Staff were friendly and courteous. Only issue with the hotel, and the reason it didn't get a five rating, was the hair left in the bathroom from the previous guests. Yuck. Housekeeping was in general good but this was just wrong. When you get in after long flight at 11pm this is not what you want to see.

My wife picked this place because of the location in Waikiki, and the price. We had never been to Honolulu before and were willing to take a chance on an unknown hotel. We were very happy with the decision. From the outside it looks dated and the lobby is reminiscent of the 1960's. The staff was very friendly and quickly processed our reservation. When we got to our room it was more than I expected. Rooms were very large, it had a kitchen area, a nice table for sitting, bamboo furniture (which I thought was very cool), and a nice balcony. The only problem I encountered was that the parking spaces were small, but we rented an Escape so our car fit perfectly. Excellent location, easy access to restaurants, beach, and all places you might want to venture.

Stayed here 2 nights, 1 each end of a 3 week trip to the mainland.Chose this hotel as going by other reviews this is the better end of Waikiki to stay.Very good location & quality for the price with an easy walk to the beach, shopping,markets, eateries.Huge room with a very good kitchen area. Bathroom a liitle more cramped but totally adequate.Furnishings are in keeping with the price but once again totally clean, tidy & well kept.Air conditioning was a little noisy but you would get used to it after a couple of nights.Very pleasant staff.Definitely recommend this hotel if you are wanting a cheaper place to stay to save your money for tourist activities & dining.

I'm glad I read reviews & booked this hotel based on those reviews. The location couldn't be better, staff's knowledge of things to do, buses to get etc was great. The staff always acknowledged you with "Aloha" almost every time you walked in or out which was nice. The room was huge, with a deck (for smokers). Do visit the Cheesecake Factory to have lunch or dinner....it is superb!!!...unfortunately I was told about this place on my last day:(The only downside for me was that the pillows were too flat for my liking.

Well, what a bittersweet vacation! I stayed at Ilima Hotel with my family from May 24-June 1, 2013. We arrived to the hotel with a full parking lot. Apparently, the parking is full due to locals taking advantage of the free and limited parking spaces. Anyway, after circling around forever, we checked into our rooms. We booked a 2 bedrooms with a kitchenette. This was ok for a family of 5. The room was a bit smelly; but it was livable. The couch that turns into a bed was a bit revolting. The mattress had black spots, which possibly could be molds. The air conditioner in the living room had some molds growing out of it too. My parents room near the balcony had duct tape as a way to keep the cool air in. As for bed that I slept in, the bed pulls down from the wall unit. I noticed on my bed sheet- there was a yellow beige spot on the right side during the last night. It was the size of a golf ball. This definitely shows the quality of housekeeping service. Overall, the service of cleanliness is very questionable. Each day we would go out to enjoy our activities. One day we noticed that our towels in the bathroom were not cleared out. I had to contact the front desk to ask for the housekeeping to come. This happened 2 times. The housekeepers came one day around 3 pm. The reason why I remember the time is because I called to ask when they will be arriving to clean our room and give us fresh and clean towels.On the last day,late in the evening, I started packing and found that my jewelry was stolen including my white gold ring with diamonds!I went downstairs to report the incident and then called the police. The front desk lady debated for a while to call the police. She asked her colleague for help on this situation.The front desk lady told me to speak with the morning front desk lady. Finally, I had her call the police and they came at 1245 am. I reported the case to the police. I informed them that the jewelry where it was stored. The police was given of the time frame when the housekeeper could come into the room. After the report, the next day, the rude front desk- Eme would not help out on the situation. She knew more information about the jewelry than me. She informed me to contact Jay ( assistant manager). All the staff were dodging questions. The housekeeping supervisors would not handle the situation-- Davina and Nana ( supervisors of Housekeeping) would not give me the housekeeper's name and stated that it was written policies . I asked to see written policies , and Eme would not give it to me. Obviously, they are protecting the thief.I found out that the night front desk lady spoke with the specific housekeeper. Apparently, the housekeeper knew what it looked like. This was the same housekeeper that has been cleaning our room for the week. Jay ( Assistant manager) returned my phone call in a couple of days. He states he interrogated the housekeeper... I am not sure why he will not let me speak with the Head manager,Please be advised-- Ilima is located in sketchy area and the housekeeping staff are thieves!! Ilima hires thieves!

Great stay at the Ilima. Stayed here because it was reasonably priced (Waikiki is very expensive) but still had good reviews. The reviews were correct. Quality hotel, nice staff, and good location for exploring. Decor is not fancy but clean and the room was very large. Nice flat screen tv with true HD picture, which I was not expecting, and good WiFi. Family loved it.

Hi everyone. Just returned to Toronto after an awesome May 22-30 vacation in Oahu, Hawaii (Honolulu/Waikiki Beach). Once again stayed at the Ilima Hotel - wonderful staff here, friendly & helpful plus spacious rooms with amazing view of canal and mountains, 14th floor suite! Close walking distance to just about everything. Tour buses pick you up at front entrance of hotel and regular bus service stops are nearby. Take the free trolley to the Hilo Hattie's store! My first visit to Honolulu was 2 years ago, my boyfriend's first visit was in 1974 - this was his 6th visit! Could go on and on about how beautiful Oahu is! :D

When traveling, me and my wife stay all day out.So, our expectation regarding to Hotels are: good price, good localization and a clean and secure place to stay.All these points we've found at Ilima Hotel.The friendliness and courtesy of all employees of the Hotel, with guests, were fantastic too.

We stayed here for 1 week in May. The place was better than expected- all the staff were local and super friendly. We had a room on the 14th floor with a pretty nice view of the city, and sorta view of the ocean, overall not bad! The location was great!!! Right outside of Kuhio, its only a short 5 min walk to the beach, and tons of food options nearby. We ate everyday at the international market.

In April of this year my wife and I paid our third visit to Honolulu and we have stayed at the Ilima each time. It is not on the beach but is only a 10 minute walk. The walk takes you through the very interesting Duke's Lane which is basically part of the International Market. Transit stops are a five minute walk, and it will take about 25 minutes to walk to Kapiolani Park with its zoo and aquarium.The hotel itself is not new, in fact it is over 40 years old and like many hotels of that era has very large rooms. We always have stayed in a studio but one-bedroom and two-bedroom units and penthouse suites are also available.All units include full kitchen facilities with the only thing missing being a dishwasher. The studios have two Queen size beds, a 32-inch HDTV connected to a satellite service and, dining table and chairs, dish and cutlery service for four, good storage room and a pay safe.Nothing can be said about the front desk staff except that they have to be among the most friendly and anxious to please people in the hotel industry anywhere. Maid service is of a normal level and maintenance are quick to respond to requests for service. The hotel also has limited free parking, a rarity in Waikiki. Free WiFi was being installed while we were there.There is a down side. If you want a hotel with a full service business center, a large pool and great gym facilities this is not the hotel for you. Additionally, this year we found that the south-facing rooms were quite noisy on Friday and Saturday nights because of the presence next door of a hotel favored by the younger crowd and a bar just up the street. These had not been a problem in previous years. There is no restaurant on site.The bottom line is: Would we go back to the Ilima? The answer is a very strong yes.

We've stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks in May of 2012 and went back for 2 weeks this May. Yes, this is an older hotel, but it's very clean, has a lovely staff, and free limited parking. It's limited because there are only about half the number of spaces as there are rooms. If the lot is full, you can park across the street for about $20. We never had to do that though even when we came back late but May isn't considered high season so during high season, you might have to either get back a little earlier before the garage fills up, or pay. With parking costing anywhere from about $20 to $35 at all other hotels, this is a great plus for the Ilima, even if you have to pay somewhere else a couple of times. Also it's located right off the Ali Canal which has free street parking and you might luck out finding a spot there. Just remember to move your car in the morning as there are I thing about 3 hours that you can't park for street cleaning, so see the signs. Basically, all the rooms are the same except the higher up you go, rates and bed sizes are different Before staying there our first time, we read a review or two about roaches. In both of our stays, we never saw this. In fact, having worked as a telephone repairman for 40 years and entered thousands of homes and apartments, I'm able to tell if there are any telltale signs of insect problems and I say disregard any old reviews stating that. LOL, in May of 2011, we stayed at the Ilikai and guess what we saw? Not an infestation, but a couple here and there. The rooms are kept very clean but the furniture is somewhat dated, but plenty of space for your clothes. Beds are comfy and we were so impressed with their pillows, we looked at the tags and ordered some for home, which we just got today. There's free wired or WIFI in every room and this year a large flat screen HDTV (can't remember if we had that last year). There are either two double beds or a double and a king. There's a kitchenette with a full size fridge, stove with oven, micro, pots, pans, dishes and utensils so if you want to cook in, you have everything you need, along with a dining table and chairs. A desk for your laptop with a slot to plug in your Ethernet cord. Bathrooms are nice and they supply soap, tissues, shampoo, etc. Balconies are big with two chairs and a small table. This is one of just a few hotels in Honolulu that has smoking rooms which are isolated to just two floors, so if you're a smoker, another plus. If you're not, you won't smell it anywhere else per my wife who doesn't smoke. The pool is very small but on both trips when we used it, it felt like it was our private pool cause it's not used much. Location? Perfect! Less than a block from the International Shopping Center, two blocks from Waikiki beach, easy to get to all highways. Plenty of the most popular restaurants within 2 blocks. Grocery store less than 3 blocks (Food Pantry). What else can I say? This is a little gem that doesn't get the ratings it really deserves, but if you want a nice affordable hotel to stay in, you'll be wasting money going elsewhere (unless you have a bundle and want to stay right on the beach). Charles & Phyllis N.Y.

Given the expensive price for Waikiki hotels, the Ilima provides excellent value - where our base rate was $110 per night for a Superior Studio for 2 adults and 2 children.Rooms were spacious with our room having a kitchen area and a full size fridge with a freezer, microwave and stove top / oven, and table with 3 chairs. Bathroom had a combined bath and shower, cable TV, balcony, although the 2 beds in the room were only doubles. The pool is a touch small although is ok if your family is the only one in it, although the hotel does provide pool towels.One major positive is free car parking (requires a ticket for your car at reception) - while some of the spots were pretty tight, it is worth noting the motel next door charged car parking at $25 per night. Wifi also had a decent strength in the room.You are about a 5 minute walk from Waikiki beach. Reception staff were very friendly and very helpful when I needed to amend my booking. The cleaners also did a good job. There is a coin laundry on level 3 at $1.50 per wash and a small gym next to the pool with an exercise bike and running machine where you need the key from reception.At the budget end I was also considering the Royal Grove and after walking past it, I was glad I chose Ilima.If you want to save money, I also found the A8 Airport Shuttle good at $30 (toll free 1800 387 1831) for up to 4 people, and Enterprise at 1221 Kapiolani Blvd (30 minute walk) had $9.99 per day weekend special picking up the car on Friday and returning on Monday - although it appears this has now gone up to $19.99 per day. By comparison, the Enterprise across the road from Ilima at 445 Seaside charges $62.99 per day for the same compact car. It is worth getting a car to check out places like the Waikele Premium Outlets and to drive around the island.

A friend and I spent 10 days at the Ilima Hotel (Apr 5-15). This is not a luxury hotel and it doesn't advertise as such. It is, however, in a great location only a short walk to the beach, shopping, and restaurants,We were on the 5th floor, with a view to the canal and the hills beyond. The room was large, clean, and adequate for our needs. The decor is dated but I didn't come to Honolulu to spend a lot of time in the room. We enjoyed having a full kitchen and generally had breakfast and one other meal at the room (generally on the balcony).The 10th floor sun deck is a great place to relax, read, and enjoy the sun. The pool (ground floor level) is small but adequate as it was never busy. There is also a few pieces of exercise equipment - we didn't use it as we spent most of our days walking.The last three days we rented a car and were able to use the free parking. That was definitely a bonus!The staff were courteous and helpful. There is a concierge on site most mornings - he took the day of his 88th birthday off when we were there!We definitely enjoyed at the Ilima and wouldn't hesitate to recommend as a great place to stay.

My family and I just spent 10 nights post cruise at this hotel staying on the 8th floor facing the canal. The rooms are huge with kitchen facilities and comfortable beds. The hotel is dated but clean with staff that actually care . Free parking is a bonus and we used this for 8 days with our hire car never had trouble getting a spot each day. This hotel is :About 800m to international markets , 900 metres to beach , countless restaurants nearby to eat from including chillis , big Khuna , Cheesecake Factory , fattys Chinese , every type of food within Walking distance of the hotel. Massage facilities within 100 metres which I would describe as one of the best I have experienced all over the world- kenko sokushin . For a family that is active and spends most of the time exploring the island it was a perfect and cheap considering its location. Friends stayed 400 metres way and payed 3 times as much and could only stay 5 nights. We enjoyed a full day at big island exploring the valcanoes with the savings we made. If you want to laze around a pool and be pampered dont stay here. If you want a practical hotel, clean , tidy and close to everything with options to do some eating at home . This is your hotel. Definitely be back.

Stayed here for one week, on the 16th floor, mountain/canal view in a Deluxe Studio. The room was really spacious with a kitchen, queen and king sized beds, table and chairs with extra room to spare. It is a short 3 block walk to the beach, and even shorter to shopping and restaurants. The canal is across the street, which is perfect for walking/jogging. If you have a rental car, the parking is free - first come, first serve, but we never had a problem finding a spot even coming back late at night. The staff was friendly and helpful and the really made us feel welcome. If you have the chance to take part in the Wednesday morning lei-making class (free to guests), do it. It was not only fun, but educational. When we come back to Waikiki, we will stay here again.

We spent only one night on our way to the north shore and had a two bedroom suite for 5 of us. Room was big, beds were small. Beds were hard, so were the pillows. Definitely a persistent musty odour throughout. The rooms are old and outdated but clean enough. Kitchen was adequate for cooking simple meals. Air conditioners were old and noisy but worked. Lots of street noise which even the loud A/C couldn't cover up but it quieted down early (although as mentioned previously, the garbage trucks did come through at 6:30am). Free internet was great with a strong signal and parking was also free (have never seen a pink parkade before!). Within easy walking distance of beach, shops and restaurants. Staff was friendly. Adequate for what you pay.

Pleasant, fairly basic hotel, but good value for money. We were on the 12 floor in a Deluxe Studio on the canal side. We stayed for 9 nights. Road noise at night was noticeable, but not of concern. Room had a King size bed and a double bed with a full kitchen. Consequently the room was quite large with room to relax. Individual room window air-conditioning units appear to be in all rooms and although noisy did a good job in the humid weather. Bathroom was a little old, but everything worked and it was clean. About a 10 min. walk to the beach and right in the middle of Waikiki. Reasonable priced Food Pantry supermarket was two short blocks away. Bus stop less than 5 minutes away. We travelled on a Roberts Shuttle from the airport for $13 each. Well organised and reliable. This is not the cheapest, but was bookable on the internet from Australia. Hotel arranged a return shuttle with Ilima Tours and Transportation for $10 each. Cheaper shuttles are available, but I was uncertain of their reliablity.

We stopped in Honolulu for three nights before continuing to Australia and Ilima Hotel worked out well for us. Excellent, convenient location with parking. Close to beaches and hotels for evening drink and entertainment. Close to canal for early morning jogging, and watching canoe races. We used this as a base for driving all over Oahu. We had basic kitchen facilities there which we enjoyed using as we bought most of our food at local farm market venues in and around Honolulu. Our room was clean, quiet and the staff is friendly. It worked out so well that we decided to stay there again on our return back to the U.S. Our second stay was as good as our first. Would definitely stay again.

Stayed one night 6th floor facing to the southwest. Very noisy and did not stop until 2am. Two twin beds, very hard mattress. and worn out pillows. With that being said, not good for a first time encounter. Good was clean, spacious, and close to the beach. Front desk employees just ok, not great. Coffee is not free. You are close to a roudy bar and x rated entertainment, but all of those characters left you alone when you walked by them.

We chose this hotel based on the the reviews on trip advisor and the decent price we found on booking.com. After staying at this hotel for 10 days I now wonder how many of these reviews are actually legitimately written by guests!? I was prepared for a budget hotel but this was far below what we were expecting. Lets start with the good:-Great staff (front desk and housekeeping). Friendly, efficient and helpful and willing to find answers for your questions if they didn't know.-Kitchenette is handy for preparing the occasional meal at the hotel (although in the end we only used it for several breakfasts and one dinner as we found going out to eat to be moderately comparable to the price of grocery store dinners - food is expensive in general)-Large room but mostly wasted space. The room could easily have accommodated a sofabed or similar.-Centrally located in Waikiki close to the international marketplace, buses, restaurants and Waikiki beach-Free parking (it is a bonus even if it is first come first serve and very tiny spaces)The bad:- We were charged the FULL amount of our stay upon check in. I have worked in the Hotel industry for ten years and have traveled the world and never have I had to pay upfront in a reputable hotel when they have a credit card on file!!! - The 4 cup coffee maker included in the room did not come with a pouch of coffee; front desk staff informed us that they charged $1 per hotel sample sized pouch of coffee. *Also took 1/2 hour for the 4 cup coffee maker to brew the little pot (kinda like watching paint dry).-We were charged $2.75 a day for use of the in room safe; however, nowhere is it posted that there is a charge for use of safe. Management has housekeeping check to see if the safe is being used daily; I find this practice EXTREMELY creepy and treading on a violation of my privacy whereas I am keeping my personal belongings in the closet as well.-Advertised wifi in the rooms before it was actually available. Will actually be available in the next 2 weeks.-Beds were uncomfortable, HARD as a rock and had very flat pillows. - Located in a sketchy part of the street. The bar in the building 2 doors down attracts some very seedy characters. I felt uncomfortable walking alone at night on this section of street, and was uncomfortable about the security of the parking lot at night. But if you are looking to purchase a date for the evening, we saw a few ladies of the night working it.The ugly:-Carpet stained- Stained up quilt-Corningware dishes from 1970's?- Ugly and outdated rattan furnishings.- Musty smell in room (yes I'm aware this comes with tropical destinations but a little fabreeze would do wonders)- "sun deck" on 10th floor is a rooftop with artificial turf that has guest rooms facing onto it. A less than appealing place to hang out.- small heated outdoor salt water pool is in the shade most of the day.I regret not cancelling the reservation as there were comparable deals for only $20-$30 more per night at beachfront much more reputable hotels on both travelzoo and bookit.com. I most definitely will not be staying here again nor recommending to others.

The Ilima is situated in the middle of Waikiki and is only a short walk to the shops and beach.Excellent staff and excellant service, hey its a little tired but so what the rooms are huge and the kitchenette helps to save money.A great place for families or couples and free wireless wi fi in all rooms from April 2013, at the moment its a cable in rooms.Hawaii is a beautiful holiday spot, go there NOW!

The room is old-dated but it was very spacious and clean. The staff was friendly and some very informative. If you needed anything they were efficient in getting what you needed. The location was very close to Waikiki Beach only a few blocks away. As well its so close to nearby restaurants. It was a block and half from Marukame Udon Restaurant. Awesome restaurant with fresh Udon - value for your money. Close to Starbucks as well!!

Very good location, easy to get to beach, International market. They gave us towels for the beach our room was very large, House keeping every day. Bus les than a block. Away. Thank you to staff for great service.

We just returned from spending a few days at the Ilima Hotel in Waikiki. Small, boutique, family owned hotel. The staff is excellent. They understand and practice aloha. Rooms are very large.Hotel is very clean and well maintained. Location is excellent. Excellent value. Highly recommended.

Lovely people, ready to help and provide any service.Perfect location to cover Waikiki in a couple of hours.The only adverse comment would be regarding the room: it is very large and convinient but some old fashioned.Consequently we rate 4 on 5

great location, walking distance to everything. the hotel needs a bit of updating though but very affordable. i wouldn't mind staying here again. they have free lei making classes every wednesday but check with reception to make sure!

Very friendly, accomodating staff! The rooms are large and spacious. The beds are small (doubles) and we were concerned but they were extremely comfortable. It is very dated but very clean. The location was great to walk to Waikiki Beach and shopping. We stayed two nights - one when we flew in and one when we flew out. We stayed ion the other side of the island the rest of the time. Chose this plce based on the price and location. We were not disappointed. If you want a large, clean, inexpensive room, friendly staff and don't care that the decor is dated then this is the place for you!

This review will sounds just like all the others. Yes...the hotel rooms need updating. But...if they did the updates, the prices would be unaffordable for most of us. As they are now, they are extremely clean and each day, the maids leave shampoo, soap, face cleaner and other goodies...amenities you would expect in a five star hotel. We had a one bedroom suite which came with a full kitchen, breakfast bar, two 32-inch flat screen HDTV's (in living room and bedroom), a stereo, two telephones and all the amenities we needed for our 10-day stay. The hotel itself is positioned right in the thick of it in Waikiki...just a couple of blocks from the beach and the room was just $198 per night with FREE PARKING...which is unheard of in a hotel in Waikiki!So when you're judging the worn places on the sofa and chairs, you just have to keep in mind that if you were looking at brand new furniture, you'd be paying over $350 per night. We flew first class in to Honolulu on Hawaiian Air....and the dated furniture didn't bother us in the least. Actually, we thought the room was quite charming....rattan and floral patterns suited us just fine. The most important thing I can convey, however, is about the food in Waikiki. If you want value in dining...get out of Waikiki. Be sure to find your way to Lobster King on King Street. Unfortunately, we only heard about it on our final day...but it was incredible. It's where the locals eat. In fact, I think we were the only non-Asians there. I ordered the roast duck for $11.95 and, as a lover of roast duck, I can say it was the best I've ever eaten.
