we travel quite extensively over the years and are quite accustomed to the fact that things can go wrong.With our stay at hotel Ilima we hit another bottom.First ,we ,ve got room just above garbage bin.Every morning, 6am, garbage truck gave us a nasty wake up.Noise from the streets prevented us from opening balcony or the windows.We asked for different room and was refused without trace of care,explanation, hotel full ,beside we,ve booked with Expedia and had to stay in ,,Expedia,,pool room .Warning Expedia rooms =crappy rooms.On 3rd day someone from hotel staff stole $380 from back pocket of my pants i left hanging in the washroom.Reported theft to manager,instead I feel sorry for you, he says -it never happened before-well,I,ve never stole money from myself either.I was well aware that theft is a national sport in Hawaii.they post warning signs everywhere,but left my guard down in the hotel.Lesson learned,hard way.From now on hotel Ilima is on our list places to avoid

This was our first trip to Hawaii. We weren't sure how our experience would be to stay in a hotel, which isnt an international franchise. But after reviewing the reviews on tripadvisor, we took the leap of faith! Thanks to all honest reviewers, we had an amazing time. The hotel is little old but well maintained. The staff is super friendly and willing to help. Lots of information available on concierge. Minutes away from Waikiki beach. Beach towels and mats are available for guests. They also offer various activities on site. such as make your own necklace.Room service is great. Rooms are mini-suite style. Really cozy rooms! I went with my wife and 2 kids. Waikiki, Oahu isnt a place where you want to stay in your resort all day. So you dont need accommodation like Caribbean resorts. You rent a car and you go to various places in the island. The best part of this hotel is FREE PARKING!!! Parking is really expensive in Oahu. So this is a plus. Its walking seconds distance to everything. Its actually nicer place to get out of Waikiki when you want to drive out. Other hotels beside it (i.e. Royal Hawaii, Westin) has trouble getting in and out for parking because its so busy around it. But this hotel is on calm street. The whole hotel is calm. Free laundry on site. Well maintained and bed-bugs free. Over-all I would highly recommend it. If want to spend money please go ahead and take other hotels in Waikiki but this is way better than any other hotels that I've seen.

We stayed here for 5 days in December 2011 and would highly recommend if anyone is looking for a clean place to stay with parking and within walking distance of Waikiki Beach. The staff here are lovely and there is free wifi in the lobby. It was great value and our room had a kitchen and was very spacious. The only down side was that one of the mattresses in our room was really uncomfortable to sleep on but the other one was fine. Also the hotel has an airport shuttle which is US15 each way per person.
We love the Ilima, roomy, well priced, very nice and helpful staff, complementary lei making class, great location. On site tight parking.

I stayed at the Ilima Hotel in Oahu with my husband, son, aunt, brother and sister prior to catching the Norwegian cruise through the islands on Dec 30th 2011. It is a very dated hotel. The hotel is very centrally located and it was easy to purchase food at a grocery store and find reasonable restaurants. There unit was stocked with pots, pans, cutlery and plates. The pull out Murphy bed was comfortable for my husband, son and I. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It was a little noisy but that did not affect our sleep. I will probably not stay there again. The two bedroom cost $370 for one night. Also, it isn't right by the beach.
Staff excellent,helpful, room clean,great view and very central locationolder style but for price,great value

I came to surprise my parents for Christmas and found the Ilima as I was searching for a place to stay. When I've been here before, I've stayed on the Beach Walk. This property was a change of pace. Situated on a quiet street facing the Ala Wai Canal, it is so much quieter than staying on the "strip." I requested a room on a high floor and away from children if possible. They gave me 1207. Great view of the canal! The room was large with a king bed and a double. Since it was just me, I slept on the firm king. Extra pillows and blankets were in the dresser. The furniture is dated, rattan and tropical looking. The AC was on when I got to the room, and it was a little loud, but the weather during this time of the year is so pleasant, so I kept it off the four days I stayed here and just opened the sliding door to the lanai. GREAT breeze! I barely heard any of the other guests on my floor and above me, except for the ventilation shaft near the kitchenette. I only used the small 4-cup coffee machine and microwave for breakfast every morning. But the unit contained the basics you'd need if you were inclined to cook.The room could use a renovation. It's so different from the Wyndham which I usually stay at. I'm sure when it first opened, it was considered the place to go. There was a flat screen tv which was the only modern item, free internet access (data cable), and lots of storage. If you plan on staying in your room to admire it's beauty, why are you visiting Hawaii? I only came back to the room to shower, change, and/or sleep. I bet if they renovated each floor, this would be the place to stay, but then again, those frills cost money, and they'd have to raise their rates. I love the "home away from home" feel here. The staff is GREAT! Helpful and friendly! After I came back from the beach, I noticed a crate of beach mats near the entrance that are available for guests. There is an onsite laundry facility, and my only issue was that you couldn't buy detergent there. Parking is FREE! However, it is limited, and one night, I had to find street parking. My advice is to explore early in the day, come back for the beach in the afternoon, and you're guaranteed a spot. Oh, and FREE daily newspapers! I didn't check out the pool since the beach is about 3 blocks away, I mean, why come to Hawaii to swim in a pool?I would definitely stay here again!

This hotel is not on or close to the beach, however it is within 3 or 4 blocks of a nice walk through International Market and the main shopping district to Waikiki Beach. It is a comfortable efficiency hotel on a quiet street with a beautiful mountain view from the unit I have stayed in three times now. The staff is both friendly and extremly helpful; there are even lei making and other activities planned should you like to join in the fun. The units are dated yes, but the rooms are cleaned daily and there is no noise to be heard! I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a place to come back after a day of beach or activity, make a quick meal or bring in the abundant take away food from around the area...kick back with a beverage and watch the lights on the mountain in the distance. This is a great place for families, couples and singles.

This hotel was fantastic value for money. The location was absolutely perfect for everything in Waikiki. This was our third visit to Hawaii but first time in the Ilima. We will definitely stay here again. The room was large with a great balcony and fabulous views over the mountains. There was a fridge, microwave and cooker in our kitchenette and the flatscreen tv had all the usual cable US stations. Three sundecks and a heated pool we never had time to visit and the same for the gym which , to be honest, I much needed to attend as I put on loads of extra weight! The staff are very attentive and friendly and are happy to help in all ways. I completely recommend this hotel to all.

Everyone, but everyone working at this hotel was friendly and went out of their way to make their guests happy. Rooms are very large and air conditioned, the hotel is extremely clean and the views from the higher floors are great. Looking forward to my next stay!The hotel itself is around 16 floors high and is a couple of blocks from the ocean. We had a deluxe studio which comprised a king and double bed and lots of space, just right for a 2+1 family. The room had a coffee maker, toaster, microwave, stove and fridge/freezer, which meant that we could create our own meals. Every sort of pot, pan and bowl was available too, along with plates and cutlery. All spotlessly clean. The only gripe on this front was that the stove was very slow to heat up.Be warned though that groceries in Hawaii are expensive, and it's not that much cheaper to make your own food, if it's a filling meal you are after. There is a supermarket a couple of blocks away if you do want to cook, but the food court at the nearby international marketplace serves up a large plateful of just about anything you want to eat for about $10.I'd recommend the free lei making classes at the hotel for everone - all sexes and ages will become engrossed.There is a small pool at the hotel that's good for a late or early dip. There's also a small gym and sauna. The hotel provides towels (and a beach mat if required) for sea or pool swimming.There's a self-service laundry (as with all of the hotel, immaculately clean...) so you can pack light and wash your clothes as you go.There are plenty of buses that stop within 100m of the hotel and the front desk will advise on which ones to catch. There are direct services to sites such as the Arizona Memorial and Hanauma Bay.The beds were very comfortable. There are chairs, table, various drawers and cupboards - the pictures on the hotel web site are accurate. Each room has a balcony, which can be bracing at this time of year - Ohau gets windy!Recommend? Without hesitation, especially for families or couples.

Enjoyed our trip to Honolulu and using the Ilima Hotel as our base. Read trip reviews and decided to book this hotel; decision was a wonderful choice. The staff was friendly, excellent housekeeping (our beach trips carried sand in, no matter how hard we tried to leave it in parking lots!), front desk helpful assisting locating nearby places for dining, shopping, sight seeing. Hotel offered free parking (a plus if you intend to use your rental car, come and go vs. paying valet to park and retrieve your car each time.) Most hotels charge $10 per day to park, in addition to room rate, plus valet. We wanted to enjoy our vacation and not blow the bank on things we felt we could control; using the Ilima allowed us to manage our budget without going overboard. Close to beach, felt safe walking around, far enough that the nightly trucks emptying trash bins didn't distribute our sleep. The hotel is located far enough from the Wakaki Beach tourist scene to watch where locals eat. A great opportunity to enjoy authentic food at reasonable prices!

I stayed at the Ilima on three different dates in October, 2011. The hotel is in a good location, close to the Ala Wai canal and just a couple blocks off the Waikiki main drag. The room was huge, the air conditioner worked great (via remote), had an in-room safe. The beds were firm, but I like them that way. The pool was under renovation but was able to use the sun deck. Very nice laundry facilities. Free parking. Everything in the entire hotel was clean! The front desk employees were amazing - accommodating and nice.

This was our second stay at the Ilima. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Good internet in the room, but wifi only in the lobby. The hotel was under renovation starting from the higher floors, so they had not yet done the renovations on our floor. This was very well organised so it did not disturb guests during the day. They also took care to inform you of any work that would affect your stay, like the renovation of the laundry.It is great value and a good location, close to all the activities, beach and well connected for transport by bus or tour bus. Many tours leave from around the corner, and most everything in Waikiki is within easy walking distance. We are looking forward to staying here at our next Aloha Festivals visit.

We stayed in a two bedroom, 1 bath room, that we booked after trying to book a second room on the beach and found that the price had skyrocketed. We enjoyed the balcony and the kitchen. We walked to the beach and had our pick of restaurants. I like the beach, but I'd rather save some of my money for other activities.

We booked through THE website, 5th night free. Around 95 bucks a night. That is a great deal. You get everything promised. Large clean room, well equiped kitchenette, 5 minutes off THE beach. Cons: no wifi in THE room. Tip: THE bar NeXT door has wifi and happy hour. THE Ilima hotel is à good deal.

My husband and I stayed in a Superior Studio Suite for 3 nights about two weeks ago. The Ilima is central to everything, is a short walk to the International Market Place, and it only takes a few minutes to walk to the where most of the shops are on Kalakaua Avenue. The room was large and it had a kitchen, microwave and full size fridge. Being a studio, the two double beds were in the same room as the kitchen. We had a good size balcony facing the Ala Wai canal, with a lovely view of the mountains and were in a room on the 9th floor, which was reasonably quiet.The maid kept the place clean and we didn't see any cockroaches while we were there, although there were cockroach baits under the bed.The staff there were all friendly and helpful if we needed anything. So, if you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel with no frills, you can't go wrong here.

good (a bit sketchy, but great distance to everything) location, rooms were ok, nice to have kitchen facilities as we were travelling with a baby. however when baby is crawling you notice more stuff on the floor, not horrible but not sparkling clean. building is dated, but it's a great value. would probably stay here again, as we spent most of our time outside and just used the room to sleep in. i think parking was free which was a plus.
Beds were very uncomfortable, TV did not work well and there was a cockroach in our room.

AAAAAwesome hotel. I believe the last reviewer mentioning pests in the hotel must be A:Nuts, or some jealous competition for the hotel. This is the cleanest hotel ive ever been in, and absolutely perfect for someone looking for a nice place for around $100/nt. We paid $107. It has a full kitchen in even the basic room we're in, oven/stove, comes with everything you need, dishes, pots, pans, apartment size fridge (not a little bar fridge), coffee maker, sink (w/garbeurator...!), cutlery, two queen beds. it's location is perfect we just park in their FREE parking (no trouble finding a spot so far) and walk around waikiki, theres a pub close by, dennys close by, beach close by, etc etc. SUPER CLEAN. the air conditioner is not noisy if you just turn the fan to low, even on high its not bad imo. You will NOT regret staying here. super friendly staff too. its not a honey moon resort kind of place, if thats what your looking for, but me and my girlfriend loved it and will absolutely return.

If you want a "spa" hotel on the beach, the Ilima Hotel, with it's delightful retro look, is not for you. Unbeatable value, free parking, large rooms, fully equipped kitchens, deck, dipping pool and friendly staff make it a great home away from home and base for exploring. For those who value heart over luxury and don't mind a short walk to the beach. Ask for a room on one of the upper floors on the canal side with it's amazing views and less city noise.

We've stayed in this small hotel in the heart of Waikiki a number of times and never been disappointed. The main reason we stay here is the size of the rooms and the price. The rooms are large studios with a kitchenette, well equipped and with full size appliances - ideal for those who don't wish to eat all of their meals out. This hotel has friendly staff, a travel desk, internet, a small quiet outdoor pool and exercise room. This hotel also has free parking. This hotel has a great location - 2 blocks from the Food Pantry, 1 block from Dukes Lane, 3 blocks from the beach. Just a few steps from the Ala Wai Canal, we had a north-facing room with gorgeous views of the canal, mountains and golf course and a convenient place to do our early morning walks. It was lovely to sit on the lanai with our morning coffee and watch the outrigger canoes going up and down the canal. This is a quiet hotel, especially if you can get a room that is not facing the street. We love this hotel and plan to stay here on our next trip to Waikiki.

So apparently I booked a hotel room at Ilima Hotel for 3: my boyfriend, myself and a damn cockroach.And apparently, Mr. Cockroach was a quiet, little thing because it didn't show up until my last day in Hawaii.Crawling. Dying. Right by the stove. Still convulsing. Still twitching. Still slightly alive.Sexy.I assume he was trying to warn me about Ilima Hotel because it seemed as though he found management's strategically placed poison (probably under the stove) and decided his last dying wish was to be seen.Well, HALLELUJAH, you got your wish!And to make matters worst, when I saw that his antennas were still fidgeting around, I screamed at my boyfriend to "take care of it" and he did so with an empty beer bottle.Classy.The absolute worst part of this situation? I told the front desk while we were checking out and all I got was an apology. Something like this:"Oh no. Sorry..."Serious? I was completely disgusted. And while some may think this was a one time deal, consider this:- There was an ORKIN TRUCK parked outside the hotel.- I found BUG TRAPS under BOTH our BEDS.The required 1 star is for:+ FREE PARKING: Parking spaces are like ones found in SF - CRAMPED. So WORTH IT if you have a car. So NOT WORTH IT if you park like an idiot.HOWEVER, I value my hygiene wayyyyy too much to stay here again. Not even free parking can lure me back!If you absolutely MUST stay here, do not pay more than $100/night.

My wife, son and I stayed at the Ilima from Aug. 9-12, 2011 and really enjoyed it. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room on the 14th floor looking west toward the ocean was great ... spacious, clean, with a nice small kitchen which worked well for our needs. The free parking worked out well for us, which was great, as it's next-to-impossible to find parking on the street. The Ilima is a short walk to the International Marketplace, Kuhio St. with its family-friendly and affordable restaurants, and also to Kalakaua and its higher-end action. Our only complaint is that our beds were a bit harder than we like, but it would not keep us from coming back on a future visit. All-in-all, a great bargain and a great location.

We spent 5 days in the Standard Studio suite in Ilima hotel. This is a large comfortable suite with very well equipped kitchenette. The room was very clean and tidy. It is located right in the heart of Waikiki (close to bus line, drugstore, restaurants, markets and the beach). It provides free parking which is “must have” in Honolulu as well as free high-speed internet access. Staff was very welcoming and friendly. We will surely go back there in our next visit to Oahu.

My stay was from July 19th to August 9th. Thanks to "Courtni" (a manager), I was able to get a smoking room for the duration of my stay! Pros: Smoking rooms available; Kitchenettes; Larger than average room size; Furnished lani; Daily housekeeping; Nice, well stocked bathroom; Great TV (with more channels than the average hotel); Quiet hotel (never heard my "neighbors"); AC had a remote control; Free morning newspaper; Free parking for guests (first-come, first-served); Convenient location; Friendly and very accommodating staff.Cons: are you kidding? I can't say there were any cons that warrant a mention here. ALL hotel staff were very nice and happy to accommodate their guests. I especially thought that Courtni, Drina and Robin went beyond "the call of duty"!I love this hotel and hope to stay there again!

For the price the location is really good. It's a bit old but charming in it's own way....the decor is a bit old and the air con is way loud if you turn it on. We just stayed in a higher room and left the louvred windows open at night. The staff are great. Friendly, courteous and lots of help.

Don't expect luxury or pampering during your stay at this hotel, this is a valuable hotel that provides clean and very large rooms (I was in the deluxe studio) with everything you need inside. There are 2 beds, a full kitchen (microwave and traditional oven included) a decent bathroom and a lot of space where putting your stuff. The location is excellent, you are two blocks form Waikiki beach in a quite area, rooms have air-con but they don't need it because from the balcony you get a wonderful breeze during the late afternoon and the night. The staff is very kind and there's also some activities you can do at the hotel.

First I will mention the good things....FREE parking, good location, very friendly and helpful staff, nice lobby and front desk area, can walk to the beach and the big marketplace, and large rooms. When we arrived we were impressed until we opened the door to our room. It was not terrible by any means just felt like we were back in the 70's. I think if they at least updated the kitchenette it would make a big difference. The burners were covered in foil and it all looked very old and worn out. The beds were just ok and the tv was a flat screen which was nice. I doubt we would stay here again but if you are on a tight budget it might work out for you.

There are lots of good things about this hotel. First there is the free parking which is rare in Waikiki. The front desk staff and all staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. Check in time is after 3:00, but we were able to check in at 1:30. Our room was clean and HUGE. All rooms have kitchens. On Wednesdays there are free lei making lessons that are also very informative with regard to the history of leis. It is a short walk to the International Market and shopping. On the negative side - the hotel is located in an older part of Waikiki. I had no problem walking alone in the area during the day, but I would hesitate todo so later in the evening.

Situated just off the main drag, you can see the hotel is old but they care about what they are doing.We had a room with a full kitchen,2 bedrooms and a living area.Good sized Plasma and a view of the canal and golf course.Bed is only a double and not great.They have a guy in the foyer each day with advice on tours and will also make your arrangements,really good service.We would stay here again if looking for self contained accommodation.

My wife and i stayed at the Ilima Hotel from the 26th of Feb - 10th of March of this year and loved every single day we were there, the staff were absolutely awesome and catered to our every need, we stayed in room 502 its huge and very tidy with two very comfortable double beds unlike other reviewers i wouldn't call the decor outdated but more classic with plenty character, our kitchenette was clean and tidy with a stove/oven, microwave,full size fridge, electric jug and had all the utensils needed to cook and enjoy a meal when all you felt like was a bit of home cooking,the room came with cane furniture which was nice and has a dinning table for four and also a 42inch? flat screen television. We found the maid service very satisfactory with our room being cleaned and beddings changed everyday, we had a balcony facing the Ala Moana canal and golf course we could also see Diamond Head which was a bonus so if you are deciding to stay here ask for a room facing the canal. The pool area was quite inviting only small but very relaxing after a big day out shopping,sightseeing or whatever and the pool was refreshing on those very hot days and in the evening when the temperature drops slightly and the wind picks up the pool then starts to heat itself with warm water being pumped in and one of the good things we found is that we had the pool pretty much to ourselves where we noticed other hotels pools were packed to the brim with people,maybe we just got lucky everyday?plenty parking but be quick because you snooze you loose. The location of the hotel we found was ideal because it was away from the main strip of Waikiki and not as loud and full on but if you wanted to get in amongst it you were only a 5 minute walk if that away from it all.When booking tours such as Pearl Harbour or Whale watching cruises e.t.c you can't go pass the tour desk in the hotel lobby thats run by a very friendly and accommodating fine gentleman by the name of Alan, he will hook you up with the best tour companies that are very informative and very reasonable price wise also The Ilima offers free Lei making classes run by a very beautiful woman by the name of June, this class is a must unless you wanna go up the road and buy one for 15 bucks? SO, in a nutshell if all your after is somewhere that is budget friendly, clean and tidy, friendly courteous helpful staff, comfortable and large rooms with most of the creature comforts of home and aint to fussy about the decor or the settings on the stove are faded or parts of the pool are under shade or the internet/wi-fi isn't up to standard than this is the place to stay.which is why my wife and i are returning back to Waikiki in October of this year with the family in tow all 18 of us and booked to stay at The Ilima Hotel for 17days..

The hotel is is a pretty calm location. The rooms are very large, very clean and the kitchenette was helpful. Wired internet for free (1mb broadband). Beach towels and mats are for free from the reception. We could always find a free parking lot - and the parking is free of charge whereas other hotels charge starting from $25 per night. The beds were good. We did not use the pool. A very old man is sitting next to the reception - he is selling tours, I believe. He uses a big typewriter instead of a computer, this is hilarious but very stylish. Maid was good, however, they do not always change linen.

We had 2 bedrm unit facing the street. I asked for quiet room and was told that all the 2bdrms face the street. hard to believe they don't have any 2 bdrm facing the canal. as I had feared the unit was very noisy. the windows do not shut completely so it was very noisy with the dump trucks in the early morning (5 am) and bar noise late at night (10 pm). I could hear the people talking on the street outside. Generally, I can tolerate some noise but this was too much for me. The units are very old and the one I had (704) was in bad shape. There were stains on the walls, the kitchen had appliances that needs replacing. the stove knobs had the numbers all rubbed off so you couldn't read the heat settings. the coffee maker was rusted so didn't use it. no non stick pans to cook with. only a few stainless steel pots and 1 pan. the swimming pool is very small and in the shade. also very windy but the water was heated so my kids were fine swimming in it. overall, the location was great. free parking was good (though the space was really tight for our minivan). free internet in room was good. free wifi in the lobby was good. hotel staff were okay. some were really helpful but some were not. the maid service was not so great. they didn't sweep/mop the kitchen area and after several days, the kitchen area had a bad odor that wouldn't go away. Though the price is good, if I could find a good deal somewhere else, I'd probably go elsewhere. I'd pay bit more for updated/cleaner unit that is quieter.

This hotel is older but very clean and the rooms are quite large. We had a balcony so could sit outside if we wished. The kitchenette is pretty old but perfectly functional so we could make our own meals if we wished. The only problem we had was with wi-fi. We couldn't pick it up in our room but we just went down to the lobby and it was fine. We thought it compared very favourably price wise and the position was handy to walk to shops and the beach.

The Ilima is an older hotel close to the International Market and within walking distance of Waikiki Beach. The bedroom was large with a small kitchen. Could use some sprucing up, but it was very reasonably priced for the area and parking was free in their garage. I'd stay there again.
Pros - Large room and central location. Relatively inexpensive.Con's - Bed not overly comfortable, old fashioned decor and staff could have been more helpful.

This is an old hotel that has been refurbished. We had a fantastic room with a large balcony, great view and in-room fridge, stove, microwave and sink. Very clean, lots of space, helpful staff. We had a generally wonderful experience. It sits about three blocks from the beach. With free internet and free parking we saved money by staying there.

We spent the first part of our Hawaiian vacation at the Ilima. Large Room, full kitchen, King sized bed (ask for it). This is a no frills establishment... there is no in-house restaurant, the decor is dated and the pool small. The free parking is a big bonus but is sometimes full, make sure you are back a liitle earlier or take your chances getting a paid spot (up to $18.00) nearby. The hotel is clean and the staff are friendly. The views from the room are limited by the newer, taller buildings around it. The best thing is the location Waikiki beach (at The Royal Hawaiian) is a short 4 blocks, the route takes you through the International Market. When we return to Oahu we will definately stay here again

This hotel is NOT the Ritz, but it also costs a fraction of the price. The rate was very affordable and we received a large room with a nice kitchenette, balcony with a great view, and a comfortable bed. Honestly the place was larger and quieter with a better view than my timeshare I had for the rest of the week. I'd go back or recommend this place in a heartbeat.

We came here for a conference/vacation. The rooms are HUGE, the front desk staff will go out of their way to help you, and I cannot say enough wonderful things about our stay. The location is one block from the beach and across the road from the International Market - where we had all our dinners. There is a grocery three blocks away and the convenience of making our own (Kona) coffee each morning was appreciated. It is two blocks from the beach, and one block from the canal. The wireless isn't wireless, so I needed a connector, but it's free, which is a huge bonus. And every guest gets a shell 'ley' when they leave. It is a lovely hotel.

Excellent front desk staff - friendly and helpful! Wonderful view from room/balcony, looking at the Ala Wai Canal and Mountains. Wow! Friendly maid service. A close walk to everything - eg. Honolulu Zoo, Waikiki Aquarium, Waikiki Beach, restaurants, etc. Picked up at front door by tour bus to Dole Plantation. Could go on and on about how great this vacation was! Thank You to everyone at Ilima Hotel for making my first trip to Hawaii truly spectacular! :D Jo-Anne

IIlima was a departure point for our day trips to Hanauma, Koko Crater, Diamand Head, Kailua beach, Peral Harbor etc., it is not a resort for lounging around. It is two blocks from the beach, and 1 block from the international market place. We had the deluxe studio unit, very large, kitchen, and our view faced the Ala Wai Canal, Ala Wai Golf Course, and the mountain ranges at the back -- to have this view though you need to request the deluxe studio suite at least from the 10th floor or higher and facing the canal and mountains. If you do not ask for this, you will face other hotels. This was a nice change from staying on Waikiki, and at least 1/2 the price. There are golfers in view, kayaks, canoes up and down the canal, joggers, etc. Having breakfeast on the unit lanai with Kona coffe was great. Plenty of markets and convenience stores near the lobby or just a few steps from the front door. Pro: Free parking - and we always found a space- free internet. Staff are most hospitable and have craft and other Hawaiian activities (Lei making, etc). I would not suggest this hotel for children or teenagers -- it's for adults with traveliing the island in mind. After IIlima we stayed three days on the north shore. On many occasions we found the same group of youth adults having a good time but just hanging out, but to some it could be a bit intimidating. There was also the occasional "lady" of the evening but never agrressive. To conclude the IIlima worked for us as a departure point to explore -- we were pleasantly surprised by the room, and view at the back of the canal, mountains, and golf course (but you must request this). Staff were exceptional and had the Hawaiian hospitality.

Located near Ala Wai blvd, only walk away from all things, kuhio Ave is just 2 minutes walk away and Kalakaua ave is 5 minutes walking distance, and few more and you are at Waikiki beach, so not bad distance at all, comfy place to stay....Rooms are with kitchen ( bit outdated but all works )My view was to kuhio side so not much to see even 12th floor, Ala wai side might be better, and that would be also to morning sun side, cooler at evenings, Room type was Superior Studio and it was enough spacy to me, with 2 big beds, comfy enough for 4 if needed and not too soft or hard.i am not sure does all buildings window ( balcony ) sound proof there, you can hear noise coming from kuhio ave specially friday and saturday nights when crowds tend to be out late, specially those 17-25y old spend time there... and well birds, not many , do sing , so if you are light sleeper you will hear..they have Internet connection at rooms it is not very speedy, only 0.6Mb/sec in and less that that out, it did work but i would not call that High Speed internet connection, no wifi in room areas, A balcony ( Lanai ) and enough comfy shower and toilet section ,it has air condition ( bit loud ), TV, Hotel has no restaurants for a reasons, Hotel has its own pool too, did not use.,Service was excellent, staff were very kind and helpfull so all that worked so fine way ,All together it does serve all its purpose to sleep and to wash, all this was 1550 $ for 13 nights so i was pleased to all .

Had a great time at the hotel for our 20th wedding anniversary. Everything was done just right and it was neat and clean. They had a lot of free extras for the price as already mentioned in previous reviews. Like free parking, internet access, pool, kitchenette, a pitcher of cold water in the fridge when we got there. These things really add up even if it is just the little things like the water. The hotel is just 1 block from the International Market, 2-3 blocks from the beach and within a few blocks you will find many restaurants, shops and entertainment.Also, attend the free lei making class from "June". I never appreciated it as much as I thought I would. She explained how hard it was to collect and clean the Kokui nuts and what the symbol of the lei meant to the Hawaiians.The only comment that I have is that the air condition needed to be updated and I notice one morning that a truck just unloaded some air conditions.I would definitely look for this hotel the next time I come back to Honolulu.

Enjoyed my stay here, spent one week Mar6-19th, Friendly staff . We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite that was very clean and spacious, balcony. We were with in walking distance to everything. We had a full kitchen to cook in and all utensils and misc were supplied.The Illima is a good value, the only thing that I think they need to do is update the rooms a little more facelift and a newer stove.Wakiki Beach 2 blocks away and it was wonderful walking. Would Stay here again.Great Value for a family, with the cost of things in Oahu.

We stayed at the Ilima in Feb 2011 for seven nights. This is an older hotel but, for the most part, is nicely maintained. The staff at the desk were very helpful and always friendly as were the housekeeping staff. The rooms are large (550 sq ft) and have kitchenettes and lanais with two chairs. We had two queen beds, flat screen TV, window AC (which was on 24/7 and never quite cooled down the room) and plenty of closets and drawers. Pros: The location was great. We could walk 2 blocks to International Marketplace, 3 blocks to high-end shopping and 4 blocks to Waikiki Beach. The price was cheap at $115 per nt. for a huge room. Free parking and the Enterprise Car Rental office is right across the street. They provide beach mats and towels.Cons: Street noise. We were on the 5th floor and were woken up early each morning by the garbage trucks. Not much of a view from our side of the building although the other side had view of the canal. There was a very small pool and patio but there was a larger patio area on the 10th floor. No onsite restaurant. Curtains and furnishings were dated but clean.All in all, a very nice stay and I would stay there again if I returned to Honolulu.

We spent the week on Oahu celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary. We brought our 2 teenagers - aren't we nice?! Our original reservation was with another hotel / condo nearby but after reading mixed reviews I canceled and found Ilima, thanks to "Oahu Revealed". We found a special deal on their website - a room with guaranteed view and 5th night free - so it turned out to be a better deal than our original hotel, plus the guaranteed view, plus FREE parking and free internet.The Ilima had what we were looking for: a kitchenette, close to the beach and shopping, a nice view, a good deal. The room was very spacious and had a ton of storage space. We had coffee each morning on our private lanai, watching the kayakers on the canal, with the golf course and mountains behind it. Beautiful! The room and all areas of the hotel were sparkling clean. Decor wasn't terribly outdated - just the wallpaper. The furniture was rattan, good quality. Beds were comfortable. Our room was cleaned every day (to our kids' dismay, they cleaned everything but the dishes....lol). The things that put Ilima over the top are the special touches and the way they go above and beyond. They have a connected parking garage that is free to hotel guests. The internet in room is free. (Many other hotels in Waikiki charge for these items.) They offer beach towels and bamboo mats to borrow for the beach, laundry facilities (AND a laundry basket in the room for us to use). A pitcher of cold water was waiting for us in the fridge. Somewhere in making our reservation, I must have mentioned our anniversary. When we got to our room we were surprised by a gift basket and a card signed by the staff, and not just signatures but messages wishing us well and congratulating us on our 20 years! It was a personal touch that we will never forget.While it was technically only 2 blocks from the beach, it was challenging to find beach access from the street through the buildings, shops and hotels. We did like being only 1 block from the International Marketplace and there is a grocery store within walking distance. One suggestion: a retractable clothes line on the lanai or in the bathroom to hang swim suits would be helpful.Mahalo Ilima!

My mom (71 years old) and I (coming up 40 next week) just got back from Waikiki yesterday and we stayed at the Ilama Hotel for 6 nights. We dont have 1 complaint. I would like to do a special Mahalo (thank you) to Courtni in Reservations for getting us a smoking room and also getting us the mountain and canal view on the 9th floor, it DEFINATELY made out trip more enjoyable for we spent alot of time on our lanai in the morning and evening and enjoyed the tranquil view and watched all the outrigger canoes and walkers and joggers along go along the canal. ALL the staff were absolutely WONDERFUL and VERY helpful. The hotel is older, yes, but very very clean, very safe feeling and walking distance to tons of different things in the area. Just keep an eye out on your surroundings at night for it is off the main street and you have to walk by older hotels and a bar on that street (Nanahoni Street).We were there the weekend of the Pro Bowl, so only on the Sat nt we had to walk a bit faster up the side street for there was some undesirables hanging out on the street, otherwise we felt very safe overall. It is in one of the best locations in Waikiki for you are in the middle of the heart of Waikiki. If you can, get a view of the mountains, I HIGHLY recommend it. We did not go into the pool (did not seem to get alot of sun most of the day) or on any of the sundecks (there are 2 on the 10th floor and on top of the penthouse rooftop there is also a large one). The hotels kindly borrow you beach towels (basic white pool towels) and straw beach mats for the beach. You are a 5 min walk to the beach, 5 minute walk to one of the markets (cheap, cheap deals for souveniers) they barter with you like Mexicano, which I found interesting for you are in the US. The hotel is very soundproof for it is made of concrete. The only noise you hear is the garbage trucks at night (but everyone I met along our travels, at different hotels heard them) There is a grocery store 5 min walk for groceries (Foodland), kinda expensive, but does the trick for food for the room. The rooms are HUGE, so would be GREAT for families. They have free lei making classes every Wed at 10am (we missed it for we got in very very late the nt beforeand slept in). Also every Friday at 11am,they have staff that performs in a Hawaiian Chorus, in the lobby and they sing for about half hour, you can sing along too with their songbooks. We got to see it and it was BEAUTIFUL if you appreciate the true culture of the Hawaiians, a DEFINATE must see. I am HIGHLY recommending this hotel for all travellers of all ages. One thing....NOT a party place, which we were happy about that. Very very quiet hotel. It is great also if you are a smoker for there are very FEW hotels you can smoke in Hawaii. If I ever get back to Hawaii, I will definatley stay here again with no hesitation :)

This is a nice old high rise place in the middle of the chaos of Waikiki. I did not like Waikiki. To me Waikiki was a very run down old city with lots of crime and dirt. The row of fancy hotels by the ocean are nice and fun to see but unless you can stay ocean front fancy your experience will be a little rough. This hotel is a very nice place with BIG rooms and nice kitchen. The pool area is small but relaxing. The walk to the beach area can be a bit scary at night but fine during the day. There were visible drugs, prostitution and a stabbing while we were there (within a couple blocks). This is a great choice if you need a cheap place to stay close to the beach action. If you do not want to be in Waikiki beach I would suggest staying somewhere else.

This is a great hotel , we always go out of our way to avoid package deals that end up putting you in the other hotels in the area which are not as nice and not as friendly.Comparing this hotel to Trump hotel in Hawaii is ridiculous , Trump opened in 2009 and if you want to pay that kind of money for something your barely in , go for it :)This hotel is clean , the staff go completely out of their way if you need help with something , and the rooms are large . The kitchens in the room come in handy for a quick breakfast before you start your day off . We have stayed in this hotel since I was a young teenager , I came with my parents back then and now I bring my teenager daughter here.Its reliable and feels like your going home each time you go .Dont expect it to look like a hotel that opened up int he past two years as it is a older hotel but its clean , and reasonably priced and you cant put a price on the service you receive here , and I have stayed at all types of hotels in the past . Ask for a room facing the ali wai canal as they are quieter , and watch their website for deals such as 5th night free etc .

I'm not sure how this hotel has such a great rating on this forum. Stayed here for several nights on business as required by my employer. Stayed a few extra nights for leisure and moved over to Trump which is in a totally different league.Pros:-VERY friendly and helpful staff-Free parking- this parking is limited. Don't plan on parking anything large in there. Won't happen. Spaces are VERY, VERY small. If you get there after 6pm ish you won't get a spot and will have to search for somewhere to park. The staff at the front desk will help you.- Within walking distance of everything Waikiki has to offer.- Free internet that worked well.Cons:-Very dated rooms and lobby(think early 1980's)-Neighborhood- Not the greatest (not the worst that I've stayed either but.....)-Beds (think motel 6 - seriously, hard beds with paper thin sheets/bedspread-Peeling pink wallpaper-They charge to use the sometimes functional safe in your room (whats with that??) You normally use a room safe to safe guard your stuff from external and INTERNAL theft. The bottom line is this: If you are of the Motel 6, Rodeway Inn, Super 8, Econo Lodge variety then you may be ok with it. If you are used to anything nicer than that you WILL BE disappointed. I'd pay a little more and stay somewhere else. Just my .02.

Great accomodations and really close to the International Market Place and within walking distance to the beach. Very clean room with friendly staff; We highly recommend this place to anyone going to Waikiki.

Ilima hotel is in the center/back of Waikiki,a few minutes walk from everything.Lobby might seem outdated at first sight,but everything is perfectly clean and convenient.Large room featured 1 kingsize and 1 Queen which is nice when you are with 2 tall teenagers,they share a king and have less chance to bump into each other!Fully equipped kitchen ,May double glazing is not 100% efficient so you hear a little bit of the street but it was not noisy as you are in the" back" of Waikiki .Great rates comparing to others hotel of the category.Parking (limited although)is free ,when you drive out ,you are almost immediately on Alawai blvd quickly out of Waikiki .

We enjoyed everything about our stay at the Ilima. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Our upper level room was spacious and had a beautiful view of the mountains and a canal. There was a fully equipped kitchen, and use of clothes washers and dryers for guests. We usually found parking in the garage; when there were no spaces left we were able to park across the street in a public lot for a reasonable fee. We would definitely return.
Fantastic staff, Great location (walking distance to everything you need), Clean and tidy, Will be back again more than once.

Aloha!This hotel is in a pretty good spot, in the midst of waikiki without being totally immersed in waikiki such that you get all the noise that comes with it. We had a good experience with hotel staff - in fact we never had any trouble with the hotel, getting around, to and from the airport. We stayed 3 nights.There is a shuttle that takes you to and from the hotel, which is specific to iLima but you need to book in advance though since they need to co-ordinate it. When we first arrived we took an airport bus through Roberts Transport which was very reasonable as well. Roberts was about $9, and the iLima shuttle was $10.Our only complaint was that the first two days we had a hire car and need to park it somewhere. We were told that the hotel has free parking for those staying at the hotel. What we didn't anticipate on was that it was first come first served. When we arrived there were no spots left! But lucky for us, as we were checking in, someone has left so we managed to find a park. The service desk gave us some tips on when it was best to obtain a park which was handy - make sure you ask when you get there with a car! The alternative is to park across the road for a fee, or park on the street... overnight it is free up to 7am (I think?) - that's if you can find one first!Overall a very reasonable stay at a reasonable cost, and it a convenient location! Would definitely stay there again!

We chose this hotel because it got big rooms, if you stay longer you are able to cook for yourT yourself which is not that bad in Hawaii. A big plus is that they offer free parking in the middle of Honolulu! The rooms are already a it older, simple furnished, but clean. Shops and everything is in walking distance.

We stayed here for two nights (a Saturday and Sunday) and paid $160/night for a two bedroom, very large, clean spot with a full kitchen and free parking! What more can you ask for? (my husband would say a softer bed but I slept fine)The only complaint that I had was the noise level from outside the hotel--but we were on a lower floor (hence, part of the value) and it WAS Saturday night in Waikiki.One block from the Ala Wai Canal (which was a nice place to walk) and two blocks from Waikiki Beach and Duke's at the Outrigger. International marketplace was also right there.I would definitely stay there again. Not sure if my husband would, but our friends who stayed with us would go back too.

There is nothing better in your holiday hotel than to feel like home. The ilima has a perfect location, is clean and the reason I really recommend is because of the staff. they all friendly ,are helpful suggesting restaurants and beaches where to go...And above all , a lady called Courtni who helped me with her profesionalism. It is a pleasure the behaviour she had with us and because of this we will come back. I wish all the hotels would have an staff that does her job with interest and tries to do it better everyday. ingrid

If you are looking for a spacious room with a kitchen then this is your place. The free parking is quite the added bonus. We stayed 7 nights & never had a problem finding a place to park. We had a room on the 12th floor overlooking the Ala Wai canal & the mountains. Loved waking up to that view every morning & eating our breakfast on the balcony. We've never been to Hawaii so don't know if it's always like this, but we never had to use the AC. There was a constant breeze & no humidity or bugs. Every night we kept the sliding glass door open several inches & it was very comfortable & quiet! It's a very short, easy walk to the beach. Other people have mentioned Food Pantry & Foodland, but if you have a car there is a nice, large grocery store called Safeway on Kapahulu that's very near.We didn't have to ask the staff for anything so I can't comment, but someone was always there and they all seemed rather pleasant. We didn't use the pool or the workout equip so can't comment on that.My husband & I had a very good time and would definitely stay at the Ilima again!

We stayed in a studio room in the Ilima Hotel for three nights in August 2010. The room was spacious (about 540 square feet) and included a kitchenette, with dishes and a full-sized refrigerator. Parking is free in the hotel's parking garage. The employee at the front desk said it sometimes gets full, but while we were there, there was an abundance of available parking spaces. The hotel is conveniently located to many restaurants and shops in Waikiki; you need only walk a short half-block to get to a street full of them. Traffic can be extremely slow in that area, so if you are going a short distance, walking or the bus is probably faster. Although we could hear traffic during the day, it was sufficiently quiet to sleep at night. The hotel lends guests free towels and beach mats to take to the beach. Nothing stands out as unusually wonderful about the Ilima, but on the other hand, we have absolutely no complaints either. We would happily stay there again, especially for the relatively low price (compared to similar hotels in the area).

Overall good hotel.Bad: Beds are not the best. Not saggy but it is basically fabric then the springs. C-Hotel is clean but kind of tired. For instance, the part of the door (on top) that keeps the door from slamming was broken. So to open the door we had to push it up otherwise it blocked the door and we couldn't open it enough to get out. It took telling staff 3 times to fix it. Also while hotel staff are friendly they are not overly knowledgeable. For example, the enterprise across the street was sold out so we asked where we could get a rental car and the lady at the reception desk said she didn't know. I find it strange that you work in a hotel and only know one rental car location. (perhaps it was because it was the night clerk? but still...The good: location + price. 3 blocks from the beach for around $110 is pretty hard to beat. The hotel is very CLEAN as well as very quiet (very important for me). Close to food and grocery stores. Has a full kitchen (helps in keeping costs down). Parking is free but not exactly plentiful. Washer/dryers on site. Hotel provides beach towels and straw mats. Also there was one man at the front desk who was helpful. When asking him for a suggestion for an authentic sushi place he didn't know but called his wife on the spot for her suggestion. A special thanks to the wife. Side bar suggestion...go to food pantry (I think that's the name.) It is a real grocery store and much cheaper than ABC. They also sell snorkle gear. We got ours on sale for $6 much less than renting for a day.

Had a great stay at the Ilima Hotel stayed from the 3rd of August to the 16th of Aug.Check in was so good as we arrived at about 9 15am and our room was ready.We had a studio room on the 11th floor great view of the canal and mountains and heaps private no other building in front or at the sides looking in our room.Ask for room 1107 best room full size fridge great kitchen ,only thing was no coffee or tea supplied so bring your own.Had a king size bed and double bed so comfy the beds,clean shower and bathroom plenty of room to place toiletries and big draws and wardrobes to pack clothes in and store bags away.Had problems with the tv stations not tuned in probably,did report it but nothing done about it,but hey we didnt go to Honolulu to watch tv!! Staff friendly, and we used the pool most days, only ones in it so we had it to ourselves every day.Went to the free lei making class and that was fun nice teacher June who told us a bit of history about the Kuikui nut, if you are from OZY BE WARNED THEY TAKE THESE SHELL AND NUT LEIS OFF YOU UNLESS YOU HAVE A DOCUMENT TO say they have been fumigated, same with Plumeria cuttings that you can get from the ABC shops,because we had made these Leis ourselves we paid for them to be fumigated $30 by customs and they sent them back to us.The hotel is in a nice quiet area in walking distance to everything. The Pantry is a close walk to the Ilima to get Groceries ,if you want to shop where the locals go and its a bit cheaper go to Foodland at the end of Kalakaua av going towards the hawaii convention centre next to the morman chapel great goceries there.,short drive by car.Loved the Ilima not crowded Ohana feel about the Hotel and reasonable price too.

We booked a Studio rm overlooking the Alai Wai Canal. The view is peaceful and lovely,overlooking the mountains. The location is about 10mins from the beach. The Intn'l market is a short walk. Very close to the shopping area which is parallel to the beach. All high priced designer stores. Beach is crowded. The beach near the Outrigger hotel , is less crowded. Room was very spacious. Beds were made daily and linens changed daily. However the bathroom needs to be updated. The bath tub is in dire need of a good scrub and is yellow from lack of cleaning. The sink also appeared uncleaned It does not appear that cleaning agents were ever used.The shower head was faulty. The kitchenette was properly stocked with necessary utensils and fully equipped with cutting board etc. Coffee was provided for the first day and then after that you have buy it. The stove and microwave worked well. We let the front desk know that kitchnette floor needed to be mopped after the 3 days. They obliged. The carpet was not cleaned daily ; bits of paper etc stayed in the same place.Housekeeping needs to be worked on! The room has an electronic safe which was charged per day . However, beware that the safe failed to lock. We contacted the front desk and they sent up the resident expert and he tried his best. Apparently there is only ONE GUY WHO SERVICES 'EL SAFE' and were told he was 'probably ' in Maui /Nevada/La/ Las Vegas. Guests beware of the faulty safe. Front desk canceled charges on the use of the safe. Staff is courteous and front desk very obliging. Overall I'd rate this hotel 5 for it's location , kitchenette, and roomy Studio which accomodated 3 people very comfortably. Drawback : Sloppy Housekeeping and Safe -unreliable.There were 3 other rooms whose safes didn't work and we all stored our important docs in the front desk safe.

After much research for a hotel for my Hawaii trip, I went with Ilima after seeing consistently good reviews on this website and others. It was the only one that was constantly highly rated and within my price range. The service was good. We were greeted upon our arrival and taken care of immediately. Booked the room through Expedia and paid for it advance. The room was a studio with 2 beds and a kitchen. It was one step above the cheapest room. The hotel is in good condition but make no mistake, the style is 20-30 years ago. Everything looks old but I don't mind that since the price was much better than the other hotels in the area. The room had all the amenities you could ask for and a new 32 inch lcd TV. Note: the TV they had in our room was a Sharp designed to integrate the hotel video software for PPV and such. They locked out all the inputs to the TV so you CANNOT hook up your laptop to the TV, or a DVD player or a ps3 or anything for that matter. That's a big disappointment for me because I wanted to use Redbox and my laptop to watch movies at night but no go. Had to use my laptop. On the plus you do get free wired internet in the room. Although it is painfully slow compared to any decent cable connection. Around 750kbps or so. So you can't use it for netflix or hulu or youtube most of the time. Other than the technology, the room was nice. It had plenty of room and the kitchen made breakfast very easy while on vacation. The AC was a window unit with a remote, there is no central air. The hotel had a pool that was very small but I didn't use it. On to the free parking: it's available but with a few caveats. It gets filled up fast and it's really cramped. It has some of the smallest parking spots I've seen anywhere outside of Europe or Asia. Big surprise for Americans used to plenty of room. I had a convertible which was not that big and it was still a pain to park. Don't even think about bringing a Suburban or Deville in there. Minivans do alright. The lot will fill up around 9pm or so. So plan ahead. Weekends are even worse. We came back from a late dinner on Fri night and the lot was completely full. The staff was helpful and gave us a map showing all the lots available to us. We were able to find 2 that were around $7-8 for overnight. One is a public pay lot across the street and the other was the Waikiki Trade Center that has $7 for 10 hours when prepaid. The latter was about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. But no other hotels have free parking around there and street parking is impossible. All the good spots get filled up by employees working in the area. Good:CleanlinessLocationServiceBad:Small parking lot gets filled up fastTV inputs locked out so you can't watch your own content on their TVOther than that I would say it was an overall good experience. I know I'm being picky about the parking and TV but those were the only flaws in an otherwise perfect stay.

We stayed in a deluxe studio overlooking the Ala Wai canal, room was clean, spacious and well appointed. Full stove, microwave, fridge King size bed and double bed, lanai to sit on and enjoy the view.

Nice quiet hotel friendly helpful staff, clean large rooms, close to everything but away from the crowds and noise. 1/2 block to international market, 1 block to worlds best high end shopping, 2 blocks to beach, across the street fron car rental, best value around and RARE free parking! When in Hawaii I spend little time in hotel sleep, shower, change, always out doing something. This hotel is perfect for that, if you want to stay in hotel have room service, spas, cabana boys setting umbrellas and lounge chairs for you and bring you drinks and food spend the extra 200 a night and get a high end beach hotel.

I have stayed at the Ilima Hotel about 15 times in the last two years and I think it is the best value in Waikiki. Rooms are huge with kitchen and microwave. Location is between Kuhio Ave. and Ala Wai Blvd. so its a few minutes walk to the International Market Place. Limited free parking available at the hotel. Only once during my stays was the parking full and I luckily found street parking nearby. Rooms are well insulated and very quiet. I'm a light sleeper and have problems when hotels have thin walls and you can hear noise from the rooms next door. No problems with noise at the Ilima. I always sleep very well there. Front desk staff is excellent and overall I highly recommend this hotel.

Last Nov. my husband and I stayed here on our own and thought it re great so decided to take our friends here when we returned in June this year. We booked the 2 bedroom suite this time. The suite was a tiny bit small and it only had one bathroom which was a bit of a nuisance when travelling with another couple but other than that it was a great place to stay. For a family with small kids it would be ideal. I dealt with Courtni when booking and she was absolutely great, as was the staff on duty when we were there. It's a block off the main shopping street and 2 blocks up from the beach but that is no big deal. It's quiet, safe and if you are lucky enough to get a room facing the canal it has great views. Considering the price when compared to other places in the same area, it is great value with great prices. Having your own kitchen is a real bonus.

We picked this hotel because of previous reviews and we weren't disappointed. This hotel is 4-5 minutes from the beach, clean, fairly modern, and is an excellent value. Their staff is friendly and helpful. This hotel may only be a 2 - 2 1/2 star, but it seemed like a 4 star hotel, just not very fancy but with everything you need. We highly recommend it for budget-conscious travellers to Oahu.

Stayed here with my 11 and 15 y/o sons during a 2 night stay in Waikiki. Large room with internet access, beautiful views from the lanai of canal and mountains, with rainbows almost daily. We had breakfast and dinner in the room each day because the boys were tired/jet lagged. Full kitchen and everything you need. Some of the decor is a bit dated, and there was a musty smell upon entering the lobby. The pool is small, but we were the only ones using it when we used it. Short walk to beach, one block to bus to Pearl Harbor, nearby grocery. The bed was very, very comfortable. We had a great stay.

Loved this hotel. Travelers on a budget, but also wanted a nice stay.Yes, the decor isn't the latest, but it was clean. That was my main concern going to a place I've never been. Didn't see one bug, not even in the kitchen.We loved the free parking, the kitchen was perfectly equipped and the room is huge. Oh, we also loved the free internet.Overall...we'd stay there again. Oh, didn't post any photos...looks exactly like the websites show

Why pay an arm and a leg for a "5-star" hotel room and only spend the night sleeping in it? The ilima Hotel offers everything I want in a hotel at half the price a "5-star"hotel in Waikiki charges.I spent 4 nights in April 2010 at ilima in room #502. The room was clean and spacious. Free high speed internet access is available. There's also free parking within the hotel and I didn't have any problem getting a parking lot every night I came back. Other hotels in Waikiki charges at least $20 per day for parking and $25 for internet.The hotel is only 2 blocks away from Waikiki Beach and 1 block from the International Market Place and Kalakaua Ave. There are plenty of restaurants and bars near the hotel and a supermarket, Food Pantry, about 200m down Kuhio Ave to the left.On the 3rd level of the hotel, there's a coin-operated laundry facilities.Check in/out was fast and the hotel staff provided very good service. When I return to Waikiki, I will definitely stay at ilima.

Good location, good amenities in our room, a little used, and very nice desk staff. Free parking too. Good price for what we wanted. The parking was also a key feature for us. Multi level with easy access to the elevators. We stayed here so that we would have a small kitchen in our room. Large fridge, microwave, stovetop, kitchen table, and TV. The price is very reasonable and it suited our needs quite well. The staff at the front were always warm and loved to strike up a conversation with us.As I said, the hotel rooms are a little used. They are bland, are not new or newly renovated and the furniture is decent enough. Very mediocre but suit needs very well. There is a small outdoor pool and a work out room that houses treadmills. Did not investigate this any further other than looking in the door.As for the location. It’s about a two block walk south to get to the beach, we went there once because we decided to tour around the area. At night, there were plenty of restaurants to choose from a couple blocks away. We made use of Denny’s, California Pizza, and The Cheesecake Factory (either get there early or plan to wait for a table). We also checked out the International market, King’s Village, and dealt with some pushy sales people on one of the alley markets. A word of caution, if you see anybody trying to sell baby fermented sharks, please do not purchase these or anything from these people and find a more eco friendly person.You may have noted that the sleep quality was a little lacking. Beds were not the problem. The downtown core was the problem, very windy and the shutter type windows didn't exactly block out the breezy noises. I had no problems with this, a sort of white noise, but my fiancee required earplugs.This was also a good central location to visit the East side and West side of the island as well as the Pearl Harbour area. Watch out for road construction, it can get pretty nasty trying to get to the hotel on all those one way streets.

I used to be a resident of Oahu and stayed here before starting my new job overseas. It is a wonderful place, but kind of dated. This is the best value in all of Oahu and especially tourist town Waikiki. They offer free internet, parking, and laundry facilities. Also they are close proximity to the beach and Kalakaua Ave., which is the main strip in Waikiki with street performers. The rooms are large and spacious with 2 queen beds, kitchenette with plates/utentsils/toaster, etc. Also they have a 32" flat panel tv with decent amount of channels. The best view rooms in my opinion overlook the golf course across from the Ala Wai Canal and towards the mountains. It is also convenient if you like to avoid having to drive after partying it up downtown and a decent walk back to the hotel. It might be dated, but it is always clean. The A/C works and it also has a lani to sit on and drink coffee, which you'll have to purchase at the store. I have stayed here at least twice a year, every time I manage to get vacation to visit friends still residing on the island. Great place and would definitely recommend.

The Ilima is a great hotel! Not only did I get a great rate with them, but the hotel is very comfortable.The front desk staff is very professional, but very personable. They take care of everything in a very timely matter. The housekeeping staff is quiet, yet very efficient.The "studio" that we got was very spacious. Instead of the elongated room that you get, we had a large square room. There was plenty of room for the three of us to move around. You get a great kitchenette. Stove, oven, microwave, refrigerator and a table. Their room safes can hold laptops, which very few hotels have.You cannot see the ocean, but have a nice big balcony with 2 chairs and a table.They have a sunroom on the 10th floor and a pool on the lower level.It is closer to the canal rather than the ocean, but a short walk to the beach, grocery, etc. Everything is within walking distance.They have free parking under the hotel if you bring a car.I was definitely pleased with our choice and would definitely choose them again.

Was here for 7 nights on a business trip. Comfortable bed, HDtv is nice, kitchen saves you money on eating out for meals (has pots and pans, etc - no coffee or coffee filters, bring those with you) and ethernet cable internet for free. Parking lot is free on first come basis, I always got a spot. Staff is very friendly, plays music on Fridays. Only problem I had was electronic door lock stopped working, guy came and replaced it.Typical Waikiki big city noises, sirens, traffic and the morning trash trucks can't be avoided. Turn the a/c on for a fan to block that. Did enjoy the wall of windows with a sliding door onto the lanai - had north view of canal, golf course and mountains.About 3 blocks to the Waikiki beach, if you head straight for it you'll come out next to the pink palace. Location of hotel is near center of Waikiki so it has plenty of shopping and restaurants to choose from.

We returned yesterday to Winnipeg Manitoba Canada after a wonderful 2 week stay at the Ilima Hotel. There are no words to properly describe the whole wonderful staff in this hotel. We have travelled extensively and have never stayed in a hotel that has such helpful staff. Need a wine bottle opener..they have it; need to weigh your luggage......they have it; need local information.....they know it; want to learn to make your own shell lei....they do that too. I could go on and on. We were there at the time of the tsunami threat and the hotel staff was absolutely marvelous in calming any fears that we may have had. They handled the whole situation very professionally. The rooms are huge and very comfortable. They were always well cleaned for you. There is only one very tiny need in the room that I would mention. The kitchen cupboards could use a coat of paint inside but mine need it too!I would definitely stay there again if we are fortunate to be able to return.

The Ilima is in Waikiki, two blocks from the beach, one block from many bus routes, three blocks from a supermarket. We had a room with a mountain view from the balcony._Big_ room, full stove and kitchen with nice dishes and pots and full-size fridge. And high-speed free Internet. We booked online, and got an excellent price. The pool and exercise room are small, and the lobby isn't impressive. But the staff is helpful, and there's a big lending library for guests.We'll stay here the next time we're in Hawaii. It had everything we wanted.

I love to come back next time and highly recommended to friends and family.The room were clean with two full size bed, full kitchen, stove, refrigerator, microwave and LCD TV? Great for cooking your own food... and guess what it has full kitchen utensil, plates and even have toaster?Our bed was located near the lanai with cool breeze of Hawaian air.We will be coming back again for sure, great staff too, friendly>One BIG thing.... FREE PARKING ! Thats the best hotel ever in Hawaii?Keep up the good works...Philip and Estrellita Wayne339 N. Rampart Blvd.Los Angeles, CA. 90026[--][--]

I've stayed here before and the experiences are always positive. As another reviewer said, this hotel is comfortable, clean, and convenient. It is very well maintained with nice little touches in the rooms - like velcro to hold the light-blocking drapes to the wall. The rooms are big with a full wall of windows. The lanais are big enough to use. The beds are excellent, rooms are quiet, and kitchens are well-stocked. Free DSL was a happy find this trip.

This hotel is an affordable, comfortable place to stay in the heart of Honolulu. The location is convenient to Waikiki beach, shops, and major routes in/out of the city. The room was clean, comfortable, and had a small kitchen. The staff was friendly an helpful. It was my first time in Honolulu, and they helped orient me to the city and to resources for planning my time there. There are certainly hotels that are more luxurious an closer to the beach, but the Ilima Hotel is a fine bargain for the price. I would stay there again and recommend it to friends.
Free parking and quiet location are nice features. Most of other hotel has a tiny room for turists like us, but Ilima has quite roomy space with full kicthen.

I had a pleasant stay at Ilima Hotel. I got a room upgrade to Suite 802 where the balcony is facing the Ala Wai Canal and the mountains....beautiful. The staff were very nice and casual, always available. A guy knocked at my door at 5am so I called the front desk, they dealt with the problem right away and even called to check if I was okay. It's an old hotel but clean and very well maintained. However some furniture particularly the patio furniture need to be replaced. The location is perfect, just a few blocks from all the action.

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in May, and it was an excellent experience. Its a great value for the money. The location was very good, located on a quiet street, only bout a 5 minute walk from Waikiki Beach and less than that to the International Marketplace. The service was excellent and very friendly, the rooms were nicely appointed and very clean. Overall its an excellent hotel, I would gladly stay here again.

The Ilima Hotel deserves more than a 2 star rating. My daughter and I took advantage of an internet rate of $105. For that, we luxuriated in a deluxe suite with a king and a queen bed, full kitchen, 32" flat screen on the 14th floor that was extremely spacious and clean. We had very obscure views of the beach, but, heck, we were only two blocks from it! Two of the best features were free - (limited) parking and free internet. Those hotels on the beach charge extra for that! We never had a problem parking. Even had free newspaper delivered each morning to our doorstep. Free beach towels and beach mats to use. The staff was extremely accomodating and pleasant. They allowed us to leave our car there after our noon checkup to go enjoy one last lunch in Waikiki.

At $75 a night via the internet special on their website, the Ilima Hotel is one of the best hotel bargains we've ever experienced. The lobby is bright and welcoming with friendly staff. Beach towels and mats are available to borrow at the front desk. Overall, the theme is vintage Hawaiian. The pool was quite small and surrounded by buildings, so we didn't bother to use it. Our room was on the sixth floor, and quite spacious. The kitchen was adequate. Like the room decor, it was a little dated, but perfectly fine for light meals. The full sized fridge was a bonus. The view towards the canal and mountains was pleasant, although the location was a bit noisy with traffic night and day. However, because the noise was a constant buzz, we slept fine. The room had a/c, but because of the breezes that flowed through the window slats, it wasn't necessary. The on-site laundry was another plus. Buses and the ubiquitous ABC stores are just up the street on Kuhio Avenue. You could pay a lot more to stay closer to the beach, but why not walk a block and use the savings for a nice restaurant meal each day? Unless you plan to spend your O'ahu vacation sitting on the balcony of an expensive room, I would recommend the Ilima Hotel.

I accompanied my husband to Oahu on his business trip in Sept. and we stayed here for 5 nights. The room was very spacious and had a full sized kitchen. Big tv was a plus. I liked the bathroom - the sink was an oval stand alone and did not create a mess like many other hotel bathrooms. Great housekeeping daily, but you wash your own dishes. Only shortfalls: no coffee filters provided, and they charge to use the safe. Local paper delivered to your door each morning. Internet high speed but requires a cable. Laundry facility fine. Parking was no problem - get a very small car though. Quiet, and very close to bus lines, shopping, and the beach. It was far enough away from the action to be calming. Watch the paddlers on the canal around dusk. Staff displays the aloha spirit!

We spent 2 weeks at the Ilima this past summer. We were there for one week prior to our cruise and one week after the cruise. The hotel was clean with large rooms with lanais overlooking either the Ala Wai Canal or towards Waikiki Beach, although you can't see the beach from the hotel. The beach is a short walk from the hotel, only taking approx 5-10 minutes.The staff at the hotel were very friendly and accomodating to any requests we made. Free parking is a definite perk since most places charge upwards of $20+ per day. Free high speed internet was also included in the room rate.The room also featured a compete kitchen with stove, oven, microwave, fully stocked set of dishes, utensils, coffee maker, pots & pans, etc.I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a clean, safe, large room complete with in-room safe. We plan to return to the Ilima on our next vacation to Hawaii.

We had two rooms on the same floor for our family. Our room was a large two bedroom suite with comfortable beds. We always travelled in a group, especially at night. There seemed to be 'working girls' down at the corner but we made sure we never walked alone when the sun went down. Check out time was noon but our flight didn't leave until late at night. The staff offered to keep our luggage and then provided us with towels in the evening so we could wash up before we left for our flight. The staff was extrordinarily friendly. We never had any problem finding a parking spot in their free parking lot. Enterprise Rentacar was across the street. The rental agent told me that the Ilima was the only hotel in Waikiki to provide free parking. The free internet was a nice touch - the larger hotels on the beach charge for this same service. The large flat screen tv was great. The only downside is that there is no free coffee or filters for use in the coffee maker. A trip to the ABC store fixed that problem. The large supermarket 2 blocks away had everything we needed.

We had a great stay at Ilima hotel.Some more details:Great location: one block from the beach and the most relevant shops in Waikiki (if you like watches, Japaha, a small shop with great prices is just around the corner)Staff: very kind and always ready to say Aloha.Room: we had a Deluxe room (15th floor), with golf course view, two queen beds, kitchen, internet access (wired, not so fast), flat screen HD TV with cable channels.Daily housekeeping, with bathroom and kitchen linen change when requested.Hotel parking: is available included in the rate, based on first come-first serve principle since there are less parking slots than rooms. In any case we've been always been able to find a free slot during our 9 nights stay. Nice note: we've been allowed to leave the car in the parking few more hours after the check-out. For free.Self laundry service: 4 washing machines + 4 driers.
