In room: iron and ironing board, basket.During our stay the State of Hawaii was under the threat of Hurricane Felicia.About 4 days before the calculated d-day the "watch period" started and the hotel staff provided updated info daily.In addition when the threat was at max level they placed the terrace furniture into the room and added two complimentary water bottles in the fridge.Fortunately everything ended up with a rainy day.
user_location: Sir Bani Yas Island, United Arab Emirates

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at the Ilima Hotel. The room was very large and included a kitchenette. We went around the corner to a store and bought breakfast items and snacks. The hotel was walking distance to everything we needed. I had read the reviews and we rented a smaller car which my husband was able to park no problem. We did not have any difficulty getting a space. The property is not decorated in the latest style, but is comfortable and clean. My only boo boo was not requesting a king bed. The double was so narrow [we are used to a queen] that we pushed the 2 together! We did take a dip in the pool, but preferred the beach. It was a nice touch to have beach mats available to borrow. We were on the 5th floor in a standard room and had a nice view of the canal and the mountains inland. It was one of the best hotels we stayed at on this trip.

Ilima Hotel is a good value in Waikiki. It is a few blocks from the beach, but $100 or more dollars cheaper than hotels closer to the beach. Plus, every room has a kitchen and you get free parking. These add up to additional savings on top of the already low prices. There are a few drawbacks. First, this is not the most updated or cleanest hotel in the world, but certainly within acceptable parameters. Second, it is set back from the main strip and, if you are not careful, you could find yourself walking on a sketchy street on your way back to the hotel at night. Cutting through the international marketplace is your best, and safest, bet.

I got the deal off their webpage and it turns out it wasn't too bad off! The walk to the beach was not too far and for the savings , it was worth it.I liked how there was a kitchenette and how the room was very spacious. It is great when traveling on a budget.

If you have no objections to a 70 era hotel, a 2 block walk to beach, with no prestige but plenty of comfort in a clean, large, well kept room with large TV, kitchen facilities, free wi-fi, and a very helpful staff this is the bargain find in Waikiki. We stayed above the 10th floor, think lower floors may have a little noise problem, but a truly great find for the bargain hunter and thrifty traveler. Free parking is a plus, as is the on premise laundry room. The pool is very small with little sun exposure and the fitness room is only fit for one or two people at a time, no on premise eating facilities, but considering the rates, a truly bargain hotel.

Because of the many positive reviews here on tripadvisor, we booked a room for 19 nights. That was one of the best decisions we could made! The hotel is located in a pretty quite street. Our room was on the 5th floor with a view towards the mountains and the Ala Wai canal. Really beautiful! We enjoyed sitting every day on the big balcony. The room was big, the kitchen had all utensils we needed and everything very clean.The housekeeping service came every day. When we had a technical problem in the kitchen, a technician came 10 minutes later and repaired it! The staff was always friendly and helpful at every question!! A nice extra was the free newspaper, delivered every day in front of our roomdoor! We had been on Oahu 4 times before and this was the best hotel of all we had! We really enjoyed our stay at the ILIMA and will surely book again!!

Like most of the other reviewers I could not complain about this hotel in any way. Dated in decor but clean and well maintained in every respect, and the rooms are twice the size of many of the more modern hotels in town. I stayed at the Ala Moana last year and my room there wouldn't be 1/2 the size of the Ilima & cost considerably more. Our room had views over the Ali Wai canal and golf course toward the mountains and we could sit on the lanai for breakfast and enjoy the morning sun, and then watch the outrigger crews train in the afternoon while enjoying a cocktail. It is quiet, yet close to everything in Waikiki, and the kitchen facilities are more than sufficient to enable you to cook meals if you prefer to stay in. Staff were friendly & helpful.

Stayed at the Ilima for eight nights in June and found it very good overall. A rather complete set of kitchen supplies, refrigerator, stove, and large flat screen TV. The free parking is great, but some of the spaces are small. I had a larger vehicle, so I just had to be a little bit earlier so I could get one of the larger spots. It was not really a problem. It is very nice to be able to walk along the Ala Wai canal in the evening which is only a shot walk from the hotel's door. To me it is more relaxing than the area along Kalakaua Ave nearer the beach. I would avoid using the pc located in the lobby for email or boarding pass printing, as it is quite expensive. I would recommend the internet cafe around the corner on Nahua St.

The Ilima Hotel is a economic oasis in the middle of what can be a very expensive holiday if you don't shop around. We found this hotel by simply surfing the net and then discovered their special internet rates that provided much larger savings than their normal rack rate. Of course what does one do when you have no real idea about the hotel except for the other reviews we have read. Luckily for us our friend Frank came to the rescue. He happened to be on holidays at Waikiki and he checked out the hotel for us. Although he couldn't check out the rooms his report was simple......... "if you can get this for $75USD per night you are laughing". We quickly sent an email to the hotel and within 48 hours we had confirmation the room was booked. Unfortunately at that price we did not have a choice of the room and we ended up with a view looking over the hotel roof next door. The only other complaint we had were the rock hard beds however the room was very large, with a ample kitchenette. The Lanai was adequate in size and we faced the sunshine during the day and with something like 30 TV stations (and free internet) this room was great. The decor was a bit dated but is was certainly clean and comfortable. The stroll to the beach was about 10 minutes via the gauntlet of cheap jewelry and souvenirs sellers. Despite this the hotel is close to all the action and restaurants. The staff were very helpful and friendly. They provide towels and beach mats and the small swimming pool is great to wash off the sand and salt. We will certainly pick this hotel again for any return trips to Waikiki.

I searched for months for hotels and happened by the Ilima by sheer luck. After much research of reviews of Trip Advisor, I went to their (hotel) website and got a great deal, 4 nights the 5th one was FREE. Our room 1107 faced the mountains, canal and golf course, great view. It did get a litlle warm and the air conditioner seemed to have a hard time keeping up since the sun rose on that side on the hotel. But that is the only negative I can come up with. If you are looking to for resort to spend your money at, don't stay at the Ilima. But if you are going to Waikiki to see Waikiki and rather have money for that , stay at the Ilima. Everything , food, beach, shopping ,car rental is within walking distance. Full kitchenette, flat screen TV, plenty of room, great shower water pressure, and friendly staff, for less than $100.00 bucks a night, you can't go wrong. Be sure to book your stay at the Ilima.com web site to get special deal.

My husband and I booked the Ilima Hotel through Expedia for its great price and high reviews here on Trip Advisor; surprisingly high for only a 2.5 star hotel. What we got was, to us, a 5 star experience based on what we were looking for.Even though this was our honeymoon, we are not the kind of people to spend a lot of money on a fancy hotel room with all sorts of amenities ... we planned on being out and about on the island, and just needed a place to crash. Eventually, it was even better than that, with the comfortable bed, nice TV, kitchenette, and balcony. Our view wasn't the best (city view), but it seemed like there was a very nice view of the Ala Wai Canal if you wanted to pay a little more. We enjoyed eating, talking, and reading the Honolulu Advertiser (delivered every morning!) out on our "lanai". The bathroom wasn't stocked to the nines, but it had your basic toiletries. The bathroom was a good comfortable size and didn't feel tight at all. The shower ran nicely as well. No complaints there.Our kitchenette had a microwave, mini stove, BIG refrigerator, and plenty of cabinet space - which to my surprise was stocked with dishes of every size and plenty of utensils. I don't know why this surprised me, but it was very cool to have everything right there. The sink was also a trash compactor, which I didn't know how to use, so I didn't bother it.The room had two double beds, a desk with chair, a dining table with chairs, and a nice dresser to put our clothes in. Plenty of closet space if we had needed it. One morning, I went down to ask a question about where I might find a certain celebrity fitness trainer (Gilad Janklowicz) ... if anyone knew his gym. The clerk looked up the address on the internet, pointed me in the right direction, and I met him that very same day. I would've had no idea without the desk clerk - he was so helpful and nice!So the best part about Ilima is definitely the customer service. Not only do they greet you everytime you come in and out - and we did A LOT - they really seem to mean it. On Friday mornings in the lobby, the serenade the guests with real Hawaiian music courtesy the staff and the Ilima Chorus, with a ukelele to boot! It really brought Hawaii home for me, as we hadn't really done any cultural things yet. It was beautiful music and even now I can't get it out of my head.The location is pretty great - it's off the main roads towards the back of the Waikiki area, near the Ala Wai Canal. But it's the perfect setting if you like the sightseeing and shopping of Waikiki but don't want to be smack in the middle of it - because the area can get pretty loud at night, especially on the weekends. The road may look a little sketchy because it's not on the main strip, but we loved how it was off in the corner, next to a nice, neighborhood bar - no rambunctious drinkers were out.The hotel pool is nice, although on the small side. It's not too chlorinated, and while it's not heated, it'll feel relaxing in the heat of Hawaii. On that note, the air conditioning in the room is great; temperature control is a cinch. Although you need the a/c over there, a nice thing about the island was it never felt humid. As soon as you stepped into the shade, it felt better. Back home in Ohio, it's so muggy and gravity just feels heavier here. Not so on Oahu.The only people I would not recommend this hotel to are people that want luxury - these rooms are a little outdated, but clean. They are not frilly and I don't know if they have a jacuzzi suite or not. You can order delivery from pizza places and the like, but there is no room service. But if you and your family (they have large suites) just need a headquarters in Waikiki, look no further than Ilima!Oh, and P.S.! This hotel offers free parking, first come, first serve - and you are DIRECTLY across from Enterprise Rental, which is where we rented our car - very friendly and good prices! It's a great combo!

We stayed a total of 5 nights here and it was the best decision! The rooms are former condos, and we got a studio on the 11th floor, so we had a huge room that fit a king bed, a double bed, a desk, a small dining table, and a dresser quite comfortably. There was also plenty of storage, and a laundry basket for washing clothes. The washers were only $1 - cheaper than at home - and soap was avail at the front desk for another $1. :) It was ocean-view, but I could only see a smidge of the ocean. It was OK though, because at night the lights of the hotels nearby was quite mezmerizing. I slept with the shades open every night. See my photos for the view. The room was clean, the water was hot - the water heater was just in the closet - and the staff was very helpful. Because the hotel is 2 blocks from the beach, it was quiet enough to sleep, but not so far away that you felt removed from the life happening on the beach. Free parking, free internet, full kitchen, and a safe. Also, there was a great bar just outside that served $2.50 mai tais, and an awesome bakery 1 block over where we ate breakfast every morning. I would TOTALLY stay here again.

What an incredible find this hotel is. The price to stay was amazing. The staff are very polite, courteous and friendly. The authenticity and quality of service is outstanding. We rented a car to drive around Oahu and the free parking was a total bonus. The room we stayed in was clean, quiet, comfortable, spacious and perfectly adequate. The bed was a little on the firm side for me and the pool is very small. I stayed with my 5 year old so a bigger pool would have been nice. Other than that I thought the Ilima is a perfect choice. I would definitely stay again and again.

Upon first glance, the room appears old, but then you realize just how clean everything is, which is the important thing.We are vegetarian and enjoyed cooking simple meals in our room as there isn't a lot of vegetarian cuisine in Waikiki. Our kitchen was very clean and we had all the cooking utensils and pots and pans we needed. The grocery store is a very quick walk from the hotel. We asked the front staff and they told us exactly where to find it.The rooms are very large, and the lanai is nice to sit on every morning with the complimentary paper and a cup of coffee. The bedding itself was soft and clean and inviting, but the mattresses were quite hard! I started the week with a sore back, and my husband ended the week with a sore back, but, overall, it wasn't a big issue for us.We loved our shower, and the bathrooms were spotless. I actually found the towels to be thick, very clean and fairly soft. The location is very good. Close to the beach and shopping, and just off the main street you catch the public bus to visit sights. The street behind the Ilima borders the canal and is nice for a stroll. I just can't imagine paying double or triple more to be at the beach front when we all use the same beach....but I suppose different people want different things out of a vacation. The beach front locations do have lovely pool areas that you can lounge around, which I might have liked...but definitely not for the price!I don't think I'll personally ever stay in Waikiki again (just personal preference) but I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to others! We're budget minded travelers, but we still expect safety and cleanliness...which you will find at the Ilima!

I found this hotel through tripadvisor and was nervous about booking the hotel, which I did direct with them over the internet. However, the hotel was quick to respond and very helpful in dealing with all of my e-mails and when we arrived (midnight) the staff were all very helpful and throughout our holiday they contributed to the fantastic time we had in Hawaii. If you want an expensive hotel on the beachfront accommodating hundreds of guests, most of which who don't want children around, and with services on offer which you hardly ever use, then don't book the Ilima. However, if you want a nice friendly hotel with large rooms, good location (albeit not beach front), and all of the basic facilities which you need from a hotel, go to the Ilima. We had a superior twin room (803) and whilst this was on the side of the hotel we did have a good view of the Canal, Golf Course and mountains behind to our right (the view was other hotels looking straight ahead on the lanai, but Waikiki is a large city afterall). As there were 5 of us (myself, my wife and seven year old Triplet's) it was very difficult to find somewhere in Oahu to accommodate all of us. However, the Ilima had two bedrooms, one with a double bed and one with twin beds, plus a large pull down double bed in the living room (conveniently stored in a wardrobe), plus a further sofa-bed in the living room, which were more than enough to accommodate us all. The room had full kitchen facilities, which were dated, but it was convenient for breakfast and snacks. (we ate out every night so didn't really need the kitchen facilities). There were laundry facilites on the third floor and the room had a TV, (which we didn't use) and free internet connection, plus free wi-fi connection in the lobby, if you can't leave your computer at home. The pool was small and a bit shaded on occasions, but my three children loved it as it was big enough for them to swim in and also safe for us to supervise them (no life guard) and very warm. The hotels location was two blocks from the beach (about a 5-6 minute walk) and convenient for all of the restaurants which are close to hand. Overall, we had a great time at the Ilima and would have no hesitation in returning there if we were ever lucky enough to return to Hawaii.

I will begin by saying that their free parking is a rare and much-appreciated find in Hololulu. Spaces in the parking lot were quite small, but manageable. Now, about the hotel itself. If you are a Hilton or Sheraton kind of person, this place is definitely not for you. Yes, the rooms are large, but they are also old. The kitchenette seemed grimy and had much-used appliances. The most telltale sign was the bathroom towels - they were stringy, hard, and much-washed. They reminded me of hospital towels (their appearance makes you question what they were used for in the past). In fairness, the staff was pleasant and the Ilima's location was good. They had free internet and the rooms all have a small balcony. There is a pool, but it is extremely small and uninviting. It would be a good place to stay if you were in Honolulu for one night only. However, if this is your 'once a year' vacation, then I strongly suggest investing a bit more money for something more worthwhile.

We booked here based on the Trip Advisor reviews and weren't disappointed. Yes, the hotel is a bit dated but so what? It is super clean, the staff is helpful and friendly, and the street is quiet by Waikiki standards. We will absolutely stay here again if we're lucky enough to come back to Waikiki!

I stay at the Ilima about 4-6 times a year when I travel to Honolulu on business. The staff is invariably accomodating, the rooms clean and very spacious--if a little dated--and of course the location is great, off the main drag but near enough to walk just about anywhere in Waikiki. The kitchen is nice to have if you're staying more than a couple of days, and the free parking is a real value--but limited spaces may make parking difficult after early evening. It'd be nice to see room decor updated, bigger television sets, a couple of other things, but as this is one of Hawaii's last family-owned hotels, so I understand if it takes them longer to be able to afford to make such improvements.The property's biggest plus is its people, who almost without exception are friendly, helpful, and knowledgeble. The general manager has been with the hotel for more than 20 years and seems to have a knack for attracting motivated staff who genuinely enjoy their jobs--not an easy task given all the flashy competition and the difficult economy. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for value over luxury, convenience over brand name, and a truly Hawiian experience over a generic resort atmosphere. Book a room facing the mountains for the best breezes and views.Note that the hotel has only a tiny pool that gets more shade than sun, and there is no in-house restaurant. However, two large sun decks on the 10th floor get great exposure in the afternoon, and Kuhio Avenue, with its restaurants, coffee shops, and access to public transportation, is only a block away. When the limited free parking fills up, neighborhood parking may be hard to find--ask the front desk for advice.

My mother and I stayed for 3 days earlier this month. Based on a prior guest's recommendation on Trip Advisor, we requested a room with a mountain view. The room was huge with two large beds and the price was very reasonable. It included a kitchenette, a convenience which we enjoyed tremendously. The room decor is a bit dated but nonetheless charming. The staff were very friendly and helpful and seem to take a lot of pride in their hotel. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

We are just completing 7 days at the Ilima Hotel... we were looking for a good sized room (three traveling friends), and chanced upon the Ilima Hotel... their website offered excellent deals that did not show up on Orbitz, Travelocity, etc.This review is based on Room 1202, I requested a higher floot facing ther mountains (suggested by other trip advisor users)The room was very roomy, very good sized lanai (balcony), a full kitchen (though slightly dated), updated bathroom, and very clean room... all 3 of us (1 male, 2 females) agreed the hotel was excellent .Check-in was very easy and friendly.... we really had no other interaction with the staff, because we really had no complaints, but they would almost always greet us with an "Aloha" when entering the front lobby.Our rate for the Superior Studio (1 double and 1 California King Bed) was $115, and the room was very roomy.... there was plenty of space, I have stayed at other hotels that are crowded out with 2 beds, not the case here.It's a 10 minute walk to the beach, but just a couple of minutes to many bars/restaurants.Great place!

My husband and I stayed here when we first moved to Oahu. It was recommended b/c it was close to work and had laundry facilities, a kitchenette in every room and more like a very small condo. Overall, the hotel was very dated, but was good for the price. Our room had a great balcony and we could see the fireworks that went off on Friday nights.We stayed here for almost two months and the hotel staff at the front desk was always helpful. The only issue I ever had was with parking (if you don't park before 7pm most nights, parking will run out) and some minor cat calling. I was packing up my vehicle on day when we found a place to live and two gentleman on break were smoking in the garage and cat called me. I did contact the hotel manager who attempted to return my calls, but always called when I specifically told him I was at work or unavailable. So we never actually spoke about the incident. I am still minorly upset about this issue b/c I felt he did not care to remedy the situation. My husband (who works in law enforcement) even went down to the front desk in his uniform to complain and nothing was ever done about it to our knowledge.Aside from the lack of parking after 7 p.m., the parking slots are also VERY tiny so if you rent a car, do not get a bigger vehicle or a Sebring Convertible. There were also some mornings where staff of the hotel would double park vans so when I had to get my car out for work, I would have to notifiy the front desk.Overall, my experience with this hotel was good and I would recommend it with slight cautions. The front desk staff, again, was amazing, and you can not beat the location of being 3 blocks from the beach. That was by far the best part of hotel. The pool was closed for a period of time during our stay, so I did not use that facility, but the exercise equipment was not that desireable. I would recommend this hotel for anyone coming to Oahu on a budget and wants to be walking distance from shopping, restaurants and the beach.

We stayed at the I'lima Hotel for the final 2 nights of a week long Hawaii vacation. Our purpose was to meet my parents, and spend time visiting family friends and doing a little sightseeing. My parents always stay at the I'lima (they are budget-minded and like the free parking). We booked a 1-bedroom suite, and liked the spacious rooms, and well-equipped kitchen. The views were mostly of other buildings, but we could see parts of the Ala Wai canal and Manoa Valley. We liked the location - walking distance to the beach, many restaurants, shopping, and the Ala Wai canal. Parking spaces were very small, but we appreciated the free parking. We didn't get a chance to use the pool, but my husband used the exercise bike, and we enjoyed jogging along the canal every morning. The staff were very helpful and friendly, and we never had to wait for the elevators. One note of caution - we were there on Halloween, and didn't realize how wild and crazy things got in Waikiki, especially along Kalakaua Ave. Thousands of people in costumes, loud music, drinking, traffic jams - beware! Overall, we enjoyed our short stay at the I'lima.

The Ilima hotel is a very affordable, older hotel in the heart of Waikiki. While it doesn’t have many of the features of newer hotels (spas, a gym, etc) you are still in Hawaii; why do you want to stay in the hotel? The room itself is spacious, with a full kitchenette (fridge, stove, microwave and sink) as well as a small dining room area with a table and four chairs. From a practical view, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was full-sized. We enjoyed lounging on the balcony, although because of the location of the hotel, the view was of the surrounding neighborhood, not the beach. However, a two block walk took us right to the water, so this didn’t seem like much of an inconvenience. For us, a big selling point was the free parking offered by the hotel. Parking costs upwards of $20 a day at most hotels, so this was an excellent opportunity to save that money for something fun. I would caution that there are limited free spots in the garage & that it may be more full during peak times. We never had a problem, even when we came in late at night. It is very tight in the garage, so smaller cars are easier to park. The staff at the hotel was very gracious and helpful, extending our stay when we weren’t ready to leave & finding directions for us to drive to several locations. Overall, for the price this hotel is hard to beat!

I stayed at the Ilima for 8 nights in a studio superior room with my husband because of all of the positive reviews we read. We stayed in room 901, which had a beautiful view of the mountains, the Ala Wai Canal and the Ala Wai golf course. This hotel is a great value for $115/night with the 5th night free! I'd highly recommend this room because of the view. Plus, it was very quiet- street noise was not a problem with the balcony door closed. The room was impeccably clean. Make sure you request a mountain view when making your reservation because some rooms only have views of the street and other buildings. Noise might be a problem on lower floors, but it wasn't an issue on the 9th floor. I was extremely surprised to read some other reviewers complain about rude staff because every staff member I encountered during my stay was very friendly and helpful! One staff member offered to lend me a beach umbrella for the week when I inquired about where to buy one. Another staff member suggested a great alternative to the nearby expensive supermarket and gave us detailed directions. The location (10-minute walk to Waikiki beach) was fantastic. The pool was very warm, but refreshing in the evenings when it was a bit cooler outside. The lobby is very pleasant and attractive. I highly recommend this hotel for budget conscious travelers who do not require room service, concierge services, etc. Save your money and stay at the Ilima! This is a hidden jewel!

The last two days of our Hawaiian holiday were spent here and we couldn't have chosen better. Having the car park was great, nearness to the shops and restaurants was a bonus, the rooms were large and comfortable and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Would always try and stay here, if I ever have the chance to go back

I picked this hotel from reviews I read here, and they are spot on. The location is great, with a small grocery 3 blocks away so one can take advantage of the kitchen facilities. The room is spacious (much bigger than our company-paid room for the other half of our trip at twice the price). The firm beds took a little getting used to, but were fine. The extras like the chocolate-covered macadamia nuts for check-in and the shell leis at check-out were nice. When we arrived Friday morning during the sing-along, we were still able to check in, and although our room wasn't ready yet, we were still able to get towels from the desk and go to the beach. The free parking in the small garage was never a problem, although we did make it a point to be there by late afternoon and do our evenings on foot. The safe was big enough for the laptop. The only minor disappointment was that the pool was closed for repairs when we were there, but these things happen. I would go back again, and heartily recommend it to anyone with kids. If you want valet parking, spas, onsite gourmet meals, etc. go elsewhere. Check the hotel's website (and keep checking back) for great deals.

We've been to Waikiki several times and stayed in a few different hotels, but this is one hotel that we would love to go back to.The hotel is located about two blocks from Waikiki beach, off of Kuhio Avenue, where there are tons of restaurants! Upon checking in, they gave us Hawaiian cookies. That was nice. Our studio room was nice, clean, and very spacious, especially for our family of 4, which included 2 young kids. We liked the free parking, and if you come back early enough, there wasn't a problem getting a spot. My husband had difficulty one night finding a spot and he simply parked on the street. The bathrooms were modern, the beds were comfy. They had coin operated washers and dryers, and sold detergent for a nominal fee. The rooms had kitchens with a full size fridge which was convenient. With all the restaurants surrounding us, we never cooked. The hotel offered beach towels and beach mats, which is a nice touch. They also gave us newspapers every day. Upon check out, we each received a shell lei.We got a great rate off of the website. I thought it was great value, a nice place, and an extremely convenient location.

If you're looking for a boutique hotel or 5 stars with room service and a restaurant, keep looking. The Ilima is a nice spacious studio with everything that an independent traveler needs. The rooms are simple and clean with a generic décor and firmly comfortable beds. With a fridge, microwave, stove, pots, pans, coffee maker and coffee the only thing you need is your own food. There's a coin operated laundry room on the property. The hotel staff seems to work hard to keep things in good order. There was a problem with an appliance in my room and it was fixed immediately. There is a small pool and dry sauna. Parking is free and I never had a problem finding a spot. All of the staff were cheerful, knowledgeable and professional and it made for a pleasant stay. Thanks Ilima.

We had a quick two-night stay at the Ilima to see Pearl Harbor and recover from the jet lag before continuing our trip. Friendly and knowledgeable staff, clean and comfortable room (we had 3 adults and 2 children in a 2 bedroom suite with kitchen) good location (a block from the bus to Pearl Harbor) with the International Marketplace, Waikiki Beach and several good restaurants close by. It was a pleasant start to our vacation.

Took my parents on their first Hawaii trip, the Ilima Hotel was definitely one of the best value for money accommodation in the Waikiki area! Only 2 blocks away from the Waikiki beach and international market place, perfect for relaxing walks along the beach or in the street and browse through all the shopping highlights in Waikiki. We rented a car for our trip, although the Hotel advises "complimentary parkings are limited" during the 8 nights we stayed there, we had no trouble parking in the hotel at all. Checking in was fast and easy and done by helpful staff. We got a studio room on the 15th floor with awesome views to the ocean afar, and nearby hotels and Kuhio ave. Room was huge compared to standard hotels, beds were comfortable, comes with full kitchen if you prefer to do some cooking, everything was very tidy and clean. Most rooms were non-smoking rooms which were great. Complimentary hi speed internet was a big bonus too. The staff in the hotel are always polite and helpful, we had some problem with the stove on the day we checked in, after calling front desk we were attended by someone within 20 minutes, and he quickly fixed up everything for us. Maid services and newspaper were provided daily, it's good to come back to the same tidy clean room everyday. (as I have read on some serviced apartments' websites, maid services are only provided after check out, also they charge you a cleaning fee) If you are heading to the beach, the hotel front desk has complimentary beach mat and towels. Most staff were able to help with trip ideas and suggest attractions according to your requirement.Overall we had a very pleasant stay at the Ilima Hotel and will definitely consider staying there on the next trip!

Stayed in room 909 (from previous guest recommendation since we are smokers) and we loved it..Large rooms and comfortable beds with a full kitchen and large refridgerator..Kid friendly..Kind and helpful staff..Jack in the box around the corner and Macdonalds across and down the street..Perry;s 3 blocks down is worth the buffet price for picky kids and the Galaxy across from starbucks had a good $3.50 breakfast..The small TV was hard to get going and I did see only "one" roach by the front door. Nice small pool and they will provide matts and towels for the walk through the International market on Dukes Lane to the beach..We did not rent a car but parking was free and the BUS was down @ the corner. We felt safe walking @ night. The only problems we had were calling Waikiki Shuttle (also knows as Kahula five star). We took a bus to the Capitol and the bus drivers were rude and did not help us with where to get off and we got lost and spent a lot of time..We thought the 1 1/2 hour Bus ride to the Arizona would take too long but this shuttle drove around Waikiki hotels for 45 minutes and then took people to the airport (the ad only mentioned the arizona and the Swap meet)...The driver was very rude.. ..We were forced to pay round trip and though they advertise a shuttle every 30 minutes, we waited 1 hr and 10 minutes..I called twice and was screamed @ and hung up on...($24 for 3 people)..Several Buses left and we made a mistake with this as it took 2 hours to get there and 2 hours to get back...Also, we wanted to surprise My Granddaughter with a limosine back to the airport and Honolulu Cab & limosines was a "no show" and we were forced to grab a cab for $40 at the last minute..We called several times and got voice mail. Beware of transportation problems, especially when you have kids. The zoo was not worth the price but the beaches and free hula show was great.. We had been to Germaines Luau 20 years ago and it was wonderful but this time the food was so bad, the 3 of us could not find anything we could eat and we did not like the atmosphere but I have never been to any of the other Luau's to compare it to..We had a wonderful time otherwise due to this hotel.

I can't recommend this place enough for those who do not require super swanky surroundings.I booked two rooms for May 25 to June 3, 2008 using their web specials and 5th night free promotions. Studio rooms were larger than most, and also included a full kitchen with cookware.The hotel is about a block from International Marketplace and two blocks (easy walk) to the beach.Beds were large and comfortable, rooms quieter than most (7th floor), though you do hear the trash trucks in the morning. Lots of closet space and full bath with tub/shower. Small balcony with room for two to enjoy morning coffee or paper. Housekeeping was friendly and efficient. Enjoyed the hotel staff choir on Friday morning. Free parking was icing on the cake.I called every hotel in Waikiki with rooms under $300. This was the ONLY one that had: a) late pool hours, b) pool over 4' deep, and c) warm (87 F) water. These were important to my mother. It was nice to return to the hotel after a full day on the town and still have time for a swim.The lobby was clean and inviting, though a bit chilly. There is a lot of active nightlife nearby, but that would be true for any hotel in Waikiki.

We stayed here for 5 days at the beginning of our honeymoon, May 19-24. I have to say the entire experience was wonderful, from booking to check out. We booked the room on their website while they were running a special, $125/night for the Deluxe room. The room was huge, with a King sized bed AND an additional double bed, along with the kitchen, desk, and plenty of closet space.We requested a corner room on the 12th floor on the advice of another reviewer, and I received an email from the girl that does reservations asking me what kind of view I wanted (street view or canal view). I told her I wasn't sure, since I've never been there, but mentioned it was for our honeymoon. She was extremely friendly with her advice, and ended up giving us an amazing corner room with a mountain view. When we walked into our room after an excrutiating 10 hour flight, all I can say is it instantly erased our jet lag. The view was absolutely breathtaking. One whole side of the room was floor to ceiling glass. You can see the canal, the mountains, and at night, the beautiful twinkling lights of the city. Besides the great view and rock bottom prices, the hotel offers several amenities that ended up costing us dearly at the other 2 hotels we stayed at during our trip: free parking and free internet access. Not only that, but we didn't realize how handy it was to have a full kitchen. We were able to keep a full case of bottled water and some milk and cereal on hand for early mornings. It's just little ways to save money that really add up in the end. The on-site laundry facilities were very helpful as well. The location is extremely convenient, within walking distance of practically everything.As honeymooners, we picked 3 different locations for the duration of our trip: the Ilima to start, followed by a mid-range resort on the Big Island, then a high-end resort for our last 2 days in Oahu. We actually enjoyed the Ilima the best out of all of them. It's very private and quiet, which was great for us. We always had the pool to ourselves, which was nice because we really enjoyed taking dips at night after spending the day site seeing. We had a lot more opportunity for private, romantic moments at the Ilima than we did at the other resorts that were always brimming with families and other couples.

We spent 5 nights at the Ilima Hotel. We were looking for an affordable hotel near Waikiki beach, which is challenging. We were also looking for a room with some space as we were traveling with our 5-year-old. The Ilima fit the bill. We got a great AAA rate. The room was very big for the Waikiki area and had a fully-equipped kitchenette area. It is an older property and some areas are showing it's age. The room itself was clean and updated but not fancy. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom looked recently remodeled with newer fixtures. The property's pool is small and was a bit disappointing. The pool area is also shaded and drafty so a hot tub would have been nice. (We had also just arrived from the Westin Maui, which was downright opulent but twice as expensive, so this did kind of skew our perspective). We appreciated the on-site free parking and the on-site self-serve laundry facilities.

I'm kind of shocked to read all the great reviews of this hotel. It was an inexpensive hotel for the area yes, but grungy and worn. The bed was very uncomfortable. Maybe people are happy not to see bugs or whatnot, but nothing really great to relay about this place.

Stayed at the Ilima for three nights - one night in January and two nights in February. Our plabe arrived quite early - 7am and we arrived at the Ilima at about 8.30am after quite a long shuttle ride. Even though check-in time was 3pm the friendly staff at the desk made a room available and checked us in straight away. This was really appreciated after the flight from Sydney. The rooms are definitely above average in size with a small kitchen and a full size fridge. The room and bathroom were very clean and everything worked. We stayed in two different rooms, firstly on level 11 and then on level 5, both rooms were quiet. Another nice touch is that the reception area has some nice paintings.I'd recommend the Ilima to anyone who wants a hotel in a good location at a reasonable price especially if you plan to do some cooking whilst on holidays.

This modest hotel is only two blocks famous WaiKiKi beach. The smallest room was still huge with full kitchen, clean, slightly dated decor with a lot of pink. Free on-site parking, plesant staff. We found it to be a great value.

We had a condo reserved on the Windward side of the island and it turned out to be a high priced dump. We checked out and tried to find a hotel in Waikiki. We were very surprised when a room at this hotel was available. They showed us a room and quoted the rate and we were sold. Nice hotel, quiet, clean, people at the desk were very helpful and friendly. Nice balcony overlookig Waikiki. We would stay here again in a heartbeat if we visit Oahu again.

A terrific place to stay. We had a party of six, three rooms and spent 10 nights. Location is near the Ala Wai canal and about 2 1/2 blocks from the beach. The view of the mountains was awesome. Our rooms were the studio superior style and we had plenty of room. An older hotel so the rooms were not cramped like the newer hotels. The full kitchen was perfect.The staff was always attentive and helpful. You can tell that they are happy you are there. I had a number of questions before our trip and had sent them emails. I got a response within hours. I don't think I have ever been in a hotel this CLEAN. To a person they all said their rooms were immaculate. A great staff with that true hawaiian spirit.The Ilima Hotel does not have the usual restaurant and bar but you didn't need it. You are so close to everything you would ever want. They also provided free parking for our rented van. The Ilima Hotel may not wanted to be recognized for this but they DO NOT discriminate against SMOKERS like all the other hotels. They dedicate 2 floors for smokers. You can smoke in your room but we chose to smoke on the generous lanai only.I hope to go back soon and the Ilima Hotel will be where I stay.A ten out of ten. The Mallett's

We stayed at the Ilima Dec 4. thru Dec. 9. Because of Pearl Harbor Day and the Honolulu Marathon rooms were scarce. We followed a previous TripAdvisor post and requested the 14th floor with a mountain view and got room 1402, mountain view. We were very pleased with the room: a king and queen bed, kitchenette with range+oven, coffee maker, small breakfast table with two chairs, 6 foot X 12 foot lanai with two lawn chairs, free local phone and free parking. The bathroom had a full tub and shower. The room and public spaces in the hotel appeared to be very clean. This is not a brand new property with flawless paint and deep pile carpets, but it was large, comfortable, and well situated for any Waikki activity. We found the staff to be incredibly friendly and pleasant. We were told that this is a local hotel owned by the same family for many decades (not associated with the Ilima transportation group). If there was any negative in our stay it was that the little coffee packet is not replaced each day, you get one as a 'starter' for your stay and that's it.

walked in off the street in search of a quiet and comfortable room. friendly staff, extremely helpful, hassle free check in, room was spacious, clean, kitchenette was well appointed, nice view of the mountains (esp. with approaching Hurricane).what i particularly appreciated was the fact that besides the obligatory Bible in the bedside drawer there was also about the teachings of Buddha, yay!i cannot fault this hotel, it served my needs in every way in the most satisfactory manner, would definitely stay there again!

We have just stayed at the Ilima and thought it was great for what we needed. We upgraded our room from a studio to a one bedroom and were happy with what we were given. It was clean and well presented and had most things we needed during our stay. The daily maid service was great too. Its located just off the main Kuhio Road which means that getting on The Bus is really easy if you want to access other parts of the island. You do have to cross a couple of main roads to get to the beach - one of them being a main shopping street so you may feel odd walking there with all your beach stuff, but there are lots of others doing the same so its no big deal. The place does look like it needs updating but its purely cosmetic - its not dirty or anything. The backout blinds were helpful for us as we were travlling with an infant. The only donwside I would say is the very slow check in - after 20 hours travelling from the UK, it took ages!! It was 11.30pm by the time we got there and we would have just liked to have gone to our room but it was probably because there was some confusion over whether we wanted a cot or not. We also had to take our own luggage up - which was fine but some people might get annoyed at that. We took our own cot but they do have them but I think $10 a day is very steep where most other places this is free!The only other downer was that they suggested we use Ilima tours for airport pick up and drop off - not linked to them but reccomended. Pick up from the airport was ok - we did have to wait a while, but the drop off was a nightmare. We waited for 40 mins and they did not come and we got v stressed about getting our connection. The lady at reception was very helpful and called them many times but we ended up getting a cab at huge expense!. Im not sure why they reccomend them as it caused us alot of stress in getting our connection onwards. It would have been good to have had wirelss in our room also rather than the lobby but only a minor point. Definately reccomended for families or someone looking for somewhere to stay that is budget but clean and well located

Just finished a very nice vacation staying at the Ilima Hotel which is in a great location - an easy walk to Waikiki Beach and close to shops restaurants etc. Staff very pleasant and accommodating giving us very early access to our room which was great travelling with our 10 month old son. Room spacious and cooking facilities more than adequate - air con was fine. It's not the last word in luxury but you get what you pay for and the Ilima represents very good value for money. Would definitely stay there again.

Stayed here only one night. Check-in was a breeze and the front-desk staff were very helpful. Put me in a room with a view of the hiils. YES, the decor is all pink. Hotel is very conveniently located near Waikiki and the airport.Would stay here again.

We chose this hotel based on the reviews we read on this website. I had an easy time doing the online booking and also emails were answered promptly on inquires. We stayed 2 nights in end Sep 2007.Check in was a breeze, front desk staff are friendly and able to provide information/directions and eating recommendations. There are beach mats and beach towels available at the lobby, just ask from the front desk staff. This hotel is a” no fringe” place; there is no porter or room service. But the hotel location is safe, quiet and good; sits about two blocks away from the beach (less than 10 min walk), just a block away from International Market, quite centrally located in Waikiki district. There is a small pool, laundry room, free parking but the safe box is not free.Our family of 4 stayed in a two-bedroom suite, the lanai view overlooked the street while the bedrooms; one view is the same street, the other is the back of the hotel. My uncle/aunt unit was a studio also with a kitchenette and comes with full length sliding doors(comes with heavy black-out drapes) to their lanai which overlooked the canal, golf course and the mountains. Both units are fully aircon, but if you like fresh air, ilima’s strategic location gets excellent cross-breezes and so is well ventilated and fresh.Our 2 bedrooms unit has a large kitchenette, fridge, sitting/TV and lanai area. The kitchenette was fully stocked; kettle, coffee maker, pots, pans, toaster, plates and utensils. Everything was very clean. We used the stove to make breakfast and it was nice that bottled water was provided as well. Rooms are ok but the room doors had a bit of problems – one did not close properly or if you do so, it would required you to use quite a bit of strength to pull it open; the other closes easily but as the bathroom doors opens/closes next to it, the bedroom door will come unlatch from the vibrations. Also it was sometimes noisy for the room facing back of the hotel, as the windows was louvered type (noise is not from the regular traffic as the hotel is along a side street), I was awoken couple of times by the garbage truck making its rounds around the neighbourhood during the early morning wee hours. For my little girl this had no affect and she slept on quite well.My uncle/aunt’s studio was a very large unit too; I would say it was approximately the same size as our two-bedroom suite but minus the 2 bedrooms. Overall, everything was nice, clean and friendly. Next time, based on the room view and noise, I’ll go for 2 one-studio unit on the mountain side.Oh, if there are more than 2 people going to the airport, consider using the regular taxi/cab this hotel uses. I did for my family of 4, the taxi was a classy white limo driven by the Vietnamese boss; he was very friendly and charged like the regular taxi rates but unfortunately I’d lost his name card.

We stayed at the Ilima in July 07 and found the location to be fantastic. We were on the 6th floor in a 2 bedroom apartment and found it to be very clean and spacious. Our only disappointment was how noisy it was at night time. The windows are louvre type windows so it was quite difficult to shut out the noise. The pool area is very small, but quite nice. The staff were very friendly and most helpful and the apartment was serviced every day. I would recommend this hotel to others, but perhaps not in the very busy season, if noise was a problem.

We chose this hotel based on the reveiws we read on this website. Every review we read was positive and our personal experience was the same. The hotel was very clean, great location, good price. We were given a room with a wonderful view and found our stay to be very safe. The front desk were helpful and more than happy to give us directions to the various attractions and food stores, as well as extra teabags, sugar etc. The hotel has an excellent location--very short walking distance to the beach, international marketplace, is a one minute walk from the busroute and is on a sidestreet so it is less busy than the main road. We would definitely stay at this hotel again and would recommend others to do so as well--especially if you very picky about cleanliness and bugs etc.

The first thing you notice here is the pink decor, it's everywhere. But the rooms are huge (they have two double beds in each) and it's very tidy. The bathrooms are okay but the shower is poor.It is an easy walk from the beach and shopping areas. It's good value overall.

I and my family have stayed at the Ilima many times over the past 25 years, and would never consider staying anywhere else in Waikiki. In fact, some of my family are there as I write. I'm provoked to write this response by having read a review by a very young person from San Diego last September. I have trouble believing that review!! I cannot possibly imagine the events described as happening at the Ilima. We have always found the staff friendly and helpful, and the rooms spacious, clean, and quiet. I would advise anybody who hasn't been there to believe the other positive reviews.

ilima Hotel, is only 2 blocks from Waikiki., its a perfect location, near the best part of the beach ,everything is around, shopping, restaurants, bars.The rooms are very clean; we have a nice view of a golf court.Free internet and parking, the rooms have a full kitchetten and there is a7 eleven in the corner, and a big supermarket, only 2 blocks. If you are looking for a decent and nice place near waikiki, Ilima is a good choice. But is like a family hotel., dont expect a Hilton for the price you pay!But my husband and I where all day out, we have great service from Alan , he is the tour operator.We like Ilima for location, and for us ,that spend all day out, the refrigerator and stove where perfect ,before living to long day.we will be back!

The Ilima was a good find. We stayed there for 7 days at the beginning of Mar 07 and it was great. It's not a five star hotel, but you're not paying 5 star prices! We stayed in 702, which was a studio with a kitchenette that overlooked the canal and golf course. If you could get up a little higher, you'd have a better view. (there was a building partially blocking our view straight out). It was a very large, bright room with large lanai. Everything was very clean. The bathroom looked like it had recently been redone. Family travelling with us stayed in a two-bedroom suite (703). The view on that side overlooked the street, so you might want to try getting a 2 bedroom on the canal side. The staff was excellent, from front desk to housekeeping to the maintenance man who fixed my in-laws door because it shut too quickly for them! We arrived one hour before check in and didn't have to wait at all. Check in was a breeze (for the studio and 2 bedroom suite we had booked), and we were up in our rooms in about 5 minutes. I'm not sure what happened to that person that said it was smelly and unprofessional . . . I think they must have got it mixed up with another hotel!

My husband and I stayed here while we searched for housing since we were moving to Hawaii. This is a very clean hotel with kitchenettes and a laundry room. It has a small pool, and lanais on the upper floors where you can see Ala Wai Canal. We watched the outriggers canoe races here on Sundays and that was very nice. This place is really a do it yourself hotel. It does not have porters and no room service.However, the value is very good for a place to stay close to the beach and the shopping. The Island of Hawaii is now a non-smoking island now so the rooms should be losing the smoky smell that we experienced. It wasn't terrible but very noticable to people who do not smoke. Directly contact the hotel for the best rates.

This was a great choice for a family of four, we had the 1 bedroom suite and there was plenty of room. The bathroom was all new and very clean. Great kitchen with eating bar area. The view was about the same as everywhere concrete jungle, but no complaints since it is so overcrowded here. The staff was excellent and very friendly. They leave a gift basket that is free which was a nice touch along with orchids upon arrival. Location is the best because the beach hotels have so much traffic and you can use Ala Wai Rd. and bypass all of it. The only change I would make is some more comfortable beds unless you like hard matteresses!! Otherwise that would be it!! would love to come back to the ILIMA.

This was our second trip to the Ilima. This time was for our honeymoon and we received an upgrade and a lovely present! The Ilima is a great place to stay - 5 minutes' walk to the beach, close to everything, very quiet, friendly service etc. It is very well priced. Phil Sammer, the GM, is a lovely guy and obviously treats his staff well.We will definitely return to the Ilima!Michael Brisbane AUSTRALIA

This hotel was a GREAT find! Good price, great location (just 1 1/2 blocks from the beach), and lots of extra amenities -- in-room kitchenettes, on-site laundry, FREE PARKING, and a friendly and helpful staff available 24/7. This hotel is not new, and not necessarily up-to-date, but they offer everything you need. The room is very clean, even if the carpet and bedspread are old. The bathroom is spacious and adequate. The little touches are nice, considering that they are just a basic hotel (orchids on check-in day, filled ice cube trays in the freezer, and pitcher of cold water in the fridge,...). The room is huge, and I got the smallest room they had. The building is very safe and (did I say this already?) very clean.The pool is teensy, but you don't go to Waikiki to swim in a swimming pool.Highly recommended. I will stay there again.

My husband and I stayed at the Ilima the last two nights of our honeymoon while we explored Honolulu. We were impressed with the friendliness of the staff from the moment we checked in until we checked out. The room was not luxurious, nor were we expecting it to be, but it was clean, very spacious and had a great view. We had absolutely no complaints about the Ilima and would stay there again if we were looking for a reasonably priced place to stay near the Waikiki Beach area.

Great location!! It's only 1/2 block from the backside of International Marketplace. Ask for Room 909. It's a corner unit overlooking Ala Wai Canal and the golf course. The room is spacious, clean, has a balcony....and free parking. The one negative thing was that the swimming pool water was too warm. I'll give it a B+ rating....just don't expect a 5-star hotel.

I booked with this hotel due to mostly positive feedback from this website. However, when I went to the actual hotel I was in for a big surprise...I arrived at 4pm (1 hour after the guaranteed check in time at 3pm). Upon checking in at the reception counter, I was informed that our room was not ready and would not be so for an hour. I was not bothered too much by this as I am sure it may happen everywhere but I was a little put off that they didn't offer an explanation or an apology just a "oh, it's not ready, come back in an hour or so". A nice little bit of unprofessionalism to start off my stay! So. My wife and I decided to just go walk around Waikiki in the meantime. We arrive back at the Ilima almost a full two hours later figuring we'd be able to get into our room. The answer? "It's still not ready. Just have a seat and we'll tell you". I was starting to get very irritated at the fact that it was like 6pm and we were stranded in their lobby. Finally, a full 30 minutes later we are informed the room is ready.We booked for a deluxe one bedroom suite (for $283 a night) and when we got up there, we were appalled. The bathtub was rusty and stained and the whole entire bathroom was obviously not kept up. The bed sheets had stains....STAINS of I don't even want to know. The comforter (if you can call it that) on our lumpy bed had small cigarettes wholes all over it and our room smelled like cigarette as well. Overall, the room, furniture, carpet and curtains were very outdated, rundown and NOT CLEAN. This place was a nightmare! We had booked the DELUXE one bedroom suite because we did not want to make the mistake of booking a regular studio room and having a rundown little room. Apparently at this hotel it didn't matter. We immediatly contacted the front desk and politely informed them of our concerns and asked if they may another a different room of the same category they may have. The girl on the other end was very rude and said that since we "checked in so late" that there was only one other room in our category we could look at. This "new" room was more of the same!! My wife and I immediatly set out to look for a new hotel because we were not going suffer for the next 9 nights!After about 2 hours of searching we finally found a much nicer place with new, clean and beautiful rooms at the Aqua Palms. The kicker? We were only going to be paying $150 a night for a much much nicer room at the Aqua Palms.The next morning when we were checking, the girl working at the reception desk made the remark that if we wanted a "quality room we should have booked the penthouse"!!!!! Based on my stay here, I am under the impression that the staff must be writing the reviews to this site because I honestly have no idea how this hotel has a good reputation!! Anyway, I do have one positive thing to say about the hotel: The check out was very fast! It took about 3 minutes.I would never return to stay here nor would I recommend this place to anyone.

We stayed here four nights. Book online to get best rates. Upper floors offer great views (ask for mountain view). large fridge, microwave, coffee maker, and stove..didn't use stove..staff was fantastic and always welcoming..location two and half blocks from beach..much quieter than main street area..don't use Ilima Transportation from airport (different company same name, I think) used Ohana to return to airport and got personal great service for $7 pp. Ilima was $9 pp and had to stop everywhere else first (4-5 other hotels)..everything spotless (bathroom very clean and plenty of hot water) had double and king bed so plenty of sleeping space...extra blankets and pillows in drawers...tv ok but could use more channels such as ESPN2 and Weather Channel...great lanai offering great views..laundry room on 3rd floor (didn't use but saw people using--think it's 75 cents a load)...great restaurant around corner called Seaside Bar & Grill-good specials and in Delta Dining program...Cappucinos on Lewers in Waikiki Joy is great little Japanese restaurant with lots of food for money (also in Delta Dining program)..highly recommend Ilima Hotel for families, individuals, couples, etc..clean, safe, convenient to everything but not noisy, crowded area. I can't think of anything negative to say unless you want to be on beach with 24 hours of traffic and lots of overpriced hotels!!!

After arriving at Honolulu airport with no hotel booking & ringing about 20 hotels that were all full, the Ilima hotel had a room. This hotel is amazing with super friendly staff & excellent location. It is just down from the international market place. It is only a 5-7min walk to waikiki beach & close to everything else. The 1 small downside may be a small pool with not much sun. We had a 3night stay here from Sat 12Aug'06. The rooms were huge & clean & we could see some ocean too. We had a kitchenette which was great for making our own b/fast. Would be very happy to stay here again. Highly recommended!

Having had a good experience in the past with the Ilima, my wife and I returned there this year for our honeymoon, on the front and back ends of a cruise. We stayed in one of the cheaper rooms (studio), but the room was very spacious and airy. The staff is friendly, and I recognized the same people who we met during our last stay.There were a couple elements of our stay that were not as good:1. Noise: If you are not used to the city and city sounds, it may not be easy for you to drill out the sounds that many city dwellers are used to (traffic, the "beep beep" backup sounds of dumpsters being emptied, and so on. In addition, the airiness of the open-air hallways create a strong draft which causes doors to slam if you're not careful. During our stay, we had some very inconsiderate neighbors who continually went in and out of their door, letting it slam very hard behind them. (At 8AM on vacation, that was annoying).2. Parking: The parking garage fills up quickly when the hotel is busy, but there is overflow parking. The spaces are very tight, and it is extremely easy for your car to get dinged (or worse) by another. If you're not used to small city parking garages, be aware of this. The parking is free, though, which is a great plus!On the positive side:1. You get excellent value for the money2. The older gentleman at the tour desk (when we saw him in the past) was very kind and knowledgeable enough3. The desk staff is very friendly and hospitable, particularly the ones who have worked there longer4. Our housekeeper was very sweet and thorough5. The hotel is an easy walk to the International Market (a bit farther to the beach, though)6. The room was very clean with a newer air conditioner (which we used very little). The kitchenette was fine for a short stay.I detected no funny smells that were referred to in a previous review. In fact, I would take the stairs instead of the elevator down, and it was clean all the way to the lobby. I would not call the Ilima luxurious, but it was clean, safe, comfortable, and reasonably priced, especially for Waikiki. We would definitely return there again.

Arrived late evening and staff was friendly and helpful. Deluxe studio spacious( 2 people),beds extremely comfortable. Nice view of canal-roomy lanai. Proximity to beach, shopping & restaurants was excellent. Parking a little tight, but usually a space . Would definitely stay here again!

My nephew and I enjoyed 5 1/2 days at the Ilima and were so pleased with the accomodations and staff. Everyone was so courteous, friendly and humerous. Our studio #1201 had a fantastic view of the Ala Wai and hills. My nephew enjoyed sitting outside and reading in the early morning.Our room was huge and extremely clean. I read all the previous write ups so we kept our bathroom articles in the large shelved closet outside the bathroom. We stored our empty luggage in the huge storage closet, used the plastic hangars (very nice extra) for wet swimsuits and hung on the shower rod and enjoyed the extra towels we requested each day.The beach mat and beach towels available in the lobby and the proximity to Jack in the Box and Denny's for late night snacks made everything so convenient.Courtni was wonderful to work with at www.ilima.com reservations and Markus, on the front desk, was a wealth of tourist information with a great sense of humor.There are 4 washer and dryers and it's only 75 cents per machine. We didn't use the pool, sauna or exercise room.... no time!The only negative is the narrow parking stalls and I had downgraded to a compact but next time I'm going for an economy car. I had difficulty parking.

We have stayed at the Ilima hotel numerous times, and have always found it to be worth returning to. On my first stay, and indeed late at night after a long day of travelling I hadnt been very pleased with my first impressions of the hotel rooms which looked less contemporary than the holiday inn type hotels I was used to. If you are looking for a holiday inn type of hotel, you probably will find this to be a slight disappointment. However, after a few days it was obvious that there were many advantages to this hotel. It is not very far from the beach and the shops, but yet far enough that it is quiet and never overly crowded. This is extremely beneficial when you do deal with the front desk or want to swim in the pool as you never need worry about it being too busy which in my books is an absolute treasure on a holiday. As some of the other reviews have pointed out, the pool is smaller than others you will see at surronding hotels, but the fact that you may well end up having the whole pool to yourself seems to much outweigh having a small section of a large one. The staff is friendly and helpful and we have never had any complaints with that area of the hotel. The one thing that I would warn anyone considering this hotel about, is that if you are planning on taking many bus tours, or shuttle services - prepare to be the first hotel of many to be picked up and the last to be dropped off. We learned very quickly that by staying at a smaller less known hotel, that you are low priority for pickups and drop offs, which needless to say can be extremely inconvienient after a long day and has led on occassion to us simply getting off 5 or 6 blocks away at another hotel just to be able to get back faster by walking. Otherwise, we definitely never even consider another hotel when we continue to visit Hawaii as we find the benefits to this hotel definitely outweigh the negatives.

This was our first stay at the Ilima hotel and were extremely pleased with our decision. After reading some of the reviews on this website, we started out a little unsure but after checking in and looking around, we quickly disregarded those reviews. The staff was so friendly and helpful and the place was spotless. Our studio room was much bigger than we expected and it came with a full kitchen! The patio was also well sized. With young kids (5 and 7), having a full size refrigerator and freezer really helped. The kitchen was fully stocked with pots, pans, toaster, plates and utensils. We used the stove to make breakfast and dinner right in our room. Free parking was available everyday and our kids especially loved the heated pool. One of the best assets of this hotel is their staff. Our light in the kitchen was acting funny and they fixed it without us even having to ask them. My son had to do some homework and the front desk helped us out by letting us borrow their Elmer's glue and well as sharpening our pencils for us. All in all, this was one of the best experiences we've had in Hawaii and with a price of only $88/night this definitely is the best kept secret in Waikiki!

A great, economical place to stay. We really enjoyed the kichenette and the view of the mountains and canal from the lanai. We saw several rainbows. The staff is very friendly. The only negative is that the pool is very small--not for lap swimming.Highly recommended.

I and my son and his family were in Honolulu for a Memorial Service, so it was important that accomodatons were good and located conveniently. The Ilima more than lived up to that. In the heart of Waikiki, you can walk anywhere. We always found parking although it was not guaranteed. The staff was terrific and the rooms immaculate. The "kitchen" was furnished with anything you would need (great for children) and grocery stores within 1/2 block. The best view is the mountains on 15th floor and above. I'll definitely stay there next time I go back. All I can add is a heartfelt mahalo (thank you) and aloha, Ann White, Southern California

We booked this hotel based on a lot of the reviews on this board, that was a mistake. We arrived around 3:00 p.m. after travelling almost 10 hours and were informed (not too politely)that our room was not ready. We should have left then and there but our room was paid for (over $200.00 per night) for the 11 nights we spent there. Everything in this hotel is worn and dated, the kitchen was very poorly equipped, the cups and plates were chipped and cracked and there were stains everywhere. Housekeeping was spotty and not all that great. The pool is a joke. The only good thing about the whole experience was the view, we looked over the canal and golf course which was nice.Last year we stayed at the Sunrise which was wonderful compared to the Ilima, we will never stay at the Ilima again nor would we recommend the place to anyone else.

I selected the Ilima after reading very nice reviews on Tripadvisor. I reserved the "penthouse" with high expectations. Boy was I disappointed. There were stains on the furniture, carpet, and lamp shades; mildew in the bathroom; water stains in the bathroom cabinets; peeling wallpaper in the bathrooms; and the door was difficult to open....frequently sticking. The air conditioner was very noisy. The hotel is old and, and the "penthouse" decor was outdated and not well kept. I wouldn't even walk around barefoot in the room. I would never stay there again. And, after this experience, I'll view any future reviews from this website with a lot of skepticism. What a dump!!!

Listen... I read the reviews on the Ilima and was more than concerned about some of the reports. Let me set the record straight! ( in my humble opinion ) The people who did not recommend the Ilima should just stay home! Or go ahead and spend $300 plus and stay in a 5 star hotel. Actually I am writing this from our hotel room as its our last night here :( but we are on a cruise tomorrow so don't feel to bad for us! The hotel is by far more than we expected. I even went to the stair well just a minute ago to take a 'smell'...smells like concrete to me. You know something? You can't please everybody and some you can't please at all. This is a great hotel, nice rooms, great balconies and great service! I will post pictures when we get back the first week in April 2006

We stayed 4 nights at the Ilima last month and had a wonderful stay. We had 2 adults and 2 kids in our party and stayed in a 1-bdr suite. Typically when we travel we stay in a 2-bdr so I was a little concerned we might feel cramped. Not at all; my husband and I were in the bedroom, our 6-yr-old slept on the hide-a-bed, and our 2 1/2-yr-old slept in his portacrib in the living room. The place was spacious and very comfortable. It wasn't the Ritz, but we don't go to the Ritz (nor were we paying for the Ritz). It was a great deal. Really quiet, too---only heard some small kids running in the hall once. Never heard footsteps thudding from above, etc. Great housekeeping service. The room had excellent cross-breezes so was well-ventilated and fresh. Slept with the fan on so never heard any city noise at night. Pool was heated and, although small, perfectly adequate. Very friendly staff. Ample free parking. We walked everywhere---beach looks far-ish on a map, but even with kids, stroller, beach paraphernalia, etc it was no trouble at all to walk down there. What's not to love?

We stayed at the Ilima for 8 nights in January, 2006. We arrived a full 39 hours late, due to snow in Tokyo, but the hotel did not make us pay for the first night that we weren't there. They even let us stay for an extra night, at the same very low rate. The hotel was great; lots of space, clean, very central to everything in Waikiki, but very quiet too.Will definitely stay there again !

When you think of Hawaii you also think of warmweather, friendly people, bright blue skies.N O T.My stay at the Ilima Hotel located in Waikiki on theisland of Oahu, left me with cold chills up my spine,rude and uncaring employees, and a dark memory ofa vacation gone bad due to the lack of professionalismon the part of a terrible hotel staff.Starting with the hotel general manager,(if you can call him that) who had no interest or concern for ourquestions regarding problems with our room.No one seemed to give a ---- at our discomfort or theissues we had presented to them. A take it, or leave it attitude.We checked out and found another hotel where thestaff was helpful and friendly.Don't waste your money and time.Never stay at the Ilima Hotel Waikiki.P.S. We have filed a complaint with the BBB aboutthe Ilima Hotel.

After reading all the glowing reviews about Ilima Hotel, I decided to book my family there for 4d/3n last December. I had an easy time doing the online booking. The staff answered my inquiries (via e-mail) promptly.The people at Ilima are mostly friendly and accommodating. The rooms are big and the kitchenette was fully equipped.However, we experienced some unexpected "unpleasantness" with the hotel.First, there was no porter. After traveling on a plane for 18 hours, we were exhausted (especially since we have a toddler with us). It was a shock to see that there was no one to help us with the luggages. My poor husband who has a slipped disc had to carry all 6 luggages to the lobby, put them in a cart, then bring them up to our room. Then he has to bring back the cart to the lobby. I've had my share of 2 to 3 star hotels, but this is the first time I experienced this. No one among the staff offered to help my husband.Second, there are no designated non-smoking rooms. What they have are "smoke-cleared" rooms. I specifically mentioned in my booking that I have asthma and to please make sure that the room that was assigned to us doesn't smell of smoke. The room that was given to us smelled like an ashtray. Of course I complained to the front desk and to be fair, they were accommodating and transferred us to a nicer smelling room. But we had to wait for like an hour in the old room since they were still prepping up the new room.Third, the stairway smells of urine. We used the stairs to go one floor up to my brother's room and it stank of urine. My mother refused to use the stairway after that.Overall, the friendliness of the staff cannot compensate with what I feel is a lack in basic services (i.e. porter) and unhygienic environment. We will definitely not go back to Ilima.

We stayed there in a one bedroom unit for four days. Spacious, clean, very nice newly renovated bathroom,( they know where to upgrade ) Two A/C units, both are old and had to be constantly on high to maintain the temp, wondering how it's going to hold up in the summer. Kitchen is adequately equipped for simple meals, afterall very few people spend much time in their kitchen when visiting Waikiki.Front staff very friendly, but couldn't solve a glitch in my statement when I was inadvertantly billed for three long distance calls I never made. Later on ( long after check out ) they apologized for something the computer did that put those calls from a year ago onto my room. I suggested to them that in the future they should slip the statement under the door the night before check out so guests have a chance to review rather than being caught by surprise at check out while a taxi is waiting.Overall, I am happy with this hotel and will go back again, but will pay attention to the A/C unit at check-in and take time before check-out to go over the statement. Parking is so tight that every guest should rent compact cars.

Being only 2 blocks away from the beach, with free parking, and a lovely view of the Canal, our spacious hotel room with kitchen amenities (stove, full fridge and micro) was very clean and spacious.Very close to where the action is, yet very quiet at night (we slept on the 5th floor). Staff was very friendly, helpful, and parking was always available.I am looking forward to my next stay!!! Thank you, Ilima!!!

The Staff at Ilima were very nice and helpful. Thank you Virginia for making it a great stay. Not a high end hotel and parking was a bit tight but otherwise the value and close proximity to Waikiki was great.

I stayed at the Ilima Hotel in April 2004. I recommend this hotel because you get a good deal for the money.The hotel is not very far from Waikiki Beach and you get a good view of the mountain scenery of Honolulu. The price is not very high and each of the rooms as a kitchen. In addition the hotel has its own webb site and toll-free reservation number.

If you want a nice, clean room at a reasonable cost in Waikiki this is your best bet.  Our family of three stayed at the Ilima for 7 nights in August, 2005. The final cost including Taxes was less than $1000.00 (AAA discount). We had a spacious condo-style unit on the 16th floor. There were two large beds, a round dining table with four chairs, a fully equiped kitchen, full sized refrigerator, good closet and drawer space, and a beautiful view.
